column11: साहित्यशास्त्रपरम्परायाम् अलङ्कारतत्वस्य समीक्षणम् ।
column13: यद्यपि आचार्याणां शब्दभिन्नेऽपि भावैक्यं वर्तते इत्यत्र नास्ति शङ्काकलङ्कावसरः। अलङ्कारस्तु शोभावर्धकः, चमत्कारोत्पादकः लौकिकशब्दार्थाभ्यां काव्यत्वस्य पृथक्कर्तृतया किञ्चन विलक्षणं तत्त्वं वर्ततेऽत्र नास्ति विमतिः। परञ्च ध्वनिवादिनः रसवादिनश्चान्ये, काव्ये अलङ्कारस्य अलौकिकतां पश्यन्नपि न पश्यन्तीत्यत्र मनश्चेखिद्यते। अतः यथाज्ञानमत्रालङ्कारस्योहायाः स्पष्टीकरणे अलङ्कारस्यालौकिकता समीक्षिता मया स्वकीये शोधपत्रे । मम्मटाचार्येण तत्र काव्यप्रकाशे "स्फुटालङ्कारविरहेऽपि न काव्यत्त्वहानिः" इति प्रतिपादितम्। अत्र 'अलङ्कारविरह' इति पदस्य नानाविधाः अर्थाः व्याख्याकारैः अनुमानिताः। तत्र च केचन विरहस्य नाम राहित्यमिति विभावयन्ति परञ्च तन्न साधु इत्यस्माकं द्रढीयान् विचारः। तत्कथमिति सर्वं मयाऽत्र शोधपत्रे यथाज्ञानं विस्तारितम्। वस्तुतः अलङ्कारस्य काव्यत्वमस्ति वा न वेति विचारः प्रतिपाद्य अलङ्कारस्य काव्यत्वं सुतरां साधनस्य प्रयासः अस्माभिः कृतः।

column11: REPRESENTATION OF MOON IN SANSKRIT LITERATURE; SPECIAL REFERANCE TO CHANDRAPIDACHARITA
column13: By analysing the whole Sanskrit literature, writers had given importance to the idea of symbolism. Symbolism in Indian art and aesthetics is a rich and complex way to convey meaning.Symbolism plays a pivotal role in Indian aesthetics, serving as a rich, multifaceted lens through which cultural and philosophical ideas are expressed.  By analysing prominent symbols such as the lotus, the swastika, and various deities, this study highlights how these symbols function as vehicles for conveying values, beliefs, and narratives central to Indian culture.  They evoke deeper emotions in a spectator. The portrayal of the moon is an important aspect in Sanskrit literature, as it evokes the emotions of love as well as separation. The moon is a potent symbol imbued with rich cultural and philosophical meanings. This abstract examines the various representations of the moon across classical Sanskrit texts, highlighting its multifaceted roles as a symbol of beauty, time, and cosmic order. Here the fact is analysed through a text named 'Candrāpīdacarita'.

column11: साहित्यशास्त्रपरम्परायाम् अलङ्कारतत्वस्य समीक्षणम् ।
column13: अलङ्क्रियतेऽनेनेति करणघञन्तोऽयं अपरोऽलङ्कारशब्दः काव्योत्कर्षाधायकतत्वेन प्रवर्तते। लौकिककाव्यजगति कामिनीनामवयवेषु कमनीयतोत्पादकाः कटकुण्डलादयः अलङ्काराः  प्रोच्यन्ते, अयञ्च लोकसङ्ग्रहीतः अलङ्कारशब्दः। यद्यपि आचार्याणां शब्दभिन्नेऽपि भावैक्यं वर्तते इत्यत्र नास्ति शङ्काकलङ्कावसरः। अलङ्कारस्तु शोभावर्धकः, चमत्कारोत्पादकः लौकिकशब्दार्थाभ्यां काव्यत्वस्य पृथक्कर्तृतया किञ्चन विलक्षणं तत्त्वं वर्ततेऽत्र नास्ति विमतिः। परञ्च ध्वनिवादिनः रसवादिनश्चान्ये, काव्ये अलङ्कारस्य अलौकिकतां पश्यन्नपि न पश्यन्तीत्यत्र मनश्चेखिद्यते। अतः यथाज्ञानमत्रालङ्कारस्योहायाः स्पष्टीकरणे अलङ्कारस्यालौकिकता समीक्षिता मया स्वकीये शोधपत्रे ।

column4: Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady
column11: Translation techniques of N.V.P Uṇittiri : Special reference to Khaṇḍakāvyas
column13:
An effect of modernity can be seen in Sanskrit literature as well as in the vernacular.  Western education and vernacular literature are in fact giving new life to Sanskrit.  A trend of translating literary works from vernacular languages into Sanskrit is widespread in India.  As a result, modern sensibility in classical Sanskrit has become a reality today.  The contributions of Kerala to the developing modern Sanskrit literature are many in the form of independent works and translations.  
N.V.P. Uṇittiri is one of the multilingual scholars who working hard to bring the important contributions of the Malayalam language to the modern Sanskrit readers.  
He translated the works of prominent Malayalam poets like Vaḷḷattōl, Kumāran Āśān, Eḍaśśēri, P. Kuñjirāman Nāir etc. and nurtured the tradition of Sanskrit translation. The present study is focusing on translation techniques of  Unithiri’s three major translations of prominent writers of Malayalam Khaṇḍakāvyas viz.

column11: Nature of Existence in Panchastikaya Sangraha
column13: NATURE OF EXISTENCE IN PAŃCĀSTIKĀYA SAṂGRAH

column11: The Utility of Logic in Nyayasutra
column13:
The Utility of Logic in Nyayasutra
The Nyaysutra originated on the basis of logical arguments and is one among the many Darsanas. The Darsanas came into being during the Vedic age itself but today the available sources of these Darsanas are the Sutra scriptures.  The Nyayasutra belongs to group of Astika Darsana as it accepts the Pramanya of Vedas. The purpose of Nyayasastra is to analyze the opinions on the basis of scientific aim. Besides this analysis it opines that the Atma is entirely different from the body and the real knowledge is that of Moksha. It even tries to establish that the Vedantic theories are authentic through Anumana Pramana, as it supports the tenets of Advaita Vedanta. The prominence of intelligence, the utility of senses and the functioning of mind is established by this Sastra.
The Veda Pramanya is established in the first chapter that to in the first diurnal portion. The Sabda does not have Pramanya. The book begins with the establishment of the Pramanya of Vedas by negating it. This is stated by Purvapakshas. तदप्रामाण्यम्-अनृतव्

column4: Institute of Vaishnava Studies, Gainesville, Florida, USA
column8: B. Tech - IIT (D), MBA - IIM (A), M. Th., Institute of Vaishnava Studies
column11: Cosmology the Puranas and the Surya Siddhanta
column13: The Siddhāntins’ primary text is the Sūrya Siddhānta. It deals with the Earth’s shape and size and the eclipses. The Purāṇas , are vast and include cosmologies, including those of the Sun and the Moon. The 8th-century astronomer Lalla first pointed out some disagreements relating to astronomy between the Paurāṇikas and the Siddhāntins, which were supported by the astronomer Bhāskara (12th century). Christopher Minkowski summarized the dispute in five parts relating to the Earth, eclipses and the Moon and dubbed it the virodha problem. The paper studies over a dozen Purāṇas to establish that they are, consistent with the Sūrya Siddhānta. The Sūrya Siddhānta is for scholars and contains numerous computations. The Purāṇas are for the layperson and use metaphors and storytelling to stay accessible to their audience. The paper unravels these narratives and metaphors and demonstrates, for example, that the Purāṇic Earth was of the correct shape and size. The Purāṇic texts also described continents such as Africa and the Americas. The paper should open a fresh perspective on the Puranas.

column11: Exploration of Essential Manuscripts on Guhyakālī at the National Archives, Kathmandu
column13:
This paper attempts to explore key manuscripts at the National Archives, Kathmandu, focusing on the Krama/Uttarānāya system, particularly Guhyakāklī. These manuscripts are important for scholars interested in editing, studying or exploring the Guhyakālī cult or the Uttarāmnāya system of Tantrc practice. I have selected two types of manuscripts: one based on rituals (Paddhati) and the other on iconography. Due to their unpublished status, the Uttarāmnāya system remains difficult to access and study. This paper aims to draw scholarly attention to these manuscripts, encouraging their editing and publication. The significance of this research lies in making these rare resources more accessible thereby preserving and promoting an important aspect of Tantric tradition.
Keywords : Guhyakālī, Uttarāmnāya, Tantra, Paddhati, Manuscripts.

column4: Government P.G. College, Deoband, Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh
column11: समासगत पदों में शक्ति-स्वीकार्यता में दोष
column13:
न्यायशास्त्र में समस्तपद में एक शक्ति न स्वीकार कर समस्तपद के घटक पदों से अभिधा वृत्ति के द्वारा विवक्षित अर्थ का बोध माना गया है। वैयाकरण आचार्य समास के घटक पदों में शक्तिस्वीकार्यता का खण्डन करते हुए अनेक दोषों को उपस्थित करते हैं। प्रस्तुत शोधपत्र में इन्हीं दोषों की विवेचना प्रस्तुत है। यथा एकार्थीभाववादी वैयाकरण कहते हैं, चित्रगु इत्यादि समस्त पद की ‘चित्रगोस्वामी’ अर्थ में शक्ति स्वीकार किए बिना इस समस्त पद का अर्थबोध सम्भव नहीं है। गो इस अर्थ में चित्र पद के अर्थ का अभेद रूप से अन्वय सम्भव नहीं है। वैयाकरणों के अनुसार चित्र पद को यदि मात्र तात्पर्यग्राहक माना जाएगा तो बहुव्रीहि समास ही असम्भव हो जाएगा। समास में शक्ति स्वीकार न करने का अभिप्राय है कि नैयायिक पूरे समुदाय को प्रत्यय की प्रकृति स्वीकार नहीं करते हैं। इस स्थिति में ‘चित्रगुमानय’ इत्यादि वाक्यों में द्वितीया विभक्ति के अर्थ कर्मत्व का चित्रगोस्वामी अर्थ से अन्वय नहीं हो पायेगा।
	चित्रगु इस समस्त पद में शक्ति स्वीकार न करने पर यह पद अर्थ से युक्त न होने से इसकी प्रातिपदिक सञ्ज्ञा नहीं होगी और प्रातिपदिक सञ्ज्ञा के अभाव में चित्रगु पद से उत्तर सुप् प्रत्ययों का विधान नहीं हो पाएगा।

column11: संस्कृतशिक्षणे बालसाहित्यस्य अभिनवं स्वरूपम् - तस्य आवश्यकता मर्यादाः समाधानं च|
column13:
संस्कृतशिक्षणे बालसाहित्यस्य अभिनवं स्वरूपम्|
तस्य आवश्यकता मर्यादाः समाधानं च|
विद्यालयीन-औपचारिके संस्कृतशिक्षणे वा अनौपचारिके संस्कृतशिक्षणे वा पाठ्यपुस्तकानि विहाय ज्ञानवर्धकं कृतियुक्ताध्ययनपरं मनोरञ्जकं च बालसाहित्यम् अस्ति वा? अस्ति चेत् तत् कियत् सरलं सुगमं च भवति? संस्कृत-पठितॄणां मनसि जिज्ञासां निर्मातुम् उपयुक्तानि सुन्दराणि पुस्तकानि कथं भवेयुः? विशेषतः संस्कृतमाध्यमेन साहित्यस्य किं वा स्वरूपं भवेत्? किमर्थम् एतत्प्रकारकं साहित्यम् आवश्यकम्? भाषासंवर्धनाय तत्साहित्यस्य कथमुपयोगः स्यात्? तस्य च भविष्यति अपेक्षितं स्वरूपं किं स्यात्? 
तत्साहित्यनिर्माणे मर्यादाः काः? तासां च किं वा समाधानं स्यात्? समस्यापरिहारोपायानां चिन्तनम् एवम् इत्येतेषां सन्दर्भे सानुभवं यथाशक्ति यथामति विचारप्रकटनं क्रियते|

column11: UNITY IN DIVERSITY:THE ADVAITA PHILOSOPHY IN KALIDASA'S WORKS
column13:
Synopsis:

Unity in Diversity: The Advaita Philosophy in Kalidasa's Works
                                              
Kalidasa, the classical Sanskrit poet and dramatist, is celebrated for his unique approach to weaving the principles of Advaita, or non-duality, a core tenet of Indian philosophy, into his works. His literary mastery and profound philosophical insights are evident in his two Mahakavya-s, three dramas, and a messenger poem. While his works are widely interpreted to contain philosophical ideas, including those akin to Advaita Vedanta, finding specific verses that explicitly articulate these ideas in a way that corresponds directly to a specific Advaita phrasing can be challenging due to the poetic and metaphorical nature of his writing. Therefore, precise canto and verse references precisely matching Advaita principles in Kalidasa’s original Sanskrit texts are not typically demarcated as such.
Instead, Kalidasa's works are often analyzed for their thematic richness and philosophical depth, drawing parallels to Advaita through broad interpretations and allusions.

column11: उपनिषद्सु शैक्षिकतत्त्वानि
column13: उपनिषदः भारतदेशस्य सभ्यतायाः संस्कृतेः दर्शनमेवं धर्मस्यापि मानससरोवरमिति भाति । अस्मादेव भारतस्य संस्कृतरूपा गङ्गा एवं यमुनायाः अजस्रधारा प्रवहति । उपनिषदः न केवलं भारतस्य बहुमुखिदर्शनानामपि तु भारतस्य अनुपमसभ्यतायाः अपि जन्म अददात् । भारतीयेतिहासः अस्य विषयस्य साक्षी वर्तते यत् उपनिषद एव भारतदेशस्य युगपरिवर्तकास्सन्ति । भारतस्य पुनरुत्थाने उपनिषदः एव मुख्यं कारणं वर्तन्ते । स्वामिविवेकानन्दः, स्वामी रामतीर्थः, महर्षिः देवेन्द्रनाथठाकुमारः, कविः रवीन्द्रनाथः, राजा राममोहनरायः इत्यादयः विद्वांसः, सुविचारकाः समाजस्य सुधारकाः मुक्तकण्ठेन उपनिषदः ऋणं स्वीकृतवन्तः ।

column11: पुराणो मे श्रीकृष्ण का प्रभास के गोलोक धाम से वैकुंठ तक का महाप्रयान ।
column13:
ॐ कृष्णाय वासुदेवाय हरये परमात्मने ।
प्रणतः क्लेशनाशाय गोविंदाय नमो नमः ॥
पुराणो के अनुसार संसार के उपकारके लिये भगवान श्रीकृष्णचन्द्रने पृथिविका भार उतारने के लिये द्वापर युग मे जन्म लिया ओर  देत्यो एवं  दुष्ट राजोका वध किया । स्कन्द पुराण के प्रभास खण्ड मे द्वितीय अध्याय मे प्रभासका वर्णन मिलता  है ।प्रभास क्षेत्र सब तिर्थोमे श्रीष्ठ है । भगवान शिव ने कहा है कि प्रभास मुझे अधिक प्रिय है ,प्रभास मे उत्तम सिद्वि और परम गति प्राप्त होति है । पूर्वभाग मे सूर्य नारायणजी  पश्चिम मे माधवजी दक्षिण मे समुद्र तथा उत्तरमे भवानी है । वह क्षेत्र बारह योजनका है । जो सब पातकोका नाश करनेवाला है । इस क्षेत्र का प्रथम भाग महेश्वर  कहा गया है ।दूसरा वैष्णव तीसरा ब्रह्म एक करोड तीर्थ है ।मध्य मे रुद्र भाग है ।जो मनुष्य इस क्षेत्र निवास करते है ,उनको एक ही जन्ममे मोक्ष प्राप्त हो जाता है ।

column11: नाचिकेताग्नि का वैज्ञानिक स्वरूप
column13:
प्रस्तावना
आर्षद्रष्टा वैदिक ऋषियों ने स्वतपश्चर्या की शक्ति से वैदिक मन्त्रों का साक्षात्कार किया। साक्षात्कार की इस प्रक्रिया में तपःपूत वैदिक ऋषियों के द्वारा अपञ्चीकृत और सूक्ष्मभूत पञ्चमहाभूत (आकाश, वायु, अप, अग्नि तथा पृथिवी) के तत्त्वज्ञान को आत्मसात् किया गया। इहलोक में मानव-जीवन के सम्यक् सञ्चालन एवं प्राणियों में ऊर्जा का सञ्चार करने के कारण तथा परलोक अर्थात् स्वर्गलोक की प्राप्ति कराने के कारण स्वरूप ही ‘अग्नि-तत्त्व’ को पञ्चमहाभूतों में सर्वश्रेष्ठ स्थान प्रदान किया गया। एतदर्थ अग्नि-विज्ञान को जानने के कारण ही वैदिक ऋषि के द्वारा वेद के प्रथम सूक्त को सर्वप्रथम ‘अग्नि-सूक्त’ के रूप में साक्षात्कृत किया गया। एवमेव वेद के अङ्गभूत ‘उपनिषद्’ का विषय न केवल जीव, आत्मा व ब्रह्म रहा है, अपितु स्वर्गप्राप्ति के साधनभूत अग्निविद्या का भी वर्णन यहां पर विशिष्ट रूप में प्राप्त होता है। उपनिषद् साहित्य वस्तुतः अग्नि के तीन रूप को विवेचित करता है-
•	आध्यात्मिक अग्नि
•	आधिदैविक अग्नि
•	आधिभौतिक अग्नि
सावित्र अग्नि, पञ्चाग्नि, त्रिणाचिकेताग्नि उपर्युक्त अग्नियों के ही विविध स्वरूप हैं।

column11: नाचिकेताग्नि का वैज्ञानिक स्वरूप

•	आध्यात्मिक अग्नि
•	आधिदैविक अग्नि
•	आधिभौतिक अग्नि
सावित्र अग्नि, पञ्चाग्नि, त्रिणाचिकेताग्नि उपर्युक्त अग्नियों के ही विविध स्वरूप हैं। कृष्ण यजुर्वेदीय कठोपनिषद् में मृत्यु देवता के द्वारा कुमार नचिकेता को “नाचिकेताग्नि विद्या” के

column11: SCIENTIFIC APPROACH OF YOGIC SATKARMA IN PERFORMANCE ACCELERATION OF YOGASANA SPORTS ATHLETES
column13:
ABSTRACT
The present scenario shows that life has become fully materialistic, fun, masti, and luxury-oriented daily without caring for the temple-like body. Yogasana sports are the most remarkable milestones for fitness and a healthy disciplined lifestyle.Yogasana sports have both static and dynamic form which needs a supreme and extreme level of fitness, it has Traditional Asana leads to Asana without music, Artistic Single, Artistic Pair, Rhythmic Pair, and Artistic Group needs good dynamic fitness along with speed, strength, flexibility and coordination or agility for that the individual need wholesome development. It requires that much development is done by Sat karmas or Sat kriyas of yoga which leads to the purification of the body and it is also known as the Purification technique or cleansing technique.The yogasana sports deal with the dynamic fitness of an individual which leads to wholesome development along with the best result of satkriyas in the direction of science and nature, Satkriyas are the most effective techniques not only cure and prevent diseases

column11: The concept of Shastra Shravana with the perspective of Dyaneshwari
column13:
The concept of Shastra Shravana plays a crucial role in the study of Vedanta, particularly within the framework of Shravana, Manana, and Nididhyasana. These three stages are central to Vedantic practice, yet they have led to differing opinions among scholars of the same Darshana. While it is universally accepted that Shravana (listening to the scriptures) is essential, its importance, nature, and results are interpreted differently by various Acharyas. Saint Shri Dnyaneshwar Maharaj, in his commentary on the Shrimad Bhagavad Gita, known as Dnyaneshwari, also provides significant insights into this subject. 
However, there are instances where his views seem contradictory. This paper explores Dnyaneshwar Maharaj's perspectives on Shravana, addressing some of these apparent contradictions.

column11: The theory of the relation between Sleep and the Mind from the perspective of Ayurveda
column13: In recent decades, mental health studies have surged, making psychology a crucial science. While Western philosophy underpins modern psychology, Bharatiya Knowledge systems, particularly Ayurveda, offer a distinct perspective on mental health. Despite Ayurveda's global popularity, its psychological aspects remain underexplored. This paper delves into the theory of the relationship between sleep and the mind, a topic gaining traction in contemporary psychology. Ayurveda has long recognized its importance, with major texts discussing it extensively. However, different Acharyas offer varying, sometimes contradictory, views. This paper examines these diverse opinions to understand the Ayurvedic perspective on sleep and mental health.

column11: “स्थित्युद्भवप्रलयहेतुरहेतुरस्य” या श्रीमद्भागवतातील श्लोकावरील श्रीधरी टीका आणि एकनाथी भागवताचे तौलनिक अध्ययन.
column13: "ब्रह्म संकल्पना" ही भारतीय दर्शन शास्त्रातील अत्यंत महत्त्वपूर्ण संकल्पना आहे. या ब्रह्म तत्वाचे प्रतिपादन अनेक ग्रंथांच्या माध्यमातून केलेले दिसून येते, त्यामध्ये प्रामुख्याने उपनिषदे, श्रीमद्भगवद्गीता व ब्रह्मसूत्र या ग्रंथांमधून ब्रह्म तत्वाचे विस्तृत चिंतन प्राप्त होते. याच ग्रंथ परंपरेमध्ये ”श्रीमद्भागवत महापुराण”हा एक ग्रंथ येतो. कारण, "अर्थोयं ब्रह्मसूत्राणां भारतार्थविनिर्णयः।"असे वचन भागवताबद्द्ल उद्धृत केले जाते. श्रीमद्भागवतामध्ये अनेक ठिकाणी ब्रह्म तत्वाचे प्रतिपादन दिसून येते, परंतु विशेषतः श्रीमद्भागवताचा ‘एकादश स्कंध’ हा संपूर्ण भागवताचे तात्विक सार प्रतिपादन करणारा स्कंध आहे म्हणूनच याला ”मुक्ती” स्कंध असेही म्हणतात. या स्कंधामध्ये परम तत्वाबद्दल अनेक प्रकारे चिंतन आलेले आहे. त्यामध्ये तिसऱ्या अध्यायातील ३५ व्या श्लोकामध्ये ब्रह्म तत्वाचे लक्षण आणि स्वरूप विचार केलेला दिसून येतो. या श्लोकावर श्रीधराचार्यांनी आपल्या भाष्यामध्ये शास्त्राला कुठेही बाध न जाता शास्त्रीय दृष्ट्या कसा विचार केला आणि तोच शास्त्र सिद्धांत संत एकनाथांनी  दृष्टांत पूर्ण पद्धतीने विस्तृत करून सर्वांना ज्ञात होईल असा अत्यंत सरळ करून कसा सांगितला याचा अभ्यास प्रस्तुत शोधपत्रातून करण्यात येईल.

column4: DECCAN COLLEGE AND POST GRADUATE RESEARCH INSTITUTE
column11: Strategies of war: A study of dominant vyuhas of Mahabharata
column13: Vyūhas, dynamic battlefield arrangements, were meticulously designed to exploit enemy weaknesses, protect vital forces, and adapt to changing combat conditions. This paper explores the dominant military formations (vyūhas) described in the Mahābhārata, focusing on their strategic significance during the Kurukṣetra War. The study highlights prominent formations such as the Garuda, Makara, Chakraśhakata, Chakravyūha, and Ardhachaṇdra vyūhas, examining their design, tactical purpose, and effectiveness. By analyzing these formations, the paper offers insights into ancient Indian warfare, demonstrating how military science in India was deeply rooted in strategic planning, flexibility, and psychological understanding. The research also emphasizes the importance of communication, coordination, and adaptability on the battlefield, revealing how victory in warfare was achieved not only through brute strength but also through intellect and foresight. Through the lens of these vyūhas, the paper provides a comprehensive understanding of ancient India's rich military heritage.

column11: Interpretation of Tattvamasi in Siddhantabindu.
column13:
The interpretation of the mahavakya Tattvamasi (That Thou Art) in Madhusūdana Sarasvatī's Siddhantabindu offers a profound exploration of non-duality in Advaita Vedanta. 
This paper examines how Madhusūdana Sarasvatī defends and elaborates upon the concept of Tattvamasi through his commentary on the Dasasloki and the challenges he addresses against other philosophical schools. The phrase Tattvamasi combines tat (that), tvam (you), and asi (are), signifying the essential unity of the individual self (Atman) with the ultimate reality (Brahman). Madhusūdana Sarasvatī argues that this unity is not a mere conceptual assertion but an experiential truth, transcending intellectual understanding and revealing the non-dual nature of reality. 
In Siddhantabindu, the interpretation of Tattvamasi involves a rigorous critique of various schools of thought, such as Charvaka, Buddhism, Jainism, and others, which propose differing views on the nature of the self.

column11: सृष्टिमीमांसा
column13:
सृष्टिमीमांसा


वेदवाक्यतात्पर्यनिर्णयरताः मीमांसकाः “औत्पत्तिकस्तु शब्दस्यार्थेन सम्बन्ध तस्य ज्ञानमुपदेशः अव्यतिरेकश्चार्थे अनुपलब्धे तत्प्रमाणं बादरायणस्यानपेक्षत्वात्” इति जैमिनिसूत्रानुरोधेन शब्दस्य,अर्थस्य,शब्दार्थयोस्सम्बन्धस्य च नित्यत्वं प्रतिपादयन्ति । सम्बन्धाक्षेपपरिहारभाष्ये शबरस्वामिभिः अथ सम्बन्धः कः, यच्छब्दे विज्ञाते अर्थो विज्ञायते स तु कृतक इति उक्तम् । शब्दार्थयोः यः सज्ञासंज्ञिलक्षणसम्बन्धः सः कृतकः इति । शब्दस्य अर्थप्रतिपादकशक्तिः न स्वाभाविकी । अपि तु पुंसां समयात् अर्थप्रतीतिः भवति । अयं विषयः श्लोकवार्तिके एवमनूदितः यत् -
स्वतो नैवास्ति शक्तत्वं वाच्यवाचकयोरमिथः ।
प्रतीतिः स्यात् पुंसां भवेदक्षिनिकोचवत् ॥ इति ।
एतद्वैशेषिकमतं विकल्प्य दूषितं वार्तिककारैः कुमारिलभट्टपादैः । तथा हि -

क्रियते जगदादौ वा सकृदेकेन केनचित् ॥ 
समयः नाम सङ्केतः । स च समयः प्रतिमर्त्यं, प्रत्युच्चारणं भिन्नमभिन्नं वा विचार्य भाष्यकारैः जगदादौ केनचित् पुरुषेण सम्बन्धः कृतः इति तृतीयपक्षं खण्डयितुम् उपक्रान्तः - “केनापि पुरु

column11: Innovation and patenting trends in Computational Linguistics and Artificial Intelligence
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13: With the increasing proliferation of technology and digital communication in the Indian sub-continent, Indic languages are increasingly being used in online platforms, social media, and educational content. These languages mean more than just communication, as they are integral to cultural identity of the sub-continent that is rich in its classical literature, music, theatre and other cultural arts. The present paper presents the latest innovation trend and patenting trends in the fields of computational linguistics, artificial intelligence and allied areas. Key patents filed with specific reference to Indian languages are explored. Cooperative Patent Classification (CPC) and International Patent Classification (IPC) code based analysis is presented herewith, with detailed scrutiny of the sub-domains contained the fields of computational linguistics, artificial intelligence and machine learning. Prominent inventions are discussed and patent landscape analysis is outlined. Further the paper attempts a careful scrutiny of citation pattern analysis to analyze citation patterns aiding in

column11: पूर्वमीमांसाशाास्त्रस्य जिज्ञासासूत्रे स्मृतिसूत्रयोः विरोधः-परिहारश्च
column13:
पूवर्मीमांसायां िजज्ञासासूत्रे स्मृितसूत्रयोः विरोधः -परिहारश्च

शोधसारः -“धमेर्ण पापमपनुदित”1 इत्यािदिभः वेदवाक्यैः धमर्स्य पापनाशकत्वं जगदुत्पित्तिस्थितकारणत्वं च प्रितपािदतम् । स च धमर्ः अतीिन्द्रयः वेदमात्रगम्यश्च । स्मृत्यादीनामिप धमर्प्रमाणत्वं वेदमूलकतयैव । मनु-याज्ञवल्क्यािदिभः महिषर् िभरिप अयमथर्ः स्पष्टीकृ तः “वेदोऽिखलो धमर्मूलम”् 2 इत्यािदना । मीमांसावाितर् ककाराः कु मािरलभट्टपादाः अिप श्लोकवाितर्के –
यथा धमार्वबोधस्य प्रमाणं वैिदकं वचः ।
तदथर्िनणर्येहेतुःजिैमनीयंतथैवनः॥3
इत्यनेन वेदवाक्यानां तात्पयार्थर्िनणर्ये जैिमनीयं मीमांसाशास्त्रं प्रमाणिमित कथयन् प्रासङ्िगकरूपेण सूचयामास धमार्वबोधे वेद एव प्रमाणिमित । वेदवाक्यानां धमार्वबोधकत्वं तु अथर्ज्ञानद्वारा ।
भगवान् जैिमिनः धमार्धमर्िनरूपणे प्रवृत्तः सन् “अथातो धमर्िजज्ञासा”4 इत्यनेन सूत्रेण वेदाध्ययनानन्तरं धमर्िजज्ञासा कतर्व्या इित धमर्िजज्ञासां प्रितज्ञाय आद्वादशाध्यायं धमर्ं िनरूपयामास । अथज्ञर् ानसिहतत्वे एव वेदाध्ययनं पिरपूणर्ं भवित । तच्च अथर्ज्ञानं (िनणर्यरूपं तात्पयर्ज्ञानम्)िवचारापरपयायर्मीमांसाशास्त्राधीन

column11: Latest Advances in Sanskrit Child Literature: An  Overview
column13:
Children are the new generation of society. Every society's culture, traditions, behaviour patterns are passed down from one generation to 
others. Language is the medium through which these elements are transfered. Hence, many languages contain child literature. Sanskrit is no 
exception. Child literature occupies noticable amount of story books, study material, poems etc.
        From ancient times literature like Panchatantra by Vishnusharma , Hitopadesh, Nitishatak are the epitome of child literature. This research 
explores the role and characteristics of Sanskrit literature designed for children, focusing on the modern period in India. The purpose of this 
paper is to focus on the analysis of this literature and draw inferences regarding the syllabus structure, required improvement in materials, and 
merits of Sanskrit child literature. In India a lot of contributions regarding child literature are made. Sanskrit bharati is seen as a leading 
institution publishing child literature, Chnadmama is also an excellent example of a periodical for children.

column11: Daavaagni Ka Swaroop Aur Rigveda
column13:
स्वतः उत्पन्न वृक्षों का समूह 'वन' कहा जाता है और इनमें लगने वाली आग को वनाग्नि, दावाग्नि, दावानल आदि नामों से जाना जाता है। वनों को इस पृथिवी के फेफड़ों की संज्ञा दी गई है। वन न केवल जीवन के लिए आवश्यक प्राणवायु के स्रोत है अपितु जैव-विविधता के संरक्षक और पोषक भी है। आजकल पूरे विश्व में वनों में आग लगने की अनेक घटनायें देखने और सुनने में आ रही हैं। पर्यावरण पर इस प्रकार की घटनाओं के पड़ने वाले दुष्प्रभाव से पर्यावरणविद् चिन्तित है। उनकी चिन्ता स्वाभाविक भी है। वन में लगने वाली आग तीन प्रकार की मानी गई है- सतह की आग (सतह पर विद्यमान घास-फूस और खर-पतवार को जलाने वाली) जमीन की आग (घास-फूस तथा अन्य वनस्पतियों के पुज को जलाने बाली) तथा पेड़ों को जलाने वाली आग, जिसे ऊपरी स्तर की आग कहा जाती है।

देखा जाये तो वनों में लगने वाली आग पारिस्थितकी-तत्र का एक स्वाभाविक और आवश्यक अंग है। यह जहाँ एक ओर अनियत्रित रूप से फैली हुई झाड़ी आदि को साफ कर के जगल की सतह तक सूर्य के प्रकाश के पहुँचने का मार्ग प्रशस्त करती है तो दूसरी ओर मृत पेड़-पौधों और अन्यविध सड़ती वनस्पतियों को जलाकर उनके पोषक तत्वों को मिटटी में मिलाकर उसे ऊर्वर बनाती है।

column4: Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University Ramtek, Nagpur
column11: “Understanding Non-Attachment In Yoga: The Practice of Detachment”
column13: Non-attachment (Vairagya), a core concept in yoga philosophy, emphasizes detachment from outcomes, possessions, and personal desires. This paper explores non-attachment's theoretical and practical aspects within yoga practice, tracing its roots to key yogic texts like the Bhagavad Gita and Yoga Sutras of Patanjali. The discussion examines non-attachment's application in daily life, enhancing personal growth and emotional resilience. Non-attachment's role in yoga's physical and mental aspects is explored, transforming asanas, pranayama, and meditation into a focused and balanced practice. Techniques for cultivating non-attachment, such as mindfulness and reflective exercises, are presented. Addressing common misconceptions, this paper clarifies that non-attachment fosters a healthier lifestyle, rather than indifference. Case studies highlight benefits like improved emotional resilience and clarity. This paper encourages readers to integrate non-attachment into their yoga practice and daily life, offering practical insights and resources.

column11: काव्यप्रकाशरसगङ्गाधरयोः सन्दर्भेऽभिधाविमर्शः
column13:
काव्यप्रकाशरसगङ्गाधरयोः सन्दर्भेऽभिधाविमर्शः
(शोधपत्रसारांशः)
डॉ. फिरोज,
सहायकाचार्यः,
संस्कृतविभागः, कला-सङ्कायः,
काशी-हिन्दू-विश्वविद्यालयः,
वाराणसी- 221005
मम्मटाचार्येण - "स्याद्वाचको लाक्षणिकः शब्दोऽत्र व्यञ्जकस्त्रिधा" इति कारिकानन्तरं "स मुख्योर्थस्तत्र व्योपारोऽस्याभिधोच्यते" इति कारिकान्तर्गते मीमांसकमतम् अथ च पातञ्जलमतं चेति स्वीकृतमस्ति। 
	तथा हि- सङ्केतग्राह्यं शक्त्याख्यं पदार्थान्तरमभिधा" इति हि मीमांसकमतम् अथ च "तादृशं शब्दार्थयोस्तादात्म्यमभिधा" इति पातञ्जलम्।
	एतद्द्वयं मतं रसगङ्गाधारकारेणाप्युररीकृतम् अथ च नैयायिकरीतिमनुसृत्य तत्र परिष्कारं कृत्वा मतद्वयं दर्शितम्। नैयायिकाः वृत्तिं सम्बन्धरूपां स्वीकुर्वन्ति। तेषां मते ईश्वरेच्छाशक्तिः, सैव सङ्केतः, सैव सम्बन्धः। वृत्त्या पदजन्यपदार्थोपस्थितिः ततः शाह्दबोधो भवति। एवं शाब्दबोधजनकोपस्थितिजनकज्ञानविषयसम्भन्धत्वं वृत्तित्वमिति फलितम्। 
	एवं वृत्तिव्यापारः सम्बन्धः इति अर्थान्तरम्। अतः पण्डितराजादयः अभिधावृत्तीः व्यापारः सम्बन्धरूपा आहुः। मम्मटादयश्च व्यापाररूपास्ता इत्याहुः।

column11: Yoga and Sangita: Harmonious Pathways to Self-Realization
column13: Yoga and music, India's timeless treasures, have been intertwined for centuries, sharing a profound purpose of guiding individuals toward self-realization and unity with the ultimate reality. Rooted in ancient wisdom, these complementary disciplines have evolved into distinct yet interconnected paths, converging in their pursuit of unity and uniqueness, and harmonizing the mind and body through their respective practices, ultimately revealing the true nature of the self and the universe.

column11: पुराणो में देवताओं की लिङ्ग संबन्धी विषमताएँ |
column13:
पुराणो एवं वैदिक ग्रन्थोंं में देवताओंं कि लिङ्ग संबन्धी अनेक विषमताएँ देखने को मिलती हैंं| पुराणो में अनेक ऐसे देवी देवताओं के प्रसंग प्राप्त होते हैं जो पुल्लिंग ,स्त्रीलिङ्ग एवं उभय लिङ्ग तीनो रूप धारण करते हैं -
 
      देवता जो द्विलिंगी रूप धारण करते हैं आधा पुरुष आधा स्त्री रूप देवता|
•	दूसरी श्रेणी में वे देवता सम्मिलित हैं जो तीनों रूप  (पुल्लिंग, स्त्रीलिंग तथा उभयलिंग) धारण करते हैं|
•	देवता जो पहले पुरुष रूप तथा बाद में स्त्री रूप अथवा पहले स्त्री रूप तथा बाद में पुरुष रूप धारण करते हैं|
•	ऐसे देवता जो दो पुरुषों अथवा दो स्त्री देवताओं से उत्पन्न हो|
•	देवता जो एकल पुरुष अथवा एकल  स्त्री से उत्पन्न होते हैं| 
•	देवता जो विपरीत लिंग के प्रति आकर्षित नहीं होते।

column11: पदार्थः पदार्थेनान्वेति न तु तदेकदेशेन इति नियमविमर्शः
column13: शाब्दबोधे एकपदार्थे अपरपदार्थस्यान्वयः आकाङ्क्षाबलेन जायते इति विदितमेव । तत्र पदार्थे एव इतरपदार्थस्यान्वयः न तु तदेकदेशे इत्यत्र सङ्केतज्ञाने किं नियामकमिति अस्मिन् शोधलेके विमृश्यते। तथा च “जात्याकृतिव्यक्तयस्तु पदार्थः” इति न्यायसूत्रानुगुणं जात्यादित्रयाणामपि सम्भूय पदार्थत्वं विहितम् । तथा सति शाब्दबोधे जात्यादित्रिषु इतरपदार्थस्यान्वयो भासते इति वक्तव्यं स्यात्, न तु जात्यादिविशिष्टव्यक्तौ । अतः “पदार्थः पदार्थेनान्वेति न तु तदेकदेशेन” इति नियमोऽङ्गीकृतः । तत्र सङ्केतविषयतानां भेदाभेदनियामकं किम्, पदार्थत्वं नाम किम्, पदार्थैकदेशत्वं नाम किम्? पदार्थपदार्थतावच्छेदकतत्संसर्गेषु इतरपदार्थान्वयप्रयोजकीभूतसङ्केतविषयता केन सम्बन्धेन कुत्र वर्तते, सङ्केतीयमुक्यविशेष्यताकज्ञानम् शाब्दबोधे पदार्थे इतरपदार्थान्वयं प्रति कुतो न प्रयोजकं भवति, उक्त“पदार्थः पदार्थेनान्वेती”ति नियमस्य कुत्र सङ्चारो न भवति, पदविशेष्यकसङ्केतपक्षे पदार्थे इतरपदार्थान्वयं प्रति किं प्रयोजकम्  - इत्यादिविचारा अत्र शक्तिवादव्युत्पत्तिवादादिग्रन्थोक्तरीत्या चर्चिताः । इत्थमस्मिन् लेखे “पदार्थः पदार्थेनान्वेति” इति नियमस्य तात्पर्यं निरूपयितुं प्रयत्नो विहितः।

column11: TATHĀGATA - PPAVEDITA - TTHAGGAHAṆE PATISAṂCIKKHITABBĀNI KĀRAṆĀNI VĪMAṂSANAṂ
column13: Pāḷīti tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ vacanaṃ. taṃ pitakavasena tividhaṃ. seyyatīdaṃ vinayapitakaṃ, suttapitakaṃ, abhidhammapitakanti. Tena hi Imasmiṃ pariyesanasmiṃ adhippāyo pan te tayo pitake atthakathane kāni kāraṇāni patisaṃcikkhitabbānīti vīmaṃsanaṃ. Kāni kāraṇāni patisaṃcikkhitabbāni; pitakatthaggahane?  Tatheva kā hāni; rite tasmā kāraṇasmā pitakatthaggahane patisaṃcikkhite? Tatrime vissajanā pañhāti daṭṭhabbā. Pariyesanapañhassa vissajjanatthāya ettha pamukhavasena sāhiccamūlanissayo ca vāṇivijjā -  (Linguistics) pakaraṇavicārakkanavedā (Pragmatics) ca ajjhayanaṃ karīyati; paṇditābhimukhe sākaccha ca. Ettha theravādapāḷimeva Abhippetaṃ. Na tu aññasamayagatapitake. pitakatthaggahane patisaṃcikkhitabbāni kāraṇāni sambahulāni dissate. seyyathīdaṃ.Tantibhāsāñāṇaṃ. Pubbanigamanañāṇa - vippayuttaṃ. Saddhāya ca paññāya ca abhinivesanaṃ. Suttakhaṇḍaṃ avavatthetva vīmaṃsanaṃ. Sāṭṭhakathā pālisāhiccavisayāyatta - pakaraṇaganthe āsevanaṃ.Pakaraṇānubaddhanaṃ ajjhayanaṃ. (Context) Abhidhamme saṃsandananti.Tatra tantibhāsāñānaṃ nāma; Magadhabhāsāñāṇa. Taṃ kissahetu; Peṭakasāhiccaṃ pana tantibhāsāya

column11: Buddhism: A way of Social Justice and Liberation
column13:
Buddhism: A way of Social Justice and Liberation
	The Buddhism arose as a strong Social Justice Movement. It is much more than a Social Revolutionary movement. It is a great phenomenon of the mankind. Buddhism is a religion of love, kindness, compassion, humanity and equality. It emerged against the unjust and irrational practices of Vedic religion. Vedic religion has become yagyna-centric where thousands of animals killed for worthless popularity, heinous acts to be done while performing yagyna, women were restricted in all walks of life, the shudras and untouchables were treated badly.  The chaturavarnya, the Four-Fold Society has got prominence and become the way of life. It resulted into social discrimination and rigid casteism. In such socio-religious condition, Buddhism and Jainism emerged as a Protest Movement. It was a comprehensive Social Justice Movement that influenced all the aspects of mankind. It was a human-centric philosop

column11: ”जीवनमौल्यानां सार्वकालिकं तात्त्विकं संविधानं श्रीमद्भगवद्गीता’’
column13: इह खलु सकलकलाकलापकलितस्य भारतवर्षस्य पुण्यतमे भूभागे धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे पुरुषोत्तमेन भगवता श्रीकृष्णेन सकलान् मानवान् उद्धधीर्षुणा अर्जुनं निमित्तीकृत्य प्रगीता या गीता  सकलस्यापि मानवजातस्य श्रेयसे प्रेयसे च कल्प्यत इति जनिभृतां जनानाम् अहोभाग्यमेव ।महाभारतस्य भीष्मपर्वणि कुरुक्षेत्रयुद्धारम्भे कर्तव्यात्परामुखं विषीदन्तं विषण्णं धनञ्जयं निमित्तीकृत्य भगवतो मुखारविन्दात् भुवमवतीर्णो हि सर्वासाम् उपनिषदां हृदयभूतो जीवनमौल्यानां तत्त्वोपदेशो श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतेति आसंसारं प्रसिद्धेति अभिजानीमो वयम् । इयं च  बहुभिः प्राचीनैर्महात्मभिः अर्वाचीनैर्महनीयैः च विपुलं व्याख्यातेति नाविदितं नः सर्वेषाम् । प्रपञ्चेऽस्मिन् अत्यधिकासु भाषासु अनूदितेषु ग्रन्थेषु इयमेव प्राथम्यं भजत इति  विषवजनीना एषेति स्वभावोक्तिः । अर्जुनं निमित्तीकृत्य उपदिष्टाऽपि इयं गीता प्रपञ्चे विद्यमानान् सर्वानपि अस्मादृशान् अर्जुनसदृशान् आबहोः कालात् उद्धरन्ती सति अद्यापि तत्कार्यं प्रवर्तयतीति सार्वकालिकं अस्याः प्रभुत्वम् गङ्गाप्रवाहवत् अक्षुण्णं विद्योतत इति जीवनमौल्यानां सार्वकालिकस्य तात्त्विकोपदेशस्य निधिरियम् ।

column11: जिन चरित के आलोक में शाक्य मुनि बुद्ध के चरित - प्रणयन की विकास -परम्परा।
column13:
तथागत भगवान् बुद्ध सम्यक् सम्बोधि से महापरिनिब्बान तक लोक के हित-सुख के लिए अपने जीवन के 45 वर्षों तक धम्म-देशनाएँ प्रदान करते रहें। उनके वचनामृतों से असंख्य लोगों को दुःख-रोग के समूल विनाश की औषधि प्राप्त हुई। निश्चय ही उनकी कल्याणमय देशनाओं का समाज पर व्यापक प्रभाव पड़ा। तिपिटक में उनके जीवन तथा उपदेशों की सुन्दर झलक दिखायी देती है। अनेक सुत्तों में उनके जीवन-चरित के दर्शन भी होते हैं। कालान्तर में उनके उपदेशामृतों से प्रभावित होकर कवियों एवं विद्वानों ने उनके जीवन एवं शिक्षाओं पर काव्य-रचना की। इस प्रकार प्राचीनकाल में तथागत बुद्ध की पाँच जीवनियाँ उपलब्ध होती हैं-
1. महासांघिकों (लोकोत्तरवादियों) की महावस्तु,
2. मिश्रित संस्कृत में रचित सर्वास्तिवादियों का ललितविस्तर,
3. शुद्ध संस्कृत में चमत्कारिक काव्यमय शैली में लिखा गया अश्वघोष का बुद्धचरित, 
4. जातकों की भूमिका के रूप में पालि में लिखित निदानकथा ।

column11: वाङ्मय प्रवेशः
भारतीयसंस्कृतौ अवतारमहत्वं तथा भगवत्परशुरामावतारः
column13:
शोधसारः
सनातनप्रवाहे स्वच्छशाश्वत-परम्परायां भगवत्तत्त्वे विशिष्टतया भगवतः विविधरूपाणां विषये पौराणिकेतिहासे विस्तरेण वर्णनं प्राप्यते। तत्त्वचिन्तनस्य अस्यां पीयूषधारायां परमात्मनः विविधानाम् अवताराणां वर्णनम् उपलभ्यते।
सर्वथैव जगत्यर्थे स सर्वात्मा जगन्मयः।
सत्त्वांशेनावतीर्योर्व्या धर्मस्य कुरुते स्थितिम्॥
सृष्टेः अयं शाश्वतनियमोऽस्ति यत् यदा संसारे धर्मस्य विनाशो भवति अधर्मस्य उत्थानं  भवति तदा विश्वरूपः परमात्मा धर्मरक्षायै  अस्यां पृथिव्याम् अवतरति। अस्य अर्थः काचित् दैवशक्तिः अथवा स्वयं परमात्मा देवलोकात् भू-लोके अवतरति। अवतार इति शब्दस्य व्याख्या पुराणे, वैदिक-ग्रन्थे, श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतायां च प्राप्यते। अवतारवादस्य सिद्धान्तस्य व्याख्या सर्वाधिकविस्तरेण श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतायां विशेषरूपेण समुपलभ्यते।
भगवतः विष्णोः त्रेतायुगे भगवान परशुरामस्य स्वरूपे अवतरो जातः। श्रीमद्भागवतपुराणे निर्दिष्टेषु चतुविंशतौ अवतारेषु भगवतः परशुरामस्य षोडशतमः अवतारोऽस्ति तथा मत्स्यपुराणस्य मुख्येषु दशावतारेषु षष्ठक्रमे वर्णनं प्राप्यते। त्रेतायुगे भगवतः परशुरामस्य अवतारो जायते।

column11: Revisit to the Copperplate Charter of King Trilocanapāla dated Śaka 972
column13: There is a copperplate charter in the collection of the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute. The charter was published by H. H. Dhruva in 1883. Its language is Sanskrit and script Devanagari of the 11th century. It records a donation by king Trilocanapāla of Lāța region of Gujarat, dating Saka 972. Dhruva gave only the weight of the charter and no physical details of the plates. Its orthography and palaeography have also not been dealt with by him. We intend to cover such aspects of the copperplate that are not studied by earlier scholars. The numeral signs used in the plates present an interesting aspect of freehand usage of more than one sign to denote the same numbers. G. H. Ojha has illustrated the number signs from the present copperplate in plate LXXVI of his Prācīna Bhāratīya Lipimālā. The Lipipatra gives numbers from nine other charters and manuscripts, which clearly shows the exceptional nature of this copperplate. We will try to analyse the plate as regards this less pondered aspect.

column11: Effect of yoga on Postpartum Depression: A systematic Review
column13:
Effect of Yoga on Postpartum Depression: A systematic Review
(1)	Geeta Kukreti Ph.D. scholar of the department of yogic science from the University of Patanjali Haridwar.
(2)	Dr. Sandeep Singh, Assistant Professor of the department of yogic science from the University of Patanjali Haridwar.
ABSTRACT
Background: More than 13% of women experience postpartum depression (PPD) within the first three months after giving birth, making it a common and serious impact. The most commonly suggested treatments for symptom relief behavioral therapy and medication.
Aim: The purpose of this study is to examine the ladies who are suffering from postpartum depression
Methodology: For the search to encompass research with a range of postpartum depression detection and identification between 2013 and 2024 using databases like Google Scholar, Pub Med, science direct etc., the key words postpartum depression, yoga, mantra meditation.

column11: धर्म और डिजिटल जनरेशन गैप: एक विश्लेषण
column13: आधुनिक युग में डिजिटल प्रौद्योगिकीकरण के तीव्रगति से विकास ने समाज के हर पहलू को प्रभावित किया है, जिसमें धार्मिक मान्यताएँ और प्रथाएँ भी शामिल हैं। यह डिजिटल क्रांति विभिन्न पीढ़ियों के बीच एक महत्वपूर्ण अंतर पैदा कर रही है, जिसे "डिजिटल जनरेशन गैप" के रूप में जाना जाता है। यह अंतर धार्मिक क्षेत्र में विशेष रूप से स्पष्टतः दिखाई पड़ता है। युवा पीढ़ी, जिसे "डिजिटल नेटिव" भी कहा जाता है, इंटरनेट और सोशल मीडिया के माध्यम से धार्मिक जानकारी और अनुभवों तक पहुँच रही है। वे आभासीय रूप से धार्मिक कार्यक्रमों, समुदायों में भाग लेते हैं, वर्चुअल पूजा सत्रों में शामिल होते हैं, और धार्मिक ऐप्स का उपयोग करते हैं। यह डिजिटल माध्यम उन्हें विभिन्न धार्मिक विचारों और दर्शनों तक पहुँच प्रदान करता है, जिससे वे अधिक खुले विचारों वाले और बहुलवादी बनते हैं। दूसरी ओर, वृद्ध पीढ़ी प्रायः पारंपरिक धार्मिक प्रथाओं और भौतिक धार्मिक स्थलों को प्राथमिकता देती है। वे डिजिटल माध्यमों के उपयोग में असहज अनुभव करते हैं और इसे धार्मिक अनुभव के लिए अप्रामाणिक मान सकते हैं। यह अंतर कभी-कभी पीढ़ियों के बीच संघर्ष और गलतफहमी का कारण बन सकता है। यह डिजिटल जनरेशन गैप धार्मिक संस्थाओं के लिए अवसर भी प्रदान करता है।

column11: वैष्णवभक्तिप्रसारे यक्षगानपरम्परा
column13:
भारतीयाः कलाः मनुष्यान् आनन्दयन्त्यः पुरुषार्थप्राप्तौ उपकार्रिण्यो वर्तन्ते। मोक्षमार्गः अपि भगवद्भक्तेरनुसन्धानेन पुष्यति। तत्र भक्तेरस्ति विशिष्टं स्थानम्।  भगवतः साक्षात्कारमिच्छन्तः भगवद्भक्ताः भक्तिमन्तरा नान्यत्र दृष्टिं प्रसारयन्ति।
न नाकपृष्ठं न महेन्द्रधिष्ण्यं न सार्वभौमं न रसाधिपत्यम्‌ ।
न योगसिद्धीरपुनर्भवं वा समञ्जस ! त्वा विरहय्य काङ्क्षे॥
इति भागवते उच्यते। भक्तिरेव सायुज्यादिमुक्तिसाधनमित्यस्ति।
भक्तिरसामृतसिन्धौ रूपगोस्वामी
अन्याभिलाषिताशून्यं ज्ञानकर्माद्यनावृतम्॥
आनुकूल्येन कृष्णानुशीलनं भक्तिरुत्तमा॥
इत्युत्तमां भक्तिमाह। तत्र क्लेशघ्नी, शुभदा, मोक्षलघुताकृत्‌, सुदुर्लभा, सान्द्रानन्दविशेषात्मा, श्रीकृष्णाकर्षिणी चेति  सा भक्तिः नानारूपिणी।
भारतीयनाट्यकला धर्मादिपुरुषार्थप्राप्तेः मार्गं प्रेरयन्ति। कर्नाटकराज्यस्य लोकनृत्तमिति प्रसिद्धा यक्षगानकला भक्तिमार्गमेव पोषयति। भागवतादिपुराणेभ्यः रामायणभारतादिमहाकाव्येभ्यःचितम् इतिवृत्तमादाय असौ कला प्रवर्तते। अतः अत्र भक्तिः अनुस्यूतसूत्रं वर्तते। वैष्णवभक्तिप्रसारे यक्षगानपरम्परा इत्यस्मिन् शोधलेखे क्लेशघ्न्यादिभक्तेः प्रसाराय यक्षगानकला निजपरम्परां कथं विस्तारयतीति विस्तृततया विचार्यते।

column11: शब्दशक्तिमूलसंलक्ष्यक्रमध्वनेः लक्ष्यस्थलविचारः
column13: साहित्यशास्त्रे अभिधालक्षणाव्यञ्जनाः इति तिस्रः शब्दवृत्तयः अङ्गीकृताः।वृत्तित्रयेषु व्यञ्जनाव्यापारस्यैव प्राधान्यम्।सः व्यापारः कुत्र कदा कथं प्रयुज्यते इत्यस्मिन् विषये आलङ्कारिकाणां मध्ये अस्ति वैमत्यम्। तत्र पण्डितराजजगन्नाथस्य मतं मम्मटस्य मतापेक्षया भिन्नं वर्तते । नानार्थकपदप्रयोगस्थले अर्थान्तरस्य बोधः व्यञ्जनया भवतीति मम्मटाचार्यस्य एनं सिद्धान्तं सप्रमाणं खण्डयित्वा तत्रापि अभिधा वर्तते इति स्वसिद्धान्तं कथमुपस्थापितं जगन्नाथेन रसगङ्गाधरनामके ग्रन्थे शब्दशक्तिमूलध्वनेर्लक्ष्यस्थलनिरूपणावसरे तद् अस्मिन् शोधप्रबन्धे आलोचयिष्यते ।

column11: Chandonuśāsana of Vāgbhaṭa : An Unpublished Jain Text on Prosody
column13:
For hundreds of of years, Jain authors have been contributing to the Sanskrit literature of various types. From Shastric works to classical literature, Jain authors have not kept a single stone unturned. Chandas-śāstra, the science of prosody is one of the fields that has a huge contribution from Jain authors. The texts like Chandonuśāsana of Hemacandra Sūri and Kavidarpaṇa of an unknown Jain author have proved themselves as milestones of prosody. Having said that, it must be mentioned that many more original works as well as commentaries on other famous Jain and non-Jain works are still lying in a manuscript form and waiting for their turn to be published.
	One of such texts is Chandonuśāsana of Vāgbhaṭa with his own commentary (svopajña tika) named as vivaraṇa. Two manuscripts of this text are available out of which one is known for more than last half a century. Even then, there has been no effort for publishing it. The present paper aims at introducing this very text to the scholarly world. The main points covered

column11: INTRODUCTION TO MAJOR WORKS OF SANSKRIT DRAMATURGY
column13:
INTRODUCTION TO ACTOR AND SPECTATOR STUDY BASED ON SELECTED SANSKRIT TREATISES ON DRAMATURGY .

 Studying the dynamics of actors and spectators in Sanskrit dramaturgy can be a fascinating exploration . Some of the key treatises on this topic include Natya Shastra by Bharata Muni , Abhinavabharati by Abhinavagupta , and Dasarupaka by Dhananjaya , Natyadarpana by Ramachandra and Gunachandra , Natakalaksanaratnakosa by Sagaranandin , Bhavaprakasana by Saradathanaya . Indian Dramaturgy has a long history of its own : it begins from the speculations of Bharata the author of the famous Natyashastra . The Natyashastra is the oldest known treatise on performative arts in South Asia . The Natyashastra is an encyclopedia that covers every facet of a performance . This ancient text by Bharata Muni is considered the foundational work on Indian aesthetics and dramaturgy . It delves into various aspects of theater , including the role of the actor , and the engagement of the spectator . In these treatises , can explore the intricacies of rasa ( emotional aesthetics ) , abhinaya ( expression

column11: महाभारते प्रयुक्तपदेषु समासात्मिकावृत्तिघटितसन्दिग्धपञ्चपदानां संशीतिनिर्णयपुरःसरं शब्दशास्त्रीयदिशा तदपाकृतिः
column13:
महाभारते प्रयुक्तपदेषु समासात्मिकावृत्तिघटितसन्दिग्धपञ्चपदानां संशीतिनिर्णयपुरःसरं शब्दशास्त्रीयदिशा तदपाकृतिः ।
नापदं शास्त्रे प्रयुञ्जीत इति महाभाष्यवचनात् पदानि एव शास्त्रेषु प्रयोक्तव्यानि इति धिया पदशास्त्रीयविधिभिः साधुभूतानि पदानि एव प्रयोक्तव्यानि । परन्तु शास्त्रेषु प्रयुक्तेषु पदेषु क्वचित्संशीतिर्जायते । शास्त्रेषु मूर्धन्यभूतं हि व्यासप्रणीतं महाभारतम् । तत्र प्रयुक्तपदेषु बहुत्रैव संशीतिरुत्पद्यते । तेषां संशीतिपरिष्करणपूर्वकं निराकरणमेव मच्छोधप्रतिपाद्यमिति । अतो मदीयशोधप्रबन्धस्य शीर्षकं तावत् – महाभारते प्रयुक्तपदेषु समासात्मिकावृत्तिघटितसन्दिग्धपञ्चपदानां संशीतिनिर्णयपुरःसरं शब्दशास्त्रीयदिशा तदपाकृतिः । इति । संशीतीनां वैविध्यात् किंविधसंशीतीनामिह निराकरणमिति चेत् – समासात्मिकावृत्तिघटिता या संशीतिः, तस्या एव उद्घाटनपूर्वकं निराकरणमिति । यद्यपि वैयासिके महाभारते अष्टादश पर्वाणि विलसन्ति, तेन संशयात्मकस्थलानि तु विविधस्थलेभ्य एव चितानि । ननु संशीतीनामेतासां निराकरणं कथं विधास्यते इति चेत् शब्दशास्त्रीयदिशेति शेषः। शब्दशास्त्रत्वेन कस्य परामर्शः इति चेत् पाणिनीयव्याकरणस्येति

column11: Concept of sanatan dharma with special reference to World other religion
column13:
Dharma is an ancient Sanskrit term with the variety of definitions. These include 
Right way of living (Hinduism), Comic law and order (Buddhism), Path of 
righteousness (Sikhism)
The common theme through all these definitions is
A certain way of living and being that is aligned with the grand plan for humanity.
Sanatana is a Sanātana Dharma meaning "eternal dharma", is an alternative term 
used by some Hindus to refer to Hinduism instead of the term Hindu Dharma. The 
term denotes the "eternal" or absolute set of duties or religiously ordained practice 
incumbent upon all Hindus , regardless of class ,caste . the term is found in Sanskrit 
and other Indian language. The term Sanatana refers to that which is eternal and 
dharma is generally understood to be law or the order of things. When we look at 
history of the term, the term dharma Is known early as in the Rigveda.Moksha is the 
ultimate goal of Sanatana dharma .It talks about peace and prosperity.It says where 
there is peace there is progress .

column11: Rangaramanujas's view on Bhakti and Prapatti Special Reference with Chandogyopanisad
column13:
In Rangaramanuja's commentary on the Chandogya Upanishad, Bhakti (devotion) and Prapatti (self-surrender) are central concepts. Here's how he interprets these ideas in the context of the Upanishad:

Bhakti:

- Rangaramanuja emphasizes the importance of Bhakti as a means to realize the Ultimate Reality (Brahman).
- He sees Bhakti as a cultivation of love and devotion towards Brahman, leading to a deepening of one's relationship with the Divine.
- In his commentary on the Chandogya Upanishad, Rangaramanuja highlights verses that illustrate the power of Bhakti, such as "Tat Tvam Asi" (That Thou Art), which he interprets as a declaration of the devotee's identity with Brahman.

Prapatti:

- Rangaramanuja stresses Prapatti as a crucial aspect of spiritual growth, involving surrender of the ego and individual will to Brahman.
- He sees Prapatti as a means to transcend the limitations of the individual self and merge with the Ultimate Reality.
- In his commentary, Rangaramanuja explains that Prapatti is not mere passive surrender but an active engagement with Brahman

column11: A study of Raginis in the light of Ayurveda and Music Therapy
column13:
āyurveda is medical science. Though Indian classical music is popular art form it can also be used as therapy for some diseases and interestingly it is  directly related to the tridoṣa theory of āyurveda.  āyurveda believes that disease is the consequence of imbalance of these three doṣās. It is already proven that svarās and rāga samaya  are directly related to vāta, pitta, kapha. Music therapy works on this idea of interrelation of tridoṣa and musical notes, rāga samaya . Even bṛhattrayi of  āyurveda also contains the knowledge of music therapy. 
               Ancient treatises of music such as saṃgīta makaraṃda, saṃgīta pārijāta, saṃgīta ratnākara have discussed in detail about music. Among these saṃgīta makaraṃda  has mentioned rāgās  and rāgiṇīs. It menas there are rāgās with masculine element and rāgiṇīs with feminine element in classical music. saṃgīta darpaṇa was the first musical treatise to discuss about the rāgā and rāgiṇīs. This paper will deal with the critical study of  rāgiṇīs.

column11: Moral and Ethical Reasoning for today's Adolescents
column13:
This article aims at providing Indian Knowledge System (IKS) based content for the course on Moral and Ethical Reasoning for students in adolescent stage (Ages 12 to 18, which includes the grade 9 students). Closer to adulthood, adolescent children begin to develop their own moral values while questioning and analysing the ones set by their parents or society.  They value rules, but also negotiate. As they develop abstract reasoning abilities, they display interest in the larger good for society. Hence value education for them needs to include reasoning as a critical component.
Moral and Ethical Reasoning can be defined as the process that involves applying logic and principles to resolve conflict, between Moral and Ethical issues, in the right way.
This article aims to draw from IKS, moral principles and illustrate on how these can be applied in contemporary situations for resolving conflicts involving moral and ethical issues.  The contents of this article can be used as reference to create a detailed course on Moral and Ethical Reasoning for current day adolescents.

column11: विध्यर्थ-सूत्रार्थ-विचार
column13: विधिनिमन्त्रणामन्त्रणाधीष्टसम्प्रश्नप्रार्थनेषु लिङ् सूत्रस्थ ‘विधि’ तथा ‘अधीष्ट’ शब्दों में क्या अर्थभेद है क्योंकि ये दोनों ही नियोग अथवा प्रवर्त्तनारूप हैं और प्रवर्त्तना प्रवर्त्तकनिष्ठ प्रवृत्त्यनुकूल व्यापार को कहा जाता है। इसका उत्तर है कि ‘विधि’ का अर्थ प्रेरण अथवा प्रेषण है अर्थात् भृत्यादि को किसी काम को करने के लिए लगाना या आदेश देना जबकि ‘अधीष्ट’ का अर्थ है गुरु आदि किसी पूजनीय व्यक्ति को सत्कारपूर्वक किसी कार्य के लिए व्यापारण कराना अथवा लगाना। इन दोनों शब्दों को समझाने के लिए तथा शब्दशक्ति के विषय को व्युत्पादित करने के लिए इन दोनों शब्दों के अर्थों में भेद मानकर यहाँ ‘विधि’ और ‘निमन्त्रण’ आदि शब्दों का भेदपूर्वक ग्रहण किया गया है । वस्तुतः प्रेरणारूप विधिरूपता यहाँ इन विधिनिमन्त्रणादि सभी शब्दों में विद्यमान है।

column11: समासगत पदों में शक्ति-स्वीकार्यता में दोष
column13:
न्यायशास्त्र में समस्तपद में एक शक्ति न स्वीकार कर समस्तपद के घटक पदों से अभिधा वृत्ति के द्वारा विवक्षित अर्थ का बोध माना गया है। वैयाकरण आचार्य समास के घटक पदों में शक्तिस्वीकार्यता का खण्डन करते हुए अनेक दोषों को उपस्थित करते हैं। प्रस्तुत शोधपत्र में इन्हीं दोषों की विवेचना प्रस्तुत है। यथा एकार्थीभाववादी वैयाकरण कहते हैं, चित्रगु इत्यादि समस्त पद की ‘चित्रगोस्वामी’ अर्थ में शक्ति स्वीकार किए बिना इस समस्त पद का अर्थबोध सम्भव नहीं है। गो इस अर्थ में चित्र पद के अर्थ का अभेद रूप से अन्वय सम्भव नहीं है। वैयाकरणों के अनुसार चित्र पद को यदि मात्र तात्पर्यग्राहक माना जाएगा तो बहुव्रीहि समास ही असम्भव हो जाएगा। समास में शक्ति स्वीकार न करने का अभिप्राय है कि नैयायिक पूरे समुदाय को प्रत्यय की प्रकृति स्वीकार नहीं करते हैं। इस स्थिति में ‘चित्रगुमानय’ इत्यादि वाक्यों में द्वितीया विभक्ति के अर्थ कर्मत्व का चित्रगोस्वामी अर्थ से अन्वय नहीं हो पायेगा।
	चित्रगु इस समस्त पद में शक्ति स्वीकार न करने पर यह पद अर्थ से युक्त न होने से इसकी प्रातिपदिक सञ्ज्ञा नहीं होगी और प्रातिपदिक सञ्ज्ञा के अभाव में चित्रगु पद से उत्तर सुप् प्रत्ययों का विधान नहीं हो पाएगा। इस स्थिति में सभी समस्त पद असाधु हो

column11: KEY MORAL VALUES EMBEDDED IN FRIENDSHIP IN THE MAHABHARATA
column13:
Key Moral values embedded in a friendship Friendship plays In the Mahabharata 
Significant role in the Indian epic , Mahabharata . One of the most famus examples of friendship in the Mahabharata is the friendship between Lord Krishna and Arjuna . Krishna Served ad Arjuna ' & Chariateer and guide during the Kurukshetra War , offering him advise and Wisdom in times of need . Another notable example of friendship in the Mahabharata it the bond between Duryodhana and Karna . Despite their flaws , their friendship is characterized by loyalty and unwavering support for each other . The pandavas also demonstrate Strong bonds of friendship among themselves . Yudhishthira , Bhima , Arjuna , Nakula and Sahadeva stand by each other through thick and thin , facing numerous challenges together . Overall , friendship in the Mahabharata e portrayed as a and enduring bond that can powerful Withstand trials and tribulations

column11: An Earnest Attempt to Elucidate the Theoretical Framework of Life After Death
column13: Throughout history, the concept of life after death has captivated the attention of philosophers, writers, and scholars. Even in today's society, the youth in Indian culture continue to be deeply curious and intrigued by this age-old question. The mystery of whether there exists life after death, the nature of that existence, and the possibility that death may be the ultimate end are among the profound inquiries that have captivated humankind for generations. This comprehensive theoretical paper endeavors to grapple with these complex questions, delving into the philosophical perspectives on life after death and exploring the potential impact of these profound questions on human development. By analyzing a wide range of Indian literature, the insights of Indian philosophers, and the perspectives of foreign thinkers, this paper seeks to offer a comprehensive understanding of this timeless and thought-provoking subject-matter.

column11: A Critical Appreciation of Ovī Gītā and Bhāvānuvādita Bhagavadgītā of Shri Ashvinikumar D. Vedanti
column13: The Śrīmadbhagavadgītā holds a globally recognized status as an influential and revered treatise that provides profound guidance across all dimensions of human life. It serves as a guiding light, offering invaluable wisdom to human beings as they traverse their unique paths towards their ultimate destination. Spanning many years, this esteemed text has continued to inspire numerous translations, each contributing to its rich legacy. Notably, among these translations are the Ovī Gītā and Bhāvānuvādita Bhagavadgītā, both authored by Shri Ashvinikumar Dhundiraj Vedanti. Drawing inspiration from the Jñāneśvarī of Santa Jñāneśvara, these works are presented in Marathi and Gujarati, respectively. This paper will undertake a comprehensive exploration of the nuanced translation style employed by the author in these two significant works.

column11: General Introduction to Darsanas and A study on Setu (commentary on Prashasthapadabhashya)
column13: In India the philosophical Interpretation of the reality is called Darsana . Indian philosophical systems are broadly classified into two Astika ) ( Theistic ) and Nästika ( Atheistic ) darshana . Astika ) accept the authority of Vedas . They are Samkhya ,, Yoga , Nyaya , Vaiśeşika , Pūrva Mīmāṁsā , and Uthara Mīmāṁsā . Nāstika do not accept the authority of Vedas . They are Cārvāka , Baudha , and Jaina . The great Indian philosopher Prasastapāda wrote Prasastapāda Bhasya ( collection of properties of matter ) and is a commentary on the Vaiśesika sutras of Kanada of 2nd century BC . The text discusses the properties of motion . Prasastapāda Bhāṣya actually not a commentary but an independence compendium of the tenets of the Vaisesika School . Prasastapāda describes the dissolution of the earth , water , air and fire in terms of their atomic constituents but excludes space because space is non - atomic . With regard to the conjoining and disjoining of atoms he includes a higher will or order as the guiding principle of universal dissolution which over rides the natural karma of atoms

column11: संस्कृतकाव्यमालिकायां सौन्दर्यशास्त्रम्
column13: संस्कृतकाव्येषु सौन्दर्यशास्त्रं (Aesthetics) विशेषतया विविधसंस्कृतिषु व्याप्तानां तत्त्वानां, भावनानां, दर्शनानां च मेलने सम्पूर्णतया परिलक्ष्यते। प्रकृतिरपि सौन्दर्यस्य एका विशिष्टा भूमिका निर्वहति। प्रकृतिः सर्वं सजीवं, निर्जीवं च तत्त्वं सम्मिल्य, एकं भव्यं सौन्दर्यं प्रकटयति। प्रकृतौ विद्यमानं सौन्दर्यं न केवलं नेत्रसुखाय अपि तु आत्मनः आनन्दाय, शांतये, चित्तप्रसादाय च कल्प्यते। चिन्तामणिद्वारकानाथदेशमुखकृतः “संस्कृतकाव्यमालिका” नाम्नेस्मिन् ग्रन्थे  बहुसांस्कृतिकसौन्दर्यमाध्यमेन विविधसंस्कृतिनां सौन्दर्यात्मकानुभवः प्रतिपाद्यते। देशमुखवर्यः स्वीयकाव्येषु प्रकृतिं केवलं सौन्दर्यं रूपेण न निरीक्षन्ति, अपितु तस्य भावात्मकमाध्यात्मिकञ्च पक्षमपि गणयन्ति। संस्कृतकाव्यं न केवलं भारतस्य प्राचीनसंस्कृतिं, अपितु अन्येषां संस्कृतिनां आदानं-प्रदानं च दर्शयति। यत्र काव्ये प्राचीनभारतीयसांस्कृतिकतत्त्वानि, विश्वस्यान्यसंस्कृतिषु स्थितानि सौन्दर्यदृष्टयः च सम्मिलिताः सन्ति। तत्र अलङ्काराः, रसाः, प्रतीकाश्च अन्यसंस्कृतिष्वपि विद्यमानाः सन्ति, यैः काव्ये साकल्येन वैश्विकसौन्दर्यं प्रतिपाद्यते। अतः संस्कृतकाव्यमालिकायाम् अन्तर्जातीयसांस्कृतिकसौन्दर्यस्य प्रतिफलनं दृष्टिगोचरं भवति।

column11: Vedic Deities
column13: The Vedic age which was also called as the Vedic period is dated between 1500 BC – 600 BC.  This coincides with the period of later Bronze age & early Iron age.  It is said to be the backbone of Hinduism.   It predominantly took place in the Indus Valley civilization & later in the Indo – Gangetic plains, which was the primary site for the development of the Vedic age. The Vedic religion was mainly based on sacrifices/yagnas for the propitiation of the various Vedic deities; the principal yagnas were the Soma yagna, Ashwamedha/Horse sacrifice, Somasava yagna , Putrakameshti yagna , Darsapurnamaasa yagna , Vajapeya sacrifice etc. These sacrifices include various deities which are mentioned in the Vedas, the Aranyakas , the Kalpas, the Purvamimasa Sastras. These elaborated on various aspects of the sacrifice such as creation of sacrificial altar, the methods of conducting the sacrifice, the qualifications of the priest and the sacrificial offerings needed.    These deities which were invoked in particular sacrifices were said to have been worshipped in the three yugas of Satya, Treta &

column11: शृङ्खलामूलकालंकारनिरूपणे मम्मटविश्वनाथमतयोः समीक्षणम्
column13: सुप्राचीनकालात् काव्यरचनायामलंकारस्य वहुलव्यवहारो दृश्यते। अलंकारशास्त्रस्य सर्वप्रथमं प्राप्तो ग्रन्थो भरतविरचितं नाट्यशास्त्रम्। तदनन्तरं भामहोद्भटरुद्रटवामनादीनां ग्रन्था विरचिताः। अधुना को नामालंकार इति प्रश्नः समुदेति। अलंकारस्य स्वरूपकथनावसरे आदौ तावद् मम्मटविश्वनाथयोर्मतालोचनं विधेयम्। मम्मटप्रणीते काव्यप्रकाशे काव्यमवलम्ब्य रसालंकारगुणदोषादयो ये विषया वर्तन्ते तेषां सम्यग् विमर्शो दृश्यते। विश्वनाथमते अलंकाराः शब्दार्थयोऽस्थिरा अनित्या वा धर्माः। ते च शोभातिशय्यविधायकाः। अलंकारवैचित्रप्रकारोऽनन्तः। भामह – दण्डि – वामन – रुद्रट – मम्मट – रुय्यक – विश्वनाथ - जगन्नाथादिभिरालंकारिकैः बहवोऽलंकारा निरूपिताः। काव्यप्रकाशे एकषष्ठिसंख्यका अर्थालंकारा मम्मटेन बिनिर्मिताः। विश्वनाथपरिगणितार्थालंकाराणां संख्या हि द्व्यशीतिः। एतेषामलंकाराणां केचिदौपम्यमूलकाः, केचिद्वास्तवमूलकाः, केचिद्न्यायमूलकाः, केचिद् शृङ्खलामूलकाः। एतेषां मध्ये मम्मटविश्वनाथोभयपरिगणिताः शृङ्खलामूलकालंकारा यथा - एकावली, कारणमाला, सारो मालदीपकञ्च। अलंकारशास्त्रे गाढवन्धनार्थे शृङ्खला - शब्दस्य वहुलोव्यवहारो दृश्यते। शृङ्खलायां यथा अनेकावयवाः सन्ति तद्वत् अलंकारेऽपि पूर्वेनांशेन सह परवर्तिनो अंशस्य बन्धनो दृश्यते। एकावल्

column11: Vedic Deities
column13: The Vedic age which was also called as the Vedic period, is dated between 1500 BC – 600 BC.  This coincides with the period of later Bronze age & early Iron age.  Some proclaim that the Vedic age is the backbone of Hinduism and the entire religion was built on the foundations of the Vedas.  It predominantly took place in the Indus Valley civilization and later in the Indo – Gangetic plains which was the primary site for the development of the Vedic age. The Vedic religion was mainly based on sacrifices or yagnas for the propitiation of the various Vedic deities; the principal yagnas were the Soma yagna, Ashwamedha or horse sacrifice, Somasava yagna, Putrakameshti yagna, Darsapurnamaasa yagna, Vajapeya yagna and many others. These sacrifices were for various deities which are mentioned in the Vedas, the Aranyakas, the Kalpas and the Purvamimasa Sastras. The Vedic verses elaborated on various aspects of the sacrifice such as creation of sacrificial altar, the methods of conducting the sacrifice, the qualifications of the priest and the sacrificial offerings needed. These deities which

column11: अध्यापक शिक्षा के सन्दर्भ में आचार्य परम्परा का भूमिका
column13:
आचार्य परम्परा एक प्राचीन भारतीय परंपरा है जिसमें ज्ञान की शिक्षा गुरु-शिष्य परंपरा के माध्यम से होती है। इस परंपरा में गुरु अपने छात्रों को न केवल शैक्षिक ज्ञान देते हैं बल्कि उन्हें धार्मिक, नैतिक, और सामाजिक मूल्यों को सिखाते हैं। यह परंपरा वैदिक संस्कृति में महत्वपूर्ण है और आज भी कुछ धार्मिक एवं सांस्कृतिक संस्थानों में इसका पालन किया जाता है। आचार्य परंपरा शिक्षा के क्षेत्र में भी महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाती है, जहां शिक्षक अपने छात्रों को गहरे आदर्शों और ज्ञान के साथ-साथ शिक्षा के असली अर्थ को समझाते हैं।
अध्यापक शिक्षा एक विशेषक शिक्षा क्षेत्र है जो उन लोगों को तैयार करता है जो शिक्षा के क्षेत्र में शिक्षक, प्रोफेसर, शैक्षिक निदेशक, और अन्य शैक्षणिक नौकरियों के लिए तैयार होते हैं। इसमें विभिन्न शिक्षा के सिद्धांतों, शिक्षण प्रक्रियाओं, शिक्षा प्रौद्योगिकी, छात्रों के मनोविज्ञान, शिक्षा नीति, और अन्य शैक्षिक मुद्दों का अध्ययन और अनुसंधान शामिल होता है। इसका उद्देश्य शिक्षा क्षेत्र में उत्कृष्टता को प्रोत्साहित करना और शिक्षा प्रणालियों को सुधारना है। अध्यापक शिक्षा के संदर्भ में आचार्य परंपरा का क्या महत्वपूर्ण  भूमिका हे उसकी संपूर्ण विवरण शोध पत्र में प्रस्तुत किया जायेगा ।

column11: गीता के कर्म योग की आधुनिक काल में प्रासंगिकता
column13:
गीता के कर्म योग की आधुनिक काल में प्रासंगिकता

नाम: स्वरूप मिलिंद काणे 

भारत की परंपरा और संस्कृति बहोत विस्तारित स्वरूप की है| इसी प्रवाह में बहोत से संपन्न विषय आते है।इसी भारतीय परंपरा में से अत्यंत पवित्र और मनुष्य के जीवन का आधार अर्थात भगवद्गीता है|  
मनुष्य जीवन नश्वर है ये परमसत्य है लेकिन जितना भी जीवन शेष है उसको और जीवन के कर्मोका निर्वहन (कर्मण्येवाधिकारी मा फलेषु कदाचन । मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भुर्मा ते संगोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥) इस गीता के श्लोक के अनुसार किस तरह जिया जाए ये जानना आवश्यक है।
आज तक भगवद्गीता पर कित्येक ज्ञानी और जानकार लोगोने साहित्य की रचना की है। भगवद्गीता जीवन क्या ये सिर्फ उधृत नही करती बल्कि जीवन कैसे जीना चाहिए ये भी बात बहोत ही सरल प्रकार से उधृत की है।
आज का दौर विज्ञान और तकनीकी का है। लेकिन आज के दौर में जीवन व्यतीत करते समय परंपरा में आया हुआ ज्ञान किस तरह उपयोग में लाना है इसका दुर्भाग्यवश विस्मरण हो गया है। गीता तो सबको पता है लेकिन उसमे क्या क्या विषय किस किस प्रकार से आते है ये पता नहीं
होता।

column11: प्राकृत के प्रचार मे ब्राह्मी लिपी का योगदान
column13:
लिपी या लेखन प्रणाली का अर्थ होता है किसी भी भाषा मे लेखन का तरीका | लिपी के जरीये ध्वनियों को लिखा जाता है | लिपी और भाषा दोनो अलग अलग होते है | भाषा को बोला जाता है और इसे किसी भी लिपी में लिखा जाता है | कुछ विद्वानों का मानना है कि “लिपि शब्द” ॲकमेनियन “दिपी” से बना है।
ब्राह्मी लिपी को विश्व की प्राचिन लिपि माना जाता है | भारत देश के सबसे प्राचीन शिलालेख इसी लिपि में उपलब्ध है | अजमेर जिले के बडली गाव में प्राकृत भाषा के प्राचीन शिलालेख मिलते है | इसाका समय ओझा जी ने ५ वी सदी ई. पूर्व माना है | ब्राह्मी लिपि ब्रह्मणों के प्रयोग के लिये विकसित कि गई है इसलिये उसका नाम ब्राह्मी लिपि पडा है ऐसी मान्यता है और जैन धर्म कि मान्यता के अनुसार भ. वृषभ देव जी ने अपनी पुत्री ब्राह्मी को इसी लिपी में लिखना सिखाया इसलिये उसका नाम ब्राह्मी लिपि पडा है | 
प्राकृत शिलालेख में ब्राह्मी लिपी का स्थान सम्राट अशोक, सम्राट खारवेल, आदि शिलालेखों में ब्राम्ही, खरोष्ठी लिपि मिलती है | इस लिपि का एतिहासिक तथा पुरातत्त्वीय महत्त्व भी मिलता है जो अभ्यासनीय है |

column11: Influence of Darshnas on Indian Culture: A Perspective of Poornavad
column13:
The present Indian Culture & Tradition is an outcome of the perennial tradition of Ancient Indian Thought that has the roots of it’s resent form. The objective of this paper is to probe into the impact of Darshans on Indian culture and the need of Poornavad for reaching an integrated harmony for a better assimilation of different parts of Indian culture & tradition. 
This Study is limited to examination of the impact of Samkhya, Yoga and Vedant on the varied aspects of Indian culture and the perspectives of Poornavad as envisaged by Dr. Ramchandra Parnerkar in his doctoral thesis ‘Poornavad’. The hypothesis of this paper is that the Visions of Poornavad can be helpful in eradicating the negative aspects of the influence of Samkhya; Yoga & Vedant on present Indian Culture & Visions of the public at large.

column11: Rasa Prakaraṇaṁ- through the vision of Gaudīya vaiśnavism
column13: Rasa, which means to taste or relish, is a fundamental need of humans. Humans seek experiences to relish rasas. Rasa or mellow gives ultimate delight as stated in the Taittarīya upaniśad.                                                                                                                                                         The topmost rasa, or the most relished and enjoyed mellow is prema-rasa or love which everyone yearns for. Love is the supreme value where all other rasas prevail. The obvious absence of ego in pure love develops monism with the lover. Still, it is simultaneously separated to experience the mellows of love and perform loving devotional services unto the lover. This thought of the Gaudīyas is known as Acintya bhedābheda, propagated by Caitanya Mahāprabhu. However, it is impossible to fully experience any rasa in this world full of miseries and transience.                                                                                                                     Krishna, the master of rasas, as Rasarāja is the refuge of all rasas.

column4: The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara.
column11: An Earnest Attempt to Elucidate the Theoretical Framework of Life After Death
column13: Throughout history, the concept of life after death has captivated the attention of philosophers, writers, and scholars. Even in today's society, the youth in Indian culture continue to be deeply curious and intrigued by this age-old question. The mystery of whether there exists life after death, the nature of that existence, and the possibility that death may be the ultimate end are among the profound inquiries that have captivated humankind for generations. This comprehensive theoretical paper endeavors to grapple with these complex questions, delving into the philosophical perspectives on life after death and exploring the potential impact of these profound questions on human development. By analyzing a wide range of Indian literature, the insights of Indian philosophers, and the perspectives of foreign thinkers, this paper seeks to offer a comprehensive understanding of this timeless and thought-provoking subject-matter.

भाष्यलौकिकन्यायानां स्वरुपं वर्णयाम्यहम्।।" 
भाषा ही समुदायस्य महान् वाङनिधिः। भाषासु प्रथम व्याकृतत्वेन प्रकृतिप्रत्ययादिविभागैः देवभाषा संस्कृतम् इत्युच्यते। भाषाम् अनुसृत्य व्याकरण गच्छति। पाणिनि कात्यायन पतञ्जलिषु 'यथोत्तरं मुनीनां प्रामाण्यम्' इति पतञ्जलेः सिद्धान्ता एवात्र शास्त्रे प्रमाणरुपेण वैयाकरणैः अङ्गीक्रियन्ते।

column11: Dream-Consciousness in तव जवाधरमन्मयरेखासु of A. R. Mishra
column13:
Dream-Consciousness in तव जवाधरमन्मयरेखासु of A.R.Mishra
Dr. Pinki Das
Assistant Professor
Department of Sanskrit
Purnidevi Chowdhury Girls’ College
Bolpur, Birbhum, West Bengal, Pin 731204, India.

A. R. Mishra is a celebrated poet in Sanskrit and Odia. Beside his eight collections of Odia poems and two collections of odia mini stories, he has to his credit five collections of post modern Sanskrit poems where he became the pioneer of post modernist  Sanskrit poet.  In the present attempt we wish to discuss the concept of dream as utilized by the poet in his first book of Sanskrit poems- Tava Javādhara- manmayarekhāsu(2018).

	Our poet claims that God has created this world of colourful flowers, honey drenched dreams, desire to touch leaves and love-sport of the sprouts for  pleasure and imagination about the creation. But his dreams drenched with honey has some connection with the Rigvedic Madhuvidyā –  

“हे पुष्पवृक्षाणां प्रभो,/तुभ्यं मम कोटिप्रणामाः ।
मदर्थं त्वया निर्मितं वर्णिलपुष्पाणां राज्यम्,
मदर्थं सज्जिता मधुदिग्धाः स्वप्नाः,
पत्राणां स्पर्शलिप्सा/

column11: THE MEDICO-LEGAL IMPLICATIONS OF BHRŪṆAHATYĀ (FOETICIDE)
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
Bhrūṇahatyā refers to the killing of an embryo causing abortion, foeticide. Abortion can be either spontaneous or induced.  Induced abortion is termination of pregnancy usually carried out before the foetus attains the stage of viability at around 20 weeks of gestation, where it can exist separately from the mother. The recent Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Amendment Act of 2021 has liberalised abortion up to 24 weeks and beyond where the physical and mental health of the woman is at risk or if substantial foetal abnormalities are detected. In spite of such liberalisation of the law, many case reports of morbidity and /or mortality especially of rural and tribal women are being published who resort to unsafe termination of pregnancies either through self-infliction using methods passed on to them by the womenfolk in the family or by uncertified informal health-care providers practising traditional medicine.
     It is hence the aim of this paper to study the medico-legal implications of bhrūṇahatyā during ancient times. The ancient medical texts such as Śuśruta

column4: Indira Gandhi National Tribal University, Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh
column11: Vanishing of Hasalaru Culture in Karnataka
column13: This paper explores the multifaceted challenges faced by the Hasalaru tribe in Karnataka, leading to a gradual erosion of their cultural heritage. Through ethnographic research and interviews with community members, the study delves into the factors contributing to this cultural decline. These include socio-economic pressures, assimilation into mainstream society, and the impact of modernization on traditional practices. The paper also examines the efforts being made to preserve Hasalaru culture, such as community initiatives, cultural revitalization programs, and government policies. By understanding the complexities of this cultural erosion, the paper aims to contribute to ongoing discussions and efforts to protect and promote Hasalaru heritage.

column11: Non-Canonical Subjects and Their Impact on Thematic Roles and Argument Structures: A Cross-Linguistic Study of Bengali and Telugu
column13: This study aims to examine the influences of non-canonical subjects on the thematic roles and argument structure of two linguistically and geographically diverse languages, i.e., Bengali (an Indo-Aryan Language) and Telugu (a Dravidian Language). The non-nominative subjects like dative, genitive, instrumental, and locative subjects have been noticed to affect the syntactic and semantic characteristics of sentences in several languages. The results of this study contribute to the ongoing debate on the nature of the thematic relations and argument structure and try to establish a new point of view towards the cross-linguistic similarities. This study will be significant for linguistic theories as well as language acquisition. It will further be helpful to develop more refined models of language comprehension and production. The study implements a combination of corpus analysis, and native speakers’ judgments on acceptability to explore the cases.

column11: Reflection of Environmental Awareness in the Yājñavalkya Smṛti
column13:
Environment plays a very significant role in human civilization. Human beings have close relations with the biosphere in which they live. The whole environment and ecology consisting of earth, air, water, plants and animals provide the necessary and sufficient conditions for sustaining life.
The aim and objective of this study are to showcase the Yājñavalkya Smṛti of taking care of the environment. The Yājñavalkya Smṛti is not only rich in grammatical composition and romantic expression but also in knowledge about the environment, its destruction and the need for its protection which come up in many contexts now and then whenever any attempt is made to study this literature. Starting from the Vedic age till now it carries some appearances in the writings of scholars. This needs to be explored in detail as the vast size and span of it leaves enough scope for researchers to dig up those of knowledge.

column11: Bridging Sanskrit Aesthetic Theories with Communication Models and Elements
column13:
Bridging Sanskrit Aesthetic Theories with Communication Models and Elements

Asha.E
Guest Faculty , Department of Sahithya
Central Sanskrit University


The famous poet Wordsworth gives his definition of poetry as ' The spontaneous
overflow of powerful feelings, it takes it's origin from emotions recollected in tranquillity'
Communication is the process by which information is exchanged between individuals
through a common system. Poetry is a beautiful way of communication and it's elements
have some connections with poetic theories. When we go through the origin and
developmental stages of Indian Aesthetic schools, each school seems to have dealt with
some particular model of communication theory. This paper intends to find out the
hidden connection with both theories and their common elements.

Professor Arun Ranjan Mishra was born in a village of Pandits near the Khurda town of Orissa in 1959. After his post graduation in Sanskrit from the Utkal University Bhubaneswar in 1982, he Proceed to the University of Pune (Maharashtra) and did his M.Phil and Ph.D. Degree in Indian logic (Nyāya, 1988). Then he was working there as a Research Associate in the Centre of Advanced Study in Sanskrit. He had won the Senior Fellowship at Gandhi Centre of Science and Human values in Bangalore in 1989. However he joined in the stream of Government College in Orissa through Orissa Public Service Commission in 1990.

column13:
शोध सारांश

विषय - प्राकृत जैन साहित्य में विविधता

किसी भी दर्शन या धर्म की विचारधारा को जानने के लिए उसके साहित्य का अध्ययन बहुत ही आवश्यक है। जैन साहित्य का अध्ययन भी उसके साहित्य के माध्यम से ही हो सकता है इसके लिए हम देखते हैं कि एक विशेष कालखंड में जैन साहित्य का विकास चरमोत्कर्ष पर था वह प्राकृत के प्रचलन का समय समझना चाहिए । प्राकृत भाषा का समय 500ई पूर से 1000 ई पू था। इस समय हम जैन साहित्य अधिकतर प्राकृत भाषा में ही पाते हैं और इस प्राकृत जैन साहित्य की यह विशेषता है कि यह विविधता धारण किए हुए है जिस  समय  जैन आचार्य लोक भाषा में साहित्य लिख रहे थे तब वह किसी एक सिद्धांत में बंधी हुई परीपाटी में साहित्य नाम लिखकर अलग-अलग विषयों विधाओं और प्राकृत की विभिन्न भाषाओं को साथ लेकर चल रहे थे।
                     प्राकृत जिसे प्रकृति की भाषा कहा जाता है ;उसे समय जनमानस की भाषा थी ।और जब वह साहित्य में स्थान पाने लगी तो वह धीरे-धीरे साहित्यिक रूप लेने लगी और बोली से भाषा के रूप में सामने आई। प्राकृत के जैन साहित्य पर जब हम दृष्टि डालते हैं तब हमें विषयगत विविधता दिखाई पड़ती है जैसे अध्यात्म विषयक ग्रंथ ,दर्शन विषयक ग्रंथ ,आचार विषयक ग्रंथ ,छंद

column11: Concept of Non-Violence in Jainism
column13:
The Concept of Non-violence in Jainism

Non-violence, or Ahimsa, is the foundational principle of Jainism, without which the philosophy of Jainism is incomplete. In fact, no religion or philosophy in the world can truly exist without the principle of non-violence. All living beings cherish life. No creature willingly sacrifices its offspring for its own survival. Just as life is valuable to humans, it is equally precious to every living being. No animal desires to be harmed or killed. Every being is born with the instinct to live, not to die, and seeks happiness rather than sorrow throughout its life. Therefore, the desire to live and avoid harm is universal. In Jainism, this universal value is encapsulated in the principle of non-violence, which is the very foundation of the Jain religion.

column11: बौद्ध धम्म में सजगता
column13:
बौद्धधम्म में सजगता
- विजयकुमार बुद्धप्पा झुंबरे 
एम.ए. (पालि एण्ड बुद्धिज्म)
विश्व में अनेक धार्मिक अथवा साम्प्रदायिक परम्पराएँ एवं सिद्धान्त हैं। इनके माध्यम से मनुष्य अपने जीवन को सुखी एवं समृद्ध कर सकता है। मनुष्य अपने परिवेश, धार्मिक अथवा साम्प्रदायिक व्यवस्था के अनुसार सिद्धान्तों का पालन करता है।
हमारे देश में भी अनेक धार्मिक परम्पराएँ और साम्प्रदायिक सिद्धान्त हैं। समस्त दार्शनिक परम्पराओं में मानव-जीवन को सुखी, समृद्ध और पारलौकिक उद्देश्य की पूर्ति के लिए अपने-अपने ढंग से सिद्धान्त प्रतिपादित किये गये हैं। भारतीय धर्मों में बौद्धधर्म मनुष्य की दुःख-मुक्ति के साथ पारलौकिक निब्बान का मार्ग प्रशस्त करता है। यह लौकिक-दृष्टि से भी मनुष्य की सुख-शान्ति और समृद्धि हेतु कृत देशनाओं के माध्यम से मानवता को श्रेष्ठ जीवन का सन्देश प्रदान करता है। इसकी व्यावहारिकता एवं विस्तृत दृष्टि के कारण भारत में प्रादुर्भूत इस बौद्धधम्म का पालन आज लगभग पूरे विश्व में किया जा रहा  है। बौद्धधम्म के प्रतिपादक शाक्यमुनि तथागत बुद्ध ने मानव जीवन को दुःखमय बताया तथा इसका कारण, निदान एवं उपाय भी बताये हैं। चार आर्यों के द्वारा उन्होंने मानवीय जीवन को सुखी, शान्त एवं सुखमय बनाने का मार्ग बताया।

column11: थेरवादी बौद्ध धम्म में चाकमा जनजाति का योगदान
column13: चाकमा जनजाति जो मुख्य रूप से बांग्लादेश के चटगांव पहाड़ी क्षेत्र और भारत के पूर्वोत्तर राज्यों में निवास करती है, थेरवादी बौद्ध धर्म की अनुयायी रहे है। चाकमा जनजाति स्वयं को शाक्य कुल के वंशज मानती है। इस शोध पत्र मेंथेरवादी बौद्ध धर्म के संरक्षण और प्रसार में चकमा जनजाति के महत्वपूर्ण योगदान का विश्लेषण करेंगे। इस अध्ययन में चाकमा जनजाति द्वारा बौद्ध परंपराओं और रीति-रिवाजों की विशिष्टता को उजागर करता है, जो उनकी सांस्कृतिक पहचान का एक अभिन्न अंग हैं। यह अध्ययन यह भी दर्शाता है कि कैसे चकमा समुदाय ने अपनी धार्मिक प्रथाओं के माध्यम से न केवल बौद्ध धर्म को जीवंत रखा है, बल्कि इसे आधुनिक संदर्भ में भी प्रासंगिक बनाए रखा है। अंत में, यह शोध वर्तमान चुनौतियों और थेरवादी बौद्ध विरासत के संरक्षण के लिए चकमा समुदाय द्वारा किए जा रहे प्रयासों पर प्रकाश डालता है, जो उनके सांस्कृतिक और धार्मिक पहचान के संरक्षण के लिए महत्वपूर्ण हैं।

column11: ಕರಾವಳಿಯ ಕಲೆ "ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನ"
column13: ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನವು ಕರ್ನಾಟಕದ ಕರಾವಳಿಯ ಭಾಗದ ಒಂದು ಸಾಂಪ್ರದಾಯಿಕ ಜಾನಪದ ಕಲೆಯಾಗಿದೆ .ಇದು ಭಾಗವತಿಕೆ ಅಂದರೆ ಸಂಗೀತ ,ಕುಣಿತ ಮತ್ತು ಕಥೆಗಳನ್ನು ಒಳಗೊಂಡಿದೆ. ಇದು ಸುಮಾರು ೧೫೦ ವರ್ಷಗಳ ಹಿಂದೆ ಪ್ರಾರಂಭಗೊಂಡ ಕಲೆ.ನನ್ನ ಈ ಲೇಖನದಲ್ಲಿ ನಾನು ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನ ಕಲೆಯ ಇತಿಹಾಸದ ಬಗ್ಗೆ ಸಂಕ್ಷಿಪ್ತವಾಗಿ ಬರೆದಿದ್ದೇನೆ. ಅಂತೆಯೇ ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನದ  ವೇಷಭೂಷಣದ ಬಗ್ಗೆ , ಅದರಲ್ಲಿ ಬರುವ ಪಾತ್ರಗಳ ಬಗ್ಗೆಯೂ ವಿವರಣೆ ನೀಡಿದ್ದೇನೆ. ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನದ ವಿಧಗಳ ಬಗ್ಗೆಯೂ ನೀವು ಈ ಲೇಖನದಲ್ಲಿ ಓದಬಹುದು.ಅಷ್ಟೇ ಅಲ್ಲದೆ ಯಕ್ಷಗಾನದಿಂದ ಆಗುವ ವೈಜ್ಞಾನಿಕ ಪ್ರಯೋಜನಗಳು, ಇದನ್ನು ಮುಂದೆ ಹೇಗೆ ಸಂರಕ್ಷಿಸಬೇಕು , ಪೋಷಿಸಬೇಕು ಎಂಬುದನ್ನು ಕೂಡ ಈ ಲೇಖನದಲ್ಲಿ ಓದಬಹುದು.

column11: Therigatha ki Pramukh theriya
column13:
पालि साहित्य में थेरीगाथा का अपना महत्व है । इस थेरीगाथा में स्थविरी भिक्खुनीयों के जीवनानुभव जो उन्होंने स्वयं अपने बारे के व्यक्त किए है, जो संग्रहित है । इस ग्रंथ में ७३ बौद्ध भिक्खुणीयों के उदगार समाहित है, जो गाथा (काव्य स्वरूप) में है । इसमें कुल ५२२ गाथाए है । यहां हर थेरीगाथा जीवन का एक निश्चित संदेश देती है ।
	इस ग्रंथ में थेरियों ने, जो अर्हंत हुई थी, अपने जीवन के सत्य को, अपने जीवन के अनुभवों को लिखा है । इस में भिक्खूणी होने के पूर्व जीवन को और भिक्खुणी होने के बाद के जीवन को, जो उन्होने अनुभव किया, जाना, पहचाना उसे बहोत ही सुंदर तरीके से गाथाओ के माध्यम से भावपूर्ण ढंग से व्यक्त किया है । इसमें थेरीयों की विशेषता यह दिखाई देती है कि वे अपने पूर्व जीवन को बताने में कहीं संकोच नहीं करती है । और भिक्खूनि होने के बाद, अर्हंत पद को प्राप्त करने के बाद के जीवन का वर्णन करती है ।

column11: Diagrammatic Presentation of the Definition of Kāvya By Paṇditarāja Jagannātha
column13: The influence of Navya-Nyāya language and methodology in Rasagaṅgādhara of Jagannātha is worth mentioning. The 17th-century rhetorician, Jagannātha, has accomplished the Navya-Nyāya language to compose an ambiguity-free and accurate definition of kāvya. In the history of Indian poetics, the definition of kāvya given by Jagannātha is considered unique. This paper aims to present diagrammatically the definition of kāvya given by Jagannātha in his Rasagaṅgādhara. Some Navya-Nyāya technical terms are also explained in this regard.
