column11: KERALA COMMENTARIES OF ĀRYABHAṬĪYA
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13: Āryabhaṭīya of Āryabhaṭa is the earliest Independent work written in India, dealing exclusively with Mathematics. It deals with both Mathematics and Astronomy in a systematic manner. The text has many commentaries in various languages apart from Sanskrit, such as Malayalam, Telugu, Marathi and English. Bhāskara I is the earliest Sanskrit commentator of it. Bhaṭaprakāśa of Sūryadevayajva, Bhaṭapradīpa of Bhūtiviṣnu, Bhaṭadipika of Vaṭaśśeri Parameśwara, Āryabhaṭatantragaṇita7 of Kodaṇḍarāma are the major commentaries written in Sanskrit. The most important among these is the commentary of Keḷallūr Nīlakaṇṭha Somayāji.Other Sanskrit commentators are Prabhākara, Someśwara, Yallaya, Raghunātharāja, Munīśwara, Mādhava, Sudhākaradwivedi, Kamalākarabhaṭṭa and Ghaṭīgopa. Many commentaries on the Āryabhaṭīya were written from Kerala. However, most of these commentaries are in Sanskrit. The Malayalam commentators include Kṛṣṇadāsa, Kṛṣṇa (Bhāṣāyām Kṛṣṇa -tīkā), Ghaṭīgopa, Puliyur Purushotham

column11: पृथ्वीराजचरितम् के आधार पर पृथ्वीराज का नायकत्व
column13: पृथ्वीराजमहाकाव्यम् मध्यकाल का ऐतिहासिक महाकाव्य है। पृथ्वीराज बहुश्रुत नायक है जिनकी कथा केवल काव्यात्मक ही नहीं लौकिक है।ऐसे में महाकवि जयानक ने किस प्रकार लोक और शास्त्र का समन्वय किया है वह वस्तुतः गवेषणीय है।

column11: A STUDY OF PAṆḌITHARĀJA JAGANNĀDHA’S PANCHALAHARĪS
column13: The number of devotional (Stotra) lyrics in Sanskrit is so large that it is very difficult even to mention the names of the important ones. Stotra is a Sanskrit word, that means hymn of praise. A Stotra can be a prayer, a description, or a conversation, but always with a poetic structure. Stotra are a type of popular devotional literature. It may be a simple poem expressing praise and personal devotion to a deity or poems with embedded spiritual and philosophical doctrines. Paṇḍitharāja Jagannādha, was a poet, musician and literary critic who lived in the 17th century. He composed, Amṛta lahari, Gaṅgā lahari, Sudha lahari, Lakshmi lahari and Karuna lahari. Gaṅgā lahari and Amṛta lahari is the most known poem in praise of river Ganga and Yamuna. Lahari means extreme love of someone to something. It is literary genre of Indian religious texts designed to be melodically sung, in contrast to a shastra which is composed to be recited. Poets write devotional poetry when they want to share their love for something, usually God’s creation and their broader faith.

column11: Uncovering Cultural Dynamics in Vatsarāja’s Rukminīharaṇa
column13:
Abstract 

This paper examines "Rukminīharaṇa," a play written by Vatsarāja, a minister and poet under the Chandela kings, including Paramardideva. The play is a type of drama called Īhāmṛga, which mixes traditional stories with creative twists. The plot is based on the Mahābhārata and centers on the conflict between Krishna and Sisupala over Rukmini. Although it draws from this ancient epic, the play introduces new elements, such as the depiction of Krishna and Rukmini’s connection through their portraits.

The story unfolds in four parts, starting with Krishna learning that Sisupala plans to marry Rukmini, who prefers Krishna. It continues through a series of events involving diplomacy, emotional struggles, and ends with Krishna abducting Rukmini and defeating Sisupala. Themes like love, loyalty, and divine protection are key to the story.

The paper also discusses the social and cultural context of Vatsarāja’s time.

column11: कविकुलगुरु कालिदास की रचनाओं में पौराणिक कहानियों का दार्शनिक स्वरुप जन जन तक प्रेषित करने के पोषक तत्व - एक अध्ययन
column13:
प्रस्तावना
कविकुलगुरु कालिदास भारतीय साहित्य के एक महान कवि और नाटककार माने जाते हैं। उनकी रचनाएँ न केवल काव्य की दृष्टि से महत्वपूर्ण हैं, बल्कि उनमें दार्शनिक और पौराणिक तत्वों का समावेश भी प्रमुखता से दिखाई देता है। इस निबंध में संस्कृत साहित्य के महान कवि कविकुलगुरु कालिदास की रचनाओं के साहित्यिक और दार्शनिक आयामों का विश्लेषण किया गया है, जिसमें उन तत्वों पर ध्यान केंद्रित किया गया है जिन्होंने पौराणिक कहानियों को आम जन तक पहुंचाने में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाई है। कालिदास की प्रमुख रचनाएँ, जैसे "अभिज्ञानशाकुंतलम्," "मेघदूत," "रघुवंश," और "कुमारसंभव," को इस दृष्टिकोण से अध्ययन किया गया है कि उन्होंने किस प्रकार गूढ़ दार्शनिक विषयों से युक्त पौराणिक कथाओं को अपने साहित्य में समाहित किया है। कालिदास की रचनाओं में पौराणिक कहानियाँ और उनके दार्शनिक अर्थों का विवेचन जन जन तक पहुंचाने के लिए विशेष प्रयास किए गए हैं। इस अध्ययन का उद्देश्य कालिदास की रचनाओं में निहित पौराणिक कहानियों के दार्शनिक स्वरुप को पहचानना और उसे जन-जन तक प्रेषित करने के पोषक तत्वों का विश्लेषण करना है।

column11: Yoga and Sangita: Harmonious Pathways to Self-Realization
column13: Yoga and music, India's timeless treasures, have been intertwined for centuries, sharing a profound purpose of guiding individuals toward self-realization and unity with the ultimate reality. Rooted in ancient wisdom, these complementary disciplines have evolved into distinct yet interconnected paths, converging in their pursuit of unity and uniqueness, and harmonizing the mind and body through their respective practices, ultimately revealing the true nature of the self and the universe.

column4: Sree Sankaracharya university of sanskrit, Kalady, kerala
column11: Sacred Groves- The Ayurvedic Path to Holistic Wellness
column13: This Paper highlights the significance of sacred groves in Ayurvedic tradition, emphasizing their role in promoting holistic wellness, biodiversity conservation, and environmental sustainability. Sacred groves, revered for their cultural and spiritual significance, harbor a vast array of plant and animal species, including medicinal plants used in Ayurvedic treatments, and support rural healthcare and groundwater levels. However, these ecosystems face threats from development projects and cultural shifts, underscoring the need for intergenerational communication, education, and conservation efforts to protect their integrity and preserve traditional knowledge systems, ultimately maintaining ecological balance and promoting holistic wellness.

column11: VARUNA -THE BESTOWER OF RAIN
column13: Varuṇa is a Vedic god associated with the Sky, Oceans, and Water. Varuṇa is one of the twelve Ādityas and the son of the Aditi and Kaśyapa. In the YajurVeda, it is said that Varuṇa is Vishnu and Vishnu is Varuṇa and hence the auspicious offering is to be made to these deities.  .

column11: पंचदशी में आये वेदांत संकल्पनांओं का समीक्षात्मक अभ्यास
column13:
Abstract
	वेदांतशास्त्र के इतिहास को शांकरपूर्वकाल, शांकरकाल और शांकरोत्तर काल इन तीन प्रमुख भागों में बांटा जाता हैं । शांकरपूर्वकाल में प्रस्थान ग्रंथों में वेदांत कें संकल्पनाओं का उद्गम हमें देखनें को मिलता हैं । तब शांकरपूर्व काल में पाई जानेवाली ये वेदांत की संकल्पनाएँ, शांकर काल में पाई जानेवाली वेदांत की संकल्पनाएँ और शांकरोत्तर काल में पाई जानेवाली वेदांत की संकल्पनाएँ इनका विकास किस क्रम से हुआ हैं ? क्या इनके स्वरूप में कुछ बदलाव आया हैं ? अथवा किसी आचार्य नें अलग तरह सें इनको प्रतिपादित किया हैं ? अथवा किसी आचार्यनें नएँ संकल्पनाओं को जोडा हैं ? शांकर काल के आचार्य सुरेश्वराचार्य, त्रोटकाचार्य, हस्तमलकाचार्य, पद्मपादाचार्य आदि और शांकरोत्तर काल के रामानुज, मध्वाचार्य, निम्बार्काचार्य, माधवाचार्य आदि आचार्यों ने इसमें कुछ अलगतासे बताया है क्या ? इसका समीक्षात्मक अभ्यास वेदांत के पंचदशीस्थ प्रमुख संकल्पनाओं (ब्रह्म, माया, जीव, जगत्, ईश्वर, विवर्तवाद, पंचीकरण) के बारे में प्रस्तुत शोधपत्र में किया जा रहा हैं ।

column4: Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University, Mouda Road, Ramtek
column11: Modern Public Administration: Insights from Chanakya Niti and E-Governance through ICT in the Contemporary Era
column13:
Abstract
This research paper delves into the integration of traditional Indian governance principles with contemporary technological advancements in public administration. By exploring the principles of Chanakya Niti and their application in the context of modern e-governance through Information and Communication Technology (ICT), this study aims to highlight how ancient insights can enhance current administrative practices in India. The paper provides a detailed analysis of the convergence between historical wisdom and modern technology to propose a holistic framework for effective governance.

column11: Uncovering Cultural Dynamics in Vatsarāja’s Rukminīharaṇa
column13:
This paper examines "Rukminīharaṇa," a play written by Vatsarāja, a minister and poet under the Chandela kings, including Paramardideva. The play is a type of drama called Īhāmṛga, which mixes traditional stories with creative twists. The plot is based on the Mahābhārata and centers on the conflict between Krishna and Sisupala over Rukmini. Although it draws from this ancient epic, the play introduces new elements, such as the depiction of Krishna and Rukmini’s connection through their portraits.

The story unfolds in four parts, starting with Krishna learning that Sisupala plans to marry Rukmini, who prefers Krishna. It continues through a series of events involving diplomacy, emotional struggles, and ends with Krishna abducting Rukmini and defeating Sisupala. Themes like love, loyalty, and divine protection are key to the story.

The paper also discusses the social and cultural context of Vatsarāja’s time.

column8: Pursuing BA in Sanskrit and English
column11: Tracing the Evidences of Mathematical Concepts in the Ancient Sanskrit Treatises
column13:
Tracing the evidence of the mathematical concepts in ancient Sanskrit treatises.
India is very well known for its ancient knowledge. This knowledge is not only limited to a particular topic but includes almost each  and every field right from agriculture  to Astronomy. Mathematics is not an exception to that.Indian scholars have contributed a lot in the development of Maths. The concept of zero and numerical system was originated India.Also there was a great development in the branches of mathematics i.e.geometry and Algebra.The theorem of a right angled triangle which is famous by the name of Pythagoras has its origin in Shulb Sutras. Baudhayan has also contributed to this theorem.Also the value of π, area of trapezium, triangle are also explained in ancient Sanskrit texts.The concept like Pascal triangle is also originated in India.The formulae were in sutra form or  in a shloka and they were fully explained step by step.Brahmagupta has also contributed in the study of quadrilateral. Thus ,India has contributed a lot in the development of Mathematics.

column11: श्रीयज्ञेश्वरायणमहाकाव्ये आगतानां कृदन्तशब्दानां विश्लेषणम्
column13:
व्याक्रियन्ते व्युत्पाद्यन्ते असाधुशब्देभ्य: साधुशद्बा: अनेनेति शब्दज्ञानजनकं व्याकरणम्' इति 

सर्वं नाम धातुजम आह शाकटस्य स्तोकम् इति उक्तरीत्या यद्यपि शाकटायनमते सर्वे शब्दा: धातो: निष्पन्ना: | पाणिनीयमते तु धातो: निष्पन्ना: ये शब्दा: ते कृदन्ता: इति कथ्यन्ते | धातो: कृत्प्रत्ययं विधाय बहूनां नुतनशद्बानां निष्पात्ति: कर्तुम् शक्यते इति पाणिनीयव्याकरणस्य वैशिष्ट्यम् |        

धातो: विहिताः तिङ्भिन्नप्रत्यया: कृत्-प्रत्यया: भवन्ति | कृत्प्रत्ययानां ‘कृदतिङ्’ इति सूत्रेण कृत्संज्ञा भवति | यथा – अण्, अच्, णमुल्, अनीयर् इत्यादयः प्रत्यया: | प्रातिपदिकशब्दानां निर्माणार्थं प्रथमं धातोः कृत् प्रत्यया: भवन्ति | कृत् प्रत्यययोगेन ते कृदन्ता: भवन्ति | कृदन्तस्य ज्ञानं विना व्याकरणस्य ज्ञानं न भवति | संस्कृतसाहित्ये कृदन्तानां प्रयोगा: अधिका: भवन्ति | प्राचीनग्रन्थानाम् अध्ययनं प्रचुरं भवति, परन्तु आधुनिकग्रन्थानां, महाकाव्यानाम् अध्ययनमपि आवश्यकम् इति लक्ष्यते । अतः ‘श्रीनिवासमदनूरकरविरचितं ‘श्रीयज्ञेश्वरायणम्’ इति आधुनिकमहाकाव्यम् अध्ययनार्थं स्वीकृतम् | अस्मिन् महाकाव्ये १८ सर्गा: तथा च १९६१ श्लोका: सन्ति | एतस्मिन् महाकाव्ये ‘यज्ञेश्वरशास्त्री कस्तुरे’ महामहोपाध्यायस्य

column13: TIRTHANKAR STUTI VIVECHANA

column4: Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University, Mouda Road, Ramtek
column11: The Digital Renaissance of Sanskrit Sahitya: Opportunities and Challenges
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
Abstract
Sanskrit Sahitya, or Sanskrit literature, has been a treasure trove of knowledge, philosophy, and art for thousands of years. Known as the language of ancient India’s intellectual and spiritual traditions, Sanskrit has a vast repository of texts spanning diverse genres such as Vedic hymns, Upanishads, epics like the Mahabharata and Ramayana, and scientific treatises in fields ranging from astronomy to medicine. However, in modern times, the study of Sanskrit literature has been on a decline. The Digital Renaissance of Sanskrit Sahitya aims to revive and rejuvenate interest in this ancient language through the integration of digital technologies. This transformation presents unique opportunities, but also significant challenges.
This paper explores the key opportunities and challenges faced by Sanskrit Sahitya in the digital age, highlighting the role of technology in preserving, disseminating, and revitalizing this ancient literary tradition.

column11: Exploring Indian Aesthetics through Rīti Siddhānta (Theory of Diction): An analysis of Shelley’s Ode to the West Wind
column13: This paper investigates the applicability of Vamana's theory to the study of English literary works, specifically focusing on Shelley's Ode to the West Wind, demonstrating the enduring relevance of his theory across cultural boundaries. This study aims to identify the subtleties of diction, style, and artistic expression that resonate with the principles outlined by Acarya Vamana. It also seeks to determine how these linguistic elements contribute to the poem's thematic and aesthetic impact. The convergence of Eastern and Western literary traditions is revealed by this research, proving the universality of aesthetic principles and the possibility of reading poetic writings in different cultural contexts. In addition, the study considers how Indian theoretical frameworks might be tailored to better comprehend and value Western literary works, which broadens the field of literary criticism. In conclusion, the study suggests that the application of Indian aesthetic theories, such Rīti Siddhānta, to Western literature improves the critical discourse by bridging literary and cultural gaps

column11: Innovative Horizons in Indian Aesthetics: Bridging Tradition and Modernity
column13: Indian aesthetics, rooted in Sanskrit traditions, delves into art and beauty through concepts like rasa, dhvani, aucitya and vakrokti. Sanskrit linguistics helps illuminate these principles, showcasing their application in works by poets such as Kalidasa. Modern adaptations of Indian aesthetics through digital technologies like VR and AR are expanding the global reach of traditional art forms while presenting challenges in preserving their authenticity. This dynamic integration highlights the enduring relevance of Indian artistic principles and their adaptability in the contemporary digital landscape.

column8: BA Sanskrit, Currently Pursuing M.A Sanskrit Part 2
column11: Prākṛtism in the Pronunciation of Mādhyandina school of Śukla Yajurveda
column13:
Prakritism in the Pronunciation of Mādhyandina school of Śukla Yajurveda
Sharvari Nitin Erande

Sanskrit is one of the most ancient languages in the world, which preserves the oldest literature of the Indian subcontinent, the Vedas. These sacred texts were transmitted orally for millennia, while experiencing a meticulous process of preservation. The Vedas have remarkably retained almost all of their original content, largely due to the accompanying phonetic treatises which propounded rules for Vedic pronunciation.

Though there were precise guidelines for Vedic pronunciation, variations emerged. The proposed paper focuses on the Mādhyandina School of the Śukla Yajurveda, where notable pronunciation shifts prominently include the use of 'ज' instead of 'य', 'ख' instead of 'ष', and 'ब' instead of 'व/व्व'. These deviations raise questions about the possible influences on Vedic recitations. The said pronunciation shifts are realized when the recitation of the Mādhyandina Śukla Yajurveda is done by a Vedic Scholar.

column4: Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady
column11: Innovative Horizons in Indian Aesthetics: Bridging Tradition and Modernity
column13:
Innovative Horizons in Indian Aesthetics: Bridging Tradition and Modernity

Indian aesthetics, rooted in Sanskrit traditions, delves into art and beauty through concepts like rasa, dhvani, aucitya and vakrokti. Sanskrit linguistics helps illuminate these principles, showcasing their application in works by poets such as Kalidasa. Modern adaptations of Indian aesthetics through digital technologies like VR and AR are expanding the global reach of traditional art forms while presenting challenges in preserving their authenticity. This dynamic integration highlights the enduring relevance of Indian artistic principles and their adaptability in the contemporary digital landscape.

column11: पूर्वविप्रतिषेधविषये विद्यमानवार्त्तिकयोः प्रत्याख्यानक्रमः
column13:
पूर्वविप्रतिषेधविषये विद्यमानवार्त्तिकयोः प्रत्याख्यानक्रमः
गणेशः बाबु होसकोटि 
शोधच्छात्रः, व्याकरणविभागः
कर्नाटक-संस्कृत-विश्वविद्यालयः
चामराजपेटे, बेङ्गलूरु.
उद्देशः – 
विप्रतेषेधे परं कार्यम् (१.४.२) इति सूत्रं तावत् परिभाषासूत्रत्वेन शास्त्रे आश्रितं वर्तते। सकलं व्याकरणशास्त्रं भाष्योक्तरीत्या उत्सर्गापवादक्रमेण एव निर्मितम्। विप्रतिषेधे इत्यपि एकः उत्सर्गः। तस्य अपवादत्वेन शास्त्रे द्वे वार्त्तिके दृश्येते। तयोः कूलङ्कुषं ज्ञानम् एव अत्र अभिलषितम्। भाष्यकाररीत्या प्रत्याख्यानम् अपि अत्र दिदर्शयिषितम्।
१.	गुणवृद्ध्यौत्वतृज्वद्भावेभ्यो नुम् पूर्वविप्रतिषेधेन (वा)
२.	नुमचिरतृज्वद्भावेभ्यो नुट् विप्रतिषेधेन (वा)
समस्या – 
तयोः उदाहरणानि न एकत्र उपलभ्यन्ते। तस्मात् तेषां मद्ध्ये विद्यमानः सामान्यांशः कः, को वा भेदः इति च अवगन्तुं कश्चन क्लेशः तु अनुभूयते। यदि एकत्र तेषाम् उपस्थापनं स्यात् तर्हि तेषाम् अवगमने सौलभ्यं, किञ्च रूपसिद्धीनां ज्ञानमपि सुकरम्। 
वार्त्तिकयोः आरम्भे किं कारणम् ?, कथं तर्हि तयोः प्रत्याख्यानम् ?, वार्त्तिकाभावे का गतिः तेषां रूपाणाम् ? इति अनेके शोधप्रश्नाः वर्त्तन्ते।

column11: Cube of numbers- Sridhara, Bhaskaraacharya and Bharati Krishna Trithaji, vedic Method
column13:
Vedic Mathematics, an ancient system of calculation, was rediscovered from the Vedas between 1911 and 1918 by Sri Bharati Krishna Tirthaji Maharaj. It is founded on 16 core sutras or formulas, along with 13 sub-sutras or corollaries. These principles simplify and expedite complex calculations, making them more accessible.
True mastery of a subject begins with a deep understanding of concepts, followed by extensive practice of similar problems. This approach not only enhances learning but also fosters the development of new ideas.
One challenging area for students is calculating the cube of a number. By exploring various methods, students can find enjoyment in the subject and accelerate their learning. This paper explores techniques for finding the cube of a number, as proposed by notable mathematicians such as Sridhar (750 AD), Bhaskaraacharya (1114 AD), and Bharati Krishna Tirthaji (1884-1960).
Keywords: Vedic, Lilawati, Ghata, Mathematics.

column11: पञ्चायुधप्रपञ्चभाणस्य हस्तलिखितानाम् अध्ययनम्
column13:
३६ अध्यायेषु विभजित ग्रन्थे, नाट्यशास्त्रे आचार्यः भरतमुनिः नाट्यस्य माहात्म्यम्, ज्ञानम्, शिल्पा, विद्या, कला, योगः इत्येषां विवरं ददाति। भरतमहामुनिः , दशरुपककारः धनञ्जयः, साहित्यदर्पणकारः विश्वनाथः इत्यादयाः  दशप्रकारयुक्त रुपकस्यास्य विषये विस्तृतचर्चां कृतवन्तः। सामान्य जनाय नाट्यशास्त्रस्य रचना काठिणं भवेत् इति दृष्ट्या धनञ्जयः ‘दशरूपक’ नामक ग्रन्थरचनां कारिकारूपेण करोति।
दशरूपकेषु तृतीयः प्रभेदः भाणः। शृङ्गारशेखर, मर्कटमदलिका, शृङ्गारतिलकभाणः, रससदनभाणः चेति भाणेषु अन्यतमम्। संस्कृतसाहित्ये भाणस्य विशिष्ट स्थानमस्ति। भारती वृत्तिप्रधान्यमत्र दृश्यते। भाणे सामाजिकविषये विशेषरूपेण कविः व्यङ्ग्यात्मक प्रहारं करोति। तदर्थं भाणः लोकानुरञ्जकः भवेदेव इति केषाञ्चित् पण्डितानां मतः।
 भाणे त्रिविक्रमपण्डित विरचित पञ्चायुधप्रपञ्चभाण नामक हस्तलिखितस्य काव्यस्वरूपविषयेत्र किञ्चित् प्रस्तूयते।

column11: ऋक्तन्त्रोक्तवर्णोच्चारणविधि:
column13:
ऋक्तन्त्रोक्तवर्णोच्चारणविधि:

     मार्गदर्शकः
प्रो.हरेकृष्ण अगस्ती
व्याकरणविभागाध्यक्षः
कविकुलगुरु-कालिदास-संस्कृत-     
विश्वविद्यालय:,रामटेक-नागपूरम्

    शोधच्छात्रः  
हरिश्चन्द्र  मालू गवस
    व्याकरणविभागः

ऋक्तन्त्रप्रातिशाख्यं सामवेदीय प्रातिशाख्यं वर्तते। वेदोच्चारणनियमे प्रातिशाख्यग्रन्थाः मौलीभूता: भवन्ति। ऋक्तन्त्रप्रातिशाख्यं राणायनीयकौथुमशाखाभ्यां सह सम्बद्धं वर्तते। 
    सामवेदीयनारदीयशिक्षायां  प्राधान्येन त्रीणि उच्चारणस्थानानि उक्तानि। तथा च गौणस्थानानि विस्तरेण प्रतिपादितानि। परञ्च शिक्षाग्रन्थे उच्चारणे वर्णस्थानविषये च वैषम्यं  दृश्यते अत एव सामवेदपाठकान् सन्देहं भवितुमर्हति। तदर्थं प्राचीनप्रमाणैः सूत्रैश्च ऋक्तन्त्रप्रातिशाख्ये वर्णोपदेशस्य वर्णस्थानानाञ्च सारगर्भितविशेषाधारितसूत्राणि प्रतिपादितानि। दीर्घकालानध्ययनात्, व्याकरणानभ्यासात् कालेन (समयेन) मन्त्रोच्चारणे प्रायः अध्येतॄणां सामवेदीयच्छात्राणां दोषाः भवन्ति। एतान् दोषान् निराकरणार्थं सामवेदप्रातिशाख्यानां संरक्षणार्थञ्च  व्याकरणनियमानां ज्ञानम् आवश्यकं वर्तते।
   अत: अस्मिन् शोधपत्रे ऋक्तन्त्रोक्तवर्णस्थानानां चिन्तनम्  उच्चारणविधिश्च विश्लेषणं क्रियते।

column11: “अर्वाचीनसंस्कृतसाहित्यक्षेत्रे श्रीमतः विश्वासवर्यस्य योगदानम्”
column13: डा॰ विश्वासवर्यस्य उपन्यासाः सकलजनानाम् आकर्षणपात्रतां गतस्य चलच्चित्रजगतः समीपतः अवलोकनेन अध्ययनेन च लिखिताः एते ग्रन्थाः प्रायः आधुनिकसंस्कृतसाहित्यक्षेत्रे प्राकाशिताः स्वतन्त्राः उपन्यासाः सन्ति। अर्वाचीनसंस्कृतसाहित्यक्षेत्रे विशेषतया उपन्याससाहित्ये एतेषां प्रयासः अतीव श्लाघनीयः। अयमेव गवेषणार्थं मम मनोभिलाषमपि जनयति। अतः अस्मिन् शोधनपत्रे अर्वाचीनगद्यसाहित्ये विदुषां विश्वासवर्याणां योगदानं कीदृशमस्ति इति प्रतिपादनं कर्तुं मम विनम्रजिज्ञासा।

column11: नाचिकेताग्नि का वैज्ञानिक स्वरूप
column13:
प्रस्तावना
आर्षद्रष्टा वैदिक ऋषियों ने स्वतपश्चर्या की शक्ति से वैदिक मन्त्रों का साक्षात्कार किया। साक्षात्कार की इस प्रक्रिया में तपःपूत वैदिक ऋषियों के द्वारा अपञ्चीकृत और सूक्ष्मभूत पञ्चमहाभूत (आकाश, वायु, अप, अग्नि तथा पृथिवी) के तत्त्वज्ञान को आत्मसात् किया गया। इहलोक में मानव-जीवन के सम्यक् सञ्चालन एवं प्राणियों में ऊर्जा का सञ्चार करने के कारण तथा परलोक अर्थात् स्वर्गलोक की प्राप्ति कराने के कारण स्वरूप ही ‘अग्नि-तत्त्व’ को पञ्चमहाभूतों में सर्वश्रेष्ठ स्थान प्रदान किया गया। एतदर्थ अग्नि-विज्ञान को जानने के कारण ही वैदिक ऋषि के द्वारा वेद के प्रथम सूक्त को सर्वप्रथम ‘अग्नि-सूक्त’ के रूप में साक्षात्कृत किया गया। एवमेव वेद के अङ्गभूत ‘उपनिषद्’ का विषय न केवल जीव, आत्मा व ब्रह्म रहा है, अपितु स्वर्गप्राप्ति के साधनभूत अग्निविद्या का भी वर्णन यहां पर विशिष्ट रूप में प्राप्त होता है। उपनिषद् साहित्य वस्तुतः अग्नि के तीन रूप को विवेचित करता है-
•	आध्यात्मिक अग्नि
•	आधिदैविक अग्नि
•	आधिभौतिक अग्नि
सावित्र अग्नि, पञ्चाग्नि, त्रिणाचिकेताग्नि उपर्युक्त अग्नियों के ही विविध स्वरूप हैं। कृष्ण यजुर्वेदीय कठोपनिषद् में मृत्यु देवता के द्वारा कुमार नचिकेता को “नाचिकेताग्नि विद्या” के

column11: Buddhist Approach to Human Resource Training and Development: An Analysis of Suttas
column13: Buddhism places a strong emphasis on the development of human beings. For over 2,500 years, the Buddhist tradition has thrived due to the systematic training and development offered by the Buddha. This paper aims to explore Buddhist teachings related to human resource training and development. The research uses a qualitative approach, analyzing primary Buddhist texts, scholarly articles, and related literature. Buddhist training focuses on both the physical and mental aspects of individuals, influencing their personal and spiritual growth. The Sigāla Sutta offers a comprehensive guide to holistic development, covering societal roles, family, education, friendships, religious practices, work, and the causes of destruction. The Vitakkasaṇṭhāna Sutta describes five methods to manage challenges, while the Dantabhūmi Sutta presents a gradual training process through the metaphor of taming a wild elephant. The Kesi Sutta explains how the Buddha trained monks (rest missing due to limited submission see the attachment.)

column11: The Effectiveness of Mindfulness Practices for Teachers in Colombo District
column13: This study examines the effectiveness of mindfulness practices for teachers in Colombo district. Researcher has explored the concept of mindfulness  focusing on definitions and implementations from both Buddhist and Western perspectives. A structured questionnaire was distributed to 100 teachers who teach Buddhism in Colombo district. The questionnaire assessed their understanding of mindfulness, experiences with mindfulness practices, and their perceptions of its effectiveness in their professional lives using Likert scale responses. The data were analysed using SPSS 27, including graphs and tables to illustrate key findings. The analysis revealed that more than 75% of teachers reported significant improvements in their stress levels and classroom management skills due to mindfulness practices. Specifically, the SPSS analysis showed that 82% of respondents felt calmer and more focused, which positively affected their teaching performance. Additionally, 78% reported enhanced student-teacher interactions. Despite these benefits, 20% of teachers faced challenges in integrating mindfuln

column11: Tatvajnanannishreyasadhigamaha (तत्त्वज्ञानान्निश्रेयसाधिगमः)
column13:
न्यायसूत्रकारेण गौतमेन प्रथमं सूत्रम् उक्तम् – प्रमाण-प्रमेय-संशय-प्रयोजन-दृष्टान्त-सिद्धान्ता-वयव-तर्क-निर्णय-वाद-जल्प-वितण्डा-हेत्वाभास-च्छल-जाति-निग्रहस्थानानां तत्त्वज्ञानान्निःश्रेयसाधिगमः इति । एवञ्च प्रमाणादीनां तत्त्वज्ञानात् निःश्रेयसप्राप्तिः भवतीति अवगम्यते । एतेषां तत्त्वज्ञानन्तु शास्त्राध्ययनेन लोकानुभवादिना च सम्पादनीयमिति तु लोकवेद्यमेव । 
	किमेतेषां तत्त्वज्ञानोत्तरं साक्षादपवर्गप्राप्तिः भवति वा ? इति प्रश्नस्य उत्तरं वदति गौतमः ‘न भवति’ इति । तर्हि कथं ‘तत्त्वज्ञानात् निःश्रेयसप्राप्तिः’ इति प्रतिपादितमिति चेत्, वदति तदुत्तररूपेण द्वितीयं सूत्रम् – दुःख-जन्म-प्रवृत्ति-दोष-मिथ्यज्ञानानामुत्तरोत्तरापये तदनन्तरापायादपवर्गः इति । तथा च तत्त्वज्ञानात् मिथ्याज्ञानं नश्यति, तेन दोषाः नश्यन्ति, ततः प्रवृत्तिनाशः, ततः जन्मनाशः, ततः दुःखनाशः इत्यर्थः उपलभ्यते । दुःखञ्च एकविंशतिविधम् । तानि च षडिन्द्रियाणि, षड्विषयाः, षड्विधं तत्तद्विष

column11: Linkages of Chanakya's Arthashastra and Women Empowerment : A Study
column13: Women constitute 48.15% of the total population of India and the ability of women has not been fully utilized by India due to different reasons viz., social, cultural, educational, political, etc . Indian women’s status is not good as compared to men in respect of power, control over economic resources, wages, education, confidence, economic independence, social security etc., . In order to overcome the women’s problems the woman empowerment is essential. The present study examines how Connecting Kautilya's Arthashastra with Women Empowerment in  social context .

column11: क्षपक-शिक्षाप्रकरणाख्य-हस्तलिखितयोः परिचयः समीक्षणञ्च।
column13:
शोधपत्रस्य विषयः- क्षपक-शिक्षाप्रकरणाख्य-हस्तलिखितयोः परिचयः समीक्षणञ्च।
विषयविभागः- जैनदर्शनं प्राकृताध्यनञ्च।
संशोधकः- डॉ. अतुल ज्ञानोबा मस्के

चारित्रमोहक्षपणकारिणः क्षपकाः। (धव. पु. १, पृ. १८२ ), मोहक्खयं कुणंतो उत्तो खवओ जिणिंदेहिं। (भावसं. दे. ६६०) तपस्वी क्षपकः। (स्थाना. अभय. वृ. ३-४, २०८), क्षपकः क्षपकश्रेणिः। (व्यव. भा. मलय. वृ. ६९९, पृ. ९१) इति क्षपकस्य लक्षणानि लभ्यन्ते। 
आचार्य-श्रीजिनचन्द्रद्रसूरिविरचितः क्षपक-शिक्षाप्रकरणाख्यग्रन्थोऽद्यावधि अप्रकाशितो भाति। अयं ग्रन्थः पद्यात्मकोऽस्ति। १२३ गाथाप्रमाणोऽयं ग्रन्थः। अस्य ग्रन्थस्य द्वे हस्तलिखिते सम्प्राप्ते। अस्मिन् शोधपत्रे हस्तलिखितस्य अन्तर्बाह्यवर्णनम्। वैशिष्ट्यादिवर्णनम्। हस्तलिखितस्य विषयवर्णनं तस्य समीक्षणञ्च क्रियते।

column11: Concept of Atma in Nyaya Philosophy
column13:
Concept of Atma in Nyaya Philosophy

Nyāya philosophy, one of the six classical schools of Indian thought, provides a systematic approach to understanding reality, knowledge, and logic, primarily through the work of the sage Gautama and his Nyāya Sūtras. Central to Nyāya is the concept of Ātman, or "self," which this essay explores in detail. Ātman in Nyāya is conceived as a permanent, unchanging entity distinct from the body and mind. This essay examines the definition and nature of Ātman, emphasizing its role in Nyāya’s epistemological framework, which includes perception (pratyakṣa), inference (anumāna), comparison (upamāna), and testimony (śabda). According to Nyāya, Ātman can be directly perceived through introspective self-awareness, and its existence is supported by arguments based on self-awareness, causal continuity, and logical necessity.
The essay also contrasts the Nyāya view of Ātman with the Vedāntic concept of Brahman, highlighting Nyāya’s dualistic perspective where Ātman is seen as a distinct entity rather than equated with the ultimate reality. Furthermore,

column11: भरतमुनि एवं आचार्य अभिनवगुप्त की दृष्टि में कवि की अवधारणा : स्वरूप एवं विश्लेषण
column13: भारतीय काव्यशास्त्रीय परम्परा में कवि की अवधारणा का विस्तृत विश्लेषण प्राप्त होता है जहाँ कवि को क्रांतद्रष्टा, मनीषी और स्वयंभू के रूप में देखा गया है। भारतीय दृष्टिकोण के अनुसार कवि को शाश्वत और चिरंतन सांस्कृतिक परम्परा का कुशल प्रस्तौता, लोकानुवर्तनीय मार्ग का प्रकाशक एवं सर्जनकर्ता की भूमिका में देखा गया है।जिसे केवल रचनात्मकता का वाहक नहीं बल्कि समाज के दार्शनिक, सांस्कृतिक और आध्यात्मिक मूल्यों के प्रचारक के रूप में भी मान्यता प्राप्त है। वह देश और काल की सीमाओं से मुक्त होकर, लोक को अपने काव्य-स्फुरण का आधार बनाते हुए अपने मानसिक लोक की अभिव्यक्ति करता है। वह एक ‘द्रष्टा’ और ‘सर्जक’ के रूप में परिभाषित है जो अपनी कल्पनाशीलता, अनुभव और अंतर्ज्ञान के माध्यम से न केवल कला का सर्जन करता है अपितु मानवता के गहरे सत्य और जीवन के विविध पक्षों को भी प्रकट करता है। काव्य रचना के लिए कवि में कल्पनाशक्ति, अनुभूति, अभिव्यक्ति की योग्यता, और मनोवैज्ञानिक कौशल जैसे गुण आवश्यक होते हैं। अतः काव्य रचना के लिये कवि का स्वरूप, प्रकार, काव्य रचना प्रक्रिया, और उसे प्रेरित करने वाली प्रतिभा महत्वपूर्ण अंग बन जाते हैं। इस संदर्भ में, कवि के स्वरूप और उसके काव्य सर्जन के लिए आवश्यक तत्वों को आचार्य

column11: A study and analysis of various translations of the Vinayādhikaraṇa of Kauṭalīya Arthaśāstra from an Indological perspective
column13:
This study undertakes a comprehensive examination of the various English translations of the Vinayadhikaraṇa section of the Arthaśāstra analyzed through an Indological framework. This paper critically assesses the hermeneutic methodologies employed by the translators, with particular focus on how they navigate the intricate complexities of the original Sanskrit text, as well as the cultural, legal, and philosophical paradigms embedded within.
English translations by R. Shamasastry, R. P. Kangle, L. N. Rangarajan, and Patrick Olivelle are scrutinized for their respective approaches, ranging from the literalist to the interpretative and adaptive. It can be discerned how the intellectual milieu of the respective scholars, the number of manuscripts considered, their critical exegesis, focus on readability vs focus on technical accuracy influence the English renderings. It is hoped that the findings in this work contribute to an enhanced understanding of the reception and transmission of the Arthaśāstra in contemporary scholarship.

column11: रसविवेचन - आचार्य संघरक्षित के अनुसार
column13:
रसविवेचन - आचार्य संघरक्षित के अनुसार

डॉ. बन्सी लव्हाळे 
संस्कृत और कोशशास्त्र विभाग डेक्कन कॉलेज, अभिमत विद्यापीठ, पुणे
bansilawhale@gmail.com


भारतीय साहित्यशास्त्र की परंपरा महान है। इस साहित्यशास्त्र-परंपरा को अनेक साहित्यशास्त्रज्ञों ने अपने ग्रंथों के द्वारा अत्यंत प्रगल्भ बनाया है। इस परंपरा में सुबोधालंकार नामक आचार्य संघरक्षित विरचित ग्रंथ है। यह पालि भाषा में रचित ग्रंथ है। संस्कृत साहित्यशास्त्र की परंपरा में अनेक ग्रंथ प्राप्त होते है परंतु पालि में सुबोधालंकार यह एक मात्र ग्रंथ प्राप्त है। पांच परिच्छेदों में रचित इस ग्रंथ में आचार्य संघरक्षित ने साहित्यशास्त्रीय तत्त्वों का विवेचन किया है। सुबोधालंकार के पंचम परिच्छेद में आचार्य संघरक्षित ने रस सिद्धांत का प्रतिपादन किया है। आचार्य संघरक्षित के द्वारा पालि में वर्णन किया गया रस सिद्धांत का विवेचन कर अन्य आचार्यों का प्रभाव आचार्य संघरक्षित पर कैसे दिखायी देता है, यही चिंतन प्रस्तुत लेख में किया है।

column11: The Ghṛta and Ājya from Vedic Texts
column13:
The Vedic culture is prominently based on Yajñasaṁsthā i.e. sacrificial rituals. Various kinds of libations are offered in several sacrifices. However, Ājyāhutī is the most common libation offered in Vedic sacrifices. It is prescribed that, when a specific libation is not mentioned, Ājya should be offered as libation in Agni. 
Traditionally, Ājya is considered as clarified butter or ghee. The other synonym used for Ājya is Ghṛta. We find that from the period of ritualistic texts, the words Ghṛta and Ājya are used interchangeably. We find some references from Saṁhitas that suggest Ghṛta and Ājya might have different meanings. As the Mantra from Ṛgveda states –
यो अ॑स्मा॒ अन्नं॑ तृ॒ष्वा॒३दधा॒त्याज्यै॑र्घृ॒तैर्जु॒होति॒ पुष्य॑ति।
तस्मै॑ स॒हस्र॑म॒क्षभि॒र्वि च॒क्षेऽग्ने॑ वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्ङ॑सि॒ त्वम्॥ (RV 10.79.5)
It suggests that Ghṛta and Ājya were different from each other. Nighaṇṭu (1.12) lists Ghṛta as one of the synonyms for Udaka. But surprisingly Nighaṇṭu does not enlists words for either milk or ghee. Thus, word Ājya is not found in Nighaṇṭu.

बालरामायण में नाट्यतंत्र

डॉ. बन्सी लव्हाळे 
संस्कृत और कोशशास्त्र विभाग डेक्कन कॉलेज, अभिमत विद्यापीठ, पुणे
bansilawhale@gmail.com

संस्कृत एवं प्राकृत साहित्य के क्षेत्र में कविराज राजशेखर का नाम अत्यंत आदर के साथ लिया जाता है । बालरामायण, बालभारत, कर्पूरमंजरी, विद्धशालभंजिका ऐसे रूपकों के साथ काव्यमीमांसा नामक काव्यशास्त्रीय ग्रंथ की रचना राजशेखर ने की है । अतः राजशेखर को प्रतिभासंपन्न कवि एवं काव्यमीमांसक कहते है । नाट्यशास्त्रीय तत्त्वों के साथ अपने नाटकों की रचना राजशेखर ने की है । आचार्य भरत ने नाट्यशास्त्र में नाट्यतंत्र का विस्तृत विवेचन किया है । इस नाट्यतंत्र का उपयोग राजशेखर ने अपने नाटकों में किया है । राजशेखर के बालरामायण नाटक में नाट्यतंत्र का प्रयोग कैसे किया? इस विषय पर चिंतन प्रस्तुत लेख में किया है ।

column11: Concept of Āśauca: Vedic and post–Vedic Practices
column13:
The concept of āśauca (impurity on birth and death), occupies a profound role in Indian cultural and religious practices. Purity and impurity are not mere physical states but embody deeper social and ritual dimensions. It is important to understand how various life events and practices are approached in Indian culture, influencing everything from daily routines to sacred rituals.
In traditional Indian thought, impurity is closely linked to significant life events. Birth marks the transition from non-existence to existence, introducing a period of ritual impurity for both the mother and the relatives. Similarly, death disrupts the social order, creating impurity that affects the immediate family and the wider community.
In the context of Vedic and post-Vedic Indian traditions, the concept of impurity associated with birth and death holds significant ritual and cultural importance. During the Vedic period, āśauca was integral for maintaining social structure. The Vedic texts provide extensive details on the rituals and practices surrounding birth and death.

column11: हरिदासकृत प्रस्तावरत्नाकर हस्तलिखित का अध्ययन
column13:
संसार की समस्त परिष्कृत भाषाओं में सबसे प्राचीनतम भाषा संस्कृत भाषा है। संस्कृत शब्द 'सम्' पूर्वक 'कृ' धातू से बना हुआ है, जिसका मौलीक अर्थ है-  संस्कारित की गई भाषा। इसलिये संस्कृत भाषा को देववाणी भी कहा जाता है। संस्कृत भाषा के दो रूप हमारे सामने प्रस्तुत होती है- वैदिक तथा लौकिक।
   साहित्य 'शब्द' और 'अर्थ' के मंजुल सामंजस्य का सूचक है, आचार्य राजशेखर ने साहित्य व्युत्पत्ती के बारें में बताया है- 'सहितयो: भाव: साहित्यम्' अर्थात सहित शब्द तथा अर्थ का भाव। संस्कृत साहित्य वास्तव, शाश्वत आनंद की उपलब्धी को आपना लक्ष्य मानते है। इसलिए संस्कृत काव्य की आत्मा 'रस' है। रस का उन्मिलन श्रोता तथा पाठक के हृदय मे आनंद का उन्मेष ही काव्य का अंतिम लक्ष्य है। 
	महाकवि कालिदास, महाकवि भास, अश्वघोष आदि महान् कवि संस्कृत साहित्य में हमें अध्ययन तथा रसयुक्त काव्यों का मर्म हमें पता चलता है। इन्हीं के परम्परा में संस्कृत साहित्य में कवि हरिदास की रचना हमें पाण्डुलिपि के माध्यम रुप में प्राप्त होती है। 
	हरिदास कवि की रचना प्रस्तावरत्नाकर नामक काव्य हमें प्राप्त होती है। इस प्रस्तावरत्नाकर नामक मातृका का काव्यस्वरुपविषयक अध्ययन करेगें।

column11: मानव जीवन में शोभन अशोभन अध्यास का महत्व
column13:
मानव जीवन में शोभन अशोभन अध्यास का महत्व 


शोधार्थी प्रीति सैनी 
संस्कृत विभाग 
दिल्ली विश्वविद्यालय
ईमेल -spreeety95@gmail.com
   

अध्यात्म से तात्पर्य - आत्मानम् अधिकृत्य यत् ज्ञानं तद् अध्यात्म= आत्म विषयक ज्ञान ही अध्यात्म है।आत्म की अभिव्यक्ति में प्रमाण अहम्/I/ self यह सर्व सामान्य अनुभव है। अतः जिसके द्वारा मुझे स्वयं का ज्ञान हो वह है आध्यात्म।पाश्चात्य दृष्टि में स्व की चर्चा नहीं अपितु अर्थ एवं व्यवहार पर ही बल दिया गया है, इसके विपरीत भारतीय दर्शन धर्म अर्थ काम मोक्ष चार पुरुषार्थ पर बल देते है। धर्म अर्थात् कर्तव्य एवं धर्मानुसार अर्थ एवं काम पूर्ति जिसके आधार में मोक्ष भाव निहित हो यह भारतीय संस्कृति है। अध्यात्म शास्त्र को वेदान्त संज्ञा से अभिहित करते है, जिसमें सत्य की खोज अर्थात् सर्व का सत्य क्या है? इसपर बल दिया गया है। वेदान्त सत्य ब्रह्म है जगत मिथ्या, जगत का स्वभाव परिवर्तनशील है एवं उस स्थिति में अध्यास के कारण व्यक्ति बंधन में रहता है। प्रस्तुत शोध पत्र में अध्यास केंद्रित  मानव जीवन की वर्तमान स्थिति को शास्त्रीय अवधारणाओं सहित मनोवैज्ञानिक रूप से प्रस्तुत करने का प्रयास किया गया है।

column11: मेघदूते आधुनिकपरिप्रेक्ष्ये पारिवारिकमूल्यानि
column13:
महाकविकालिदासस्य मेघदूतं अतिविशिष्टकाव्यमस्ति। मेघदूतस्य रसानुभूतिः कमपि अलौकिकमद्भुतमनिर्वचनीयमानन्दमुत्पादयति। मेघदूतस्य गीतिकाव्यत्वं सरसत्वञ्च बलात् हरति सहृदयानां चेतांसि। यक्षयक्षवध्वाः बाह्यसौन्दर्यमन्तःसौन्दर्यञ्च संयोगवियोगशृङ्गारवर्णने स्फुटतया प्रतिपादितम्। मेघदूते मेघ एव दूतरूपेण यक्षस्य सन्देशम् अलकापुर्यां स्थितां यक्षिणीं प्रति प्रापयति। यक्षस्य प्रत्येकं कथनं सारगर्भितम्। हृदयग्राहिण्यः सूक्तयः पदे पदे समाकर्षयन्ति पुनः पुनः पठितुं तत्तत्पद्यम्। तस्मादेव उच्यते- 'मेघे माघे गतं वयः' इति। 
प्रबन्धेऽस्मिन् एकनारीव्रतस्य यक्षस्य पतिव्रताया यक्षवध्वा विस्तरेण वर्णनं कुर्वता कालिदासेन दम्पत्योः प्रेम प्रति महती निष्ठा यथा प्रकटीकृता तथा उपस्थापयितुम् इष्यते। यक्षयक्षवध्वोः दाम्पत्यप्रेम्णि उत्कण्ठायाः, त्यागस्य तथा च एकात्मभावस्य एव प्राधान्यं विद्यते। शोधपत्रेऽस्मिन् प्रस्तूयन्ते संक्षेपेण मेघदूतान्तर्गतपारिवारिकमूल्यानि।

column11: THE MEDICO-LEGAL IMPLICATIONS OF BHRŪṆAHATYĀ (FOETICIDE)
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
THE MEDICO-LEGAL IMPLICATIONS OF BHRUṆAHATYĀ (FOETICIDE)
BHUVANESWARI S, RESEARCH SCHOLAR, 
THE KSRI, CHENNAI
     Bhrūṇahatyā refers to the killing of an embryo causing abortion, foeticide. Abortion can be either spontaneous or induced.  Induced abortion is termination of pregnancy usually carried out before the foetus attains the stage of viability at around 20 weeks of gestation, where it can exist separately from the mother. The recent Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Amendment Act of 2021 has liberalised abortion up to 24 weeks and beyond where the physical and mental health of the woman is at risk or if substantial foetal abnormalities are detected. In spite of such liberalisation of the law, many case reports of morbidity and /or mortality especially of rural and tribal women are being published who resort to unsafe termination of pregnancies either through self-infliction using methods passed on to them by the womenfolk in the family or by uncertified informal health-care providers practising traditional medicine.
     It is hence the aim of this paper to stud

column11: Krishna Yajurvediya Upanishads And Maxims Of Teaching
column13:
Krishna-Yajurvediya Upanishads And Maxims of Teaching 
This paper will try to understand whether we can find any maxims in Upanishads applied by the Gurus (teachers) while imparting the hidden/ secret knowledge of the Vedas to his Shishyas (students) and whether they are similar to the modern day maxims or not. Just two, कठ and तैत्तिरीय of the ten main Upanishads are taken into consideration for this study in this paper. This study can further be extended to all other Upanishads as well.

Vd. Deepa Joshi. 
B.A.M.S. (Mumbai) and M.A. Sanskrit (Vyakarana) - University of Mumbai

column11: Integrating Buddhist Teachings On Personality For Developing School Education
column13: Personality refers to “factors” inside people that explain their behavior. Psychological understating of teachers and student is enriching the school education system. Personality dwells with individuals are unique ,behavior is different with various situations and individuals are unique and behave inconsistently across situations, there is considerable commonality in human behavior.  Buddhism is centered around virtue (morality) concentration and wisdom. Main objective was to explore Buddhist personality teaching for integrating in school education. Employing a qualitative approach, the researcher surveyed literature relevant including primary Buddhist sources, scholarly articles and books written on the field. Buddhist personality aims to understand one`s mind and behavior. Human is considered as a collection of five aggregates; Form, Feeling, Perception, Mental Formations, Consciousness with 18 dhatu analysis. प्रस्तुतोऽयम् शोधालेख: भारतीयज्ञानपरम्परायाम्  मातृकाणां स्वरूपविषयेऽस्ति । पाण्डुलिपिः - पाण्डुः पीत-पत्राणि, लिपि -लेपनात् लिम्पनात् वा  इति । मातृका: पाण्डुलिपिः वा कस्यापि प्रकाशितग्रन्थस्य मूलं  भवति ।अतः सः ग्रन्थस्याधारत्वेन विराजति, भारतीयज्ञानपरम्परायां पाण्डुलिपीनां अवदानं बहुमहत्त्वपूर्णम् अस्ति।  इमा: पाण्डुलिपय: एव समग्रसंस्कृतवाङ्मयस्य (वैदिक-लौकिकयोः उभयो:) मूलभूता: (आधारभूता: स्तम्भाः) सन्ति।  भारतीयज्ञानपरम्परा: ( IKS )  इत्यस्य विकासे, समृद्धौ संवर्धने च पाण्डुलिपिग्रन्थाः आधारभूताः सन्ति।  न्यु कैटेलागरस कैटेलागमरम् (NCC) इति पाण्डुलिपिनाम् सूचीनाम् सूचीसंग्रह : अस्ति ।  मैक्समूलरमहोदयेन अपि  ऋग्वेदसंहितायाः सम्पादनकाले  मातृकाणां महत्त्वप्रतिपादनं  स्वकीय ग्रन्थस्य “भूमिकायां” ( प्रीफेस) विस्तरेण कृतमस्ति।

column11: Concept of Atma in Nyaya Philosophy
column13:
Nyāya philosophy, one of the six classical schools of Indian 
thought, provides a systematic approach to understanding reality, 
knowledge, and logic, primarily through the work of the sage Gautama 
and his Nyāya Sūtras. Central to Nyāya is the concept of Ātman, or 
"self," which this essay explores in detail. Ātman in Nyāya is conceived 
as a permanent, unchanging entity distinct from the body and mind. 
This essay examines the definition and nature of Ātman, emphasizing 
its role in Nyāya’s epistemological framework, which includes 
perception (pratyakṣa), inference (anumāna), comparison (upamāna), 
and testimony (śabda). According to Nyāya, Ātman can be directly 
perceived through introspective self-awareness, and its existence is 
supported by arguments based on self-awareness, causal continuity, 
and logical necessity.

column11: PERCEPTION OF BUDDHIST PRINCIPLES INTO TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT: ENHANCING SRI LANKA'S GARMENT SECTOR WORKFORCE
column13: Human capital is one of the most valuable resources for any organization, especially in sectors like Sri Lanka’s garment industry, where a majority of the workforce consists of women. As Sri Lanka's garment sector, contributing over 40% of the country’s total exports, faces economic challenges, innovative approaches to workforce development are essential. This study explores the potential of integrating Buddhist principles into training and development to enhance the effectiveness and well-being of the garment sector workforce. Using a qualitative methodology, the research examines Buddhist texts alongside interviews with 25 trainers from five garment factories. The findings reveal significant awareness of Buddhist techniques for training, although practical barriers, such as lack of understanding and organizational challenges, hinder their widespread adoption. Participants expressed positive perceptions of the potential benefits of these principles, particularly in areas like stress management, leadership development, and ethics. The results indicate that while Buddhist teachings ar

column11: “What Makes a True Brahmin?: Exploring the Brahmana-Vagga of the Dhammapada”
column13: This paper explores the reinterpretation of the Brahmin identity within early Buddhist discourse by examining the Brahmana-Vagga (“The Chapter on the Brahmin”) of the Dhammapada, a seminal Buddhist work. In the Vedic tradition, the term “Brahmin” has traditionally been linked to caste and birthright. The Brahmana-Vagga, on the other hand, refutes this idea by defining the Brahmin not by ancestral status but by moral behavior, spiritual wisdom, and inner purity. This study emphasizes how characteristics like non-violence, self-control, and the quest for enlightenment are emphasized as crucial characteristics of a true Brahmin through a detailed examination of the verses. Thus, the Brahmana-Vagga offers a critique of established social structures and represents a larger change in early Buddhism that places a higher value on moral virtue and spiritual development than social stratification. Through this paper, we hope to gain a better understanding of how early Buddhist ethical and social philosophy was transformational.

column11: Crafting Children’s Literature in Sanskrit: Adaptation, Original Content, and Modern Engagement Strategies
column13:
The development of children's literature in Sanskrit presents a unique opportunity for both linguistic advancement and cultural preservation. This study delves into the strategies for creating compelling content for young readers, drawing from Sanskrit's extensive literary tradition, particularly the Ramayana, Mahabharat, Panchatantra, Hitopadesha, and Jataka Tales. These classical texts offer foundational storytelling examples that can be modified to suit the requirements of contemporary children's literature while retaining the depth of Sanskrit's vocabulary and moral narratives. The main focus of this paper is the Ramayana.

The adaptation process involves a focus on moral themes, empathy, and ethical quandaries, allowing children to connect with values central to Indian culture. Additionally, this research suggests the creation of original stories in Sanskrit addressing modern topics such as environmental conservation, collaboration, and social ethics.

column11: Pāli Taddhita - A Morphological Study
column13:
Exploring the intricacies of a language’s grammar requires a thorough analysis of its structure, rules,
and patterns. This endeavor becomes particularly enlightening when delving into classical languages
like Pāli and Sanskrit. In such linguistic studies, one not only understands word morphology, etymology,
sentence construction, syntax, and semantics but also gains insights into the history and cultural nuances
of the language’s speakers. Pāli, in particular, stands as a testament to the richness of grammatical
studies. Its grammar, a well-developed system akin to Sanskrit, unveils a wealth of knowledge embedded
not only in the language itself but also in the cultural heritage it carries.
In Pāli, Taddhitas, or secondary derivatives, are formed by appending specific suffixes to nouns. The
use of Taddhitas contributes to the conciseness and aesthetic quality of the language. These derivatives
provide valuable insights into the socio-cultural context of their time, including references to kings,
kingdoms, foods, festivals, and other elements of daily life. Attaching PDF.

column11: Philosophical Robustness as an effect of diversity in Indian Knowledge System
column13: Problem: Why does the Indian Knowledge System (IKS) contain so much diversity?This diversity brings robustness and adaptability, helping the IKS to evolve. From a graph theoretical perspective, a dense network of ideas, where nodes represent different philosophies and edges represent interactions or debates between them, is more robust to noise and perturbations. In such a network, the failure or invalidation of one idea does not collapse the entire system; instead, the network can adapt by relying on other interconnected ideas. This multiplicity of ideas fosters a culture of debate, dialogue, and synthesis, allowing for the coexistence of multiple truths and solutions. This intellectual flexibility is crucial for addressing complex and evolving real-world challenges. I will present mathematical approach to show the robustness of such idea networks.

column11: TRAIN HUMAN WITH BUDDHIST TEACHINGS FOR A SUSTAINBLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPEMNT
column13: Sri Lanka is facing a severe economic crisis, largely due to internal mismanagement, political interference, and shifting societal attitudes. The crisis has led to increased social problems, including a rise in suicides, robberies, and emigration. This study explores how Buddhist teachings, particularly on balance, mindfulness, and compassion, can be applied to address these economic challenges. The main objective is to examine how Buddhist principles of economic management can be integrated into Sri Lanka's economic policies and practices to promote sustainable development and resolve the ongoing crisis. The research uses a qualitative approach, analyzing the Buddhist Pali canon alongside contemporary economic theories and literature. This method provides a well-rounded understanding of how Buddhist teachings can be practically applied to modern economic management. The study highlights poverty as a core issue, showing that economic crises often stem from poor resource management. Buddhist teachings emphasize that hunger is the greatest disease, leading to immense suffering. The res

column11: A Mismatch Between the Tree and its Roots
column13: On a daily basis the meaning of dharma is stated as religion, duty, or justice. Dharma occurring multiple times in texts such as samhitās, Upanishads and smritis has several transition of meaning. In Mahābhārata Krishnā and Yudhiṣṭhira are the representatives of Dharma. They are highly regarded for practicing dharma, but in some instances it seems that their understanding of dharma is different. Yudhiṣṭhira is known for his righteousness; he was adhered to dharma. Whereas the perspective of dharma for Krishnā was different. Yudhiṣṭhira is the tree of Dharma and Krishnā is its roots  as defined by Vyās in Mahābhārata  युधिष्ठिरो धर्ममयो महाद्रुमः स्कन्धोऽर्जुनो भीमसेनोऽस्य शाखाः। माद्रीसुतौ पुष्पफले समृद्धे मूलं कृष्णो ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणाश्च⁠।⁠।⁠ (Mbh 1.1.111). But in some cases of Mahābhārata there is contradiction in action and words of dharma. For example when we look into the case of requesting five villages and not going for war. Yudhiṣṭhira agrees to accept five villages from Kauravās instead of fighting a battle that is leaving his kshatriya dharma behind but then Krishnā

column11: Panchanga parichaya
column13:
Abstract
अखिल भूमण्डले स्मिन् समुपलब्धेषु विविधभाषागत प्राचीनग्रन्थेषु वेदः सर्वेभ्यः प्राचीनतम इति सर्वैरव अंगीक्रियते। संहिता - ब्राह्मणारण्यकोपनिषदाभिप्रायेण वेदस्य चतुर्विभागाः विद्यन्ते। एतेषु चतुर्षु विभागेषु छन्दोबद्ध मन्त्ररूपो वैदिकदेवतास्तुतिपरको वैदिकमहर्षिभिः साक्षात्कृतो मुख्यविभागः संहिताशब्देन व्यवहियते। यथा ऋक्संहिता, यजुः संहिता, सामसंहिता / धर्वसंहिता ऋक्संहितायां च। स्तुतिपरकमन्त्राणां, यजुःसंहितायां याजकीयानां मन्त्राणां , सामसंहितायां गायनपरकमन्त्राणाम् अधर्वसंहितायां विविधविधविघ्न विनाशका / भिचारिकमन्त्राणाञ्च संग्रह। विद्यते||
एतेषाम् ऋगादीनां चतुर्णामपि वेदानाम् आविर्भावः यज्ञपुरुषदेव अभवत्। भगवती श्रुतिरेवात्र प्रमाणम् - तस्माद्यज्ञात्सर्वहुतः ऋचः सामानि जज्ञिरे। छन्दांसि जज्ञिरे तस्माद्यजुस्तस्मादजयत।। अपि च यस्मादृचो अपातक्षन् यजुर्यस्मादपाकषन् । सामानि यस्य लोमानि अथर्वा‌ङ्गिरसो मुखम् ॥ स्कम्भं तं ब्रूहि कतमः स्विदेव सः ।।

column13:

मार्गदर्शक:
संस्कृतभाषा-साहित्यविभाग:,क.का.सं.वि.रामटेकम्(महाराष्ट्रम्)
सारांश: -
डेग्वेकरोपाह्ण पाण्डुरङ्गशास्त्रीमहावर्यस्य विरचरितस्य श्रीकुरुक्षेत्रमहाकाव्ये अष्टादशसर्गा: विद्यन्ते ये खलु नातिस्वल्पा: नातिदीर्घाश्च । एतेषु सर्गेषु प्राय: सोमवंशस्य ऋक्षो नाम नृपत: कुरुपर्यन्तं वर्णनं कृतमस्ति । महाकाव्यदृष्ट्या महाकाव्यलक्षणयुक्तमेतद् काव्यं नैकान् विषयान् स्पृशति । 
शोधपत्रेऽस्मिन् श्रीकुरुक्षेत्रमहाकाव्यस्य विश्लेषणात्मकमध्ययनं क्रियते । काव्येऽस्मिन् प्राचीनकालस्य शासनपध्दति: राज्ञ: कर्तव्यानि प्रजानां कर्तव्यानि च सङ्घटनाया: महत्वम् हिंसाऽहिंसाविचार: आदीनां विश्लेषणमत्र क्रियते ।

column11: Heroism and Pathos: Karna’s Character through the Lens of Dhvanyaloka
column13:
ABSTRACT

Kavisamvadam is said in Dhvanyaloka by Anandavardhanacharya and in its Abhinava Gupta’s Lochana vyakhya. It describes like;
संवादो ह्यन्यसादृश्यम् तत्पुनः प्रतिबिम्बवत्। 
आलेख्याकारवत् तुल्यदेहिवच्च शरीरिणाम्।।
Here, the word संवादः refers to coincidence. Coincidence is the correspondence with one another. It can be mainly three types. It can be a person’s reflected image, can also be a painted one and can be like two persons which resembles each other. Every poetics and art works are inspired or adapted from one another. Neither both of the first and second coincidence are separately existing. According to the text, an intelligent man should avoid the first coincidence because a reflected image has no life of its own.  The second coincidence has no soul in it, but has a body of its own. The third, resemblance of two people may have a definite existence and they may identical too. It describes as;
तत्र पूर्वमनन्यात्म तुच्छात्म तदनन्तरम्।
तृतीयं तु प्रसिध्दात्म नान्यसाम्यं त्यजेत्कवि: ।।

column11: प्राकृत भाषा एवं साहित्य के विकास में दक्षिण भारत का योगदान
column13:
प्राकृत भाषा एवं साहित्य के विकास में दक्षिण भारत का योगदान
शोध सारांश : प्राकृत भाषा, प्राकृत का दक्षिण भारत में आगमन व विकास, दक्षिण में प्राकृत भाषा का प्रचार, द्रविड़ी भाषाओं पर प्राकृत का प्रभाव, प्राकृत भाषाओं पर द्रविड़ी का प्रभाव, दक्षिण भारत में रचित प्राकृत साहित्य, दक्षिण भारतीय आचार्यों की प्राकृत रचनायें, आचार्य भद्रबाहु का दक्षिण में मगध देश से आगमन, मौर्य सम्राट चन्द्रगुप्त की दक्षिण में साधना, आचार्य गुणधर, आचार्य पुष्पदंत एवं भूतबली का दक्षिण में विहार, वनवासी-तमिल देश में आगमन, आचार्य यतिवृषभ  की रचना, आचार्य वट्टकेर की रचना, आचार्य वीरसेन की धवला टीका, आचार्य जिनसेन, आचार्य नेमिचंद्र का योगदान, मध्ययुग में संस्कृत एवं कन्नड़ टीका रचनायें, पांडुलिपी संरक्षण, द्रविड़ लिपियों में प्राकृत ग्रंथों का संरक्षण, भट्टारक परंपरा का प्राकृत पांडुलिपी संरक्षण में योगदान, प्राकृत ग्रंथों पर आधुनिक द्रविड़ भाषाओंकी टीका एवं व्याख्यायें

column11: Understanding the Saga of Lairāī-Devi of Goa
column13:
The topic conveys a sense of exploration and depth, giving a detailed examination of the story and significance of the revered deity, Lairāī -Devi of Goa. This study delves into the narrative and ritualistic practices associated with her. She is believed to be the youngest amongst the seven sisters of Goa. These deities comprising of —Kelbāi, Mahāmāyā, Morjāi, Shītalā Devi, Mirābaī (Milāgris), Ajādipā, and Lairāī—and their brother Khetobā, youngest amongst them all. 
The paper explores the aftermath of the arrival of the Seven Sisters and Khetobā, in Goa, through the Chorlā Ghāt that connects Karnataka and Goa. Their journey culminated in their reception by Shāntādurgā- Devi in Ḍicholī and what ensued thereafter. The narrative includes a significant episode where the siblings' migration led to their settlements in various regions, including Shirgāo for Lairāī. Emphasis is on gradual increasing popularity of the cult of Lairāī, the youngest sister now the most prominent amongst these deities.

column11: अनुसन्धानक्षेत्रे पाण्डुलिप्याध्ययनस्यावश्यकता
column13:
पाण्डुलिपिः - पाण्डुः पीत-पत्राणि, लिपि -लेपनात् लिम्पनात् इति। भारतवर्षे प्राय: पञ्चाशत् - लक्षाधिका: पाण्डुलिपयः सन्ति । । मातृका: ( पाण्डुलिपिः )कस्यापि प्रकाशितग्रन्थस्य प्रथम: हस्तलेख: (autograph ) भवति ।अतः सः ग्रन्थस्याधारत्वेन विराजति, भारतीयज्ञानपरम्परायां पाण्डुलिपीनां अवदानं बहुमहत्त्वपूर्णम् अस्ति।  इमा:
पाण्डुलिपय: एव समग्रमसंस्कृत वाङ्मयस्य (वैदिक-लौकिकयोः उभयो:) नींव: (आधारभूता: स्तम्भाः) सन्ति। पाण्डुलिपीनां विना " प्रकाशमानस्य ग्रन्थस्य शुद्धपाठ -निर्धारणं न सम्भवति, येन विना पुस्तकस्य अपि प्रकाशनं न सम्भवति । इति । सम्प्रति पाण्डुलिपिशब्दार्थः विचार्यते पाण्डुलिपि नाम हस्तेन लिखितायाः रचनायाः प्रारम्भिकं प्रारूपं भवति। अद्य पाण्डुलिपिः इति शब्दः हस्तलेखस्य पर्यायत्वेन प्रयुज्यते । इतिहासेन ज्ञायते आदौ भूमौ लेखनं ततः भित्तौ लिखनं, पश्चात् काष्ठेषु फलकेषु तालपत्रेषु इति क्रमशः लेखनस्याधारः परिवर्तनं प्राप्नोत् ।
पाण्डुलिपिरिति समस्ते पदे पाण्डुलिपिः इति अवान्तरपदद्वयं वर्तते । आद्यस्य पदस्य श्वेतः पीतो वा इत्यर्थः । लिपिशब्दस्य वर्णप्रतीकम् अक्षरप्रतीकं वा इत्यर्थः।
पाण्डुलेख:- पाण्डुलेख इति शब्दः कमपि विशिष्टमर्थं प्रतिपादयति ।

column13:
बालरामायण में नाट्यतंत्र

डॉ. बन्सी लव्हाळे 
संस्कृत और कोशशास्त्र विभाग डेक्कन कॉलेज, अभिमत विद्यापीठ, पुणे
bansilawhale@gmail.com

संस्कृत एवं प्राकृत साहित्य के क्षेत्र में कविराज राजशेखर का नाम अत्यंत आदर के साथ लिया जाता है । बालरामायण, बालभारत, कर्पूरमंजरी, विद्धशालभंजिका ऐसे रूपकों के साथ काव्यमीमांसा नामक काव्यशास्त्रीय ग्रंथ की रचना राजशेखर ने की है । अतः राजशेखर को प्रतिभासंपन्न कवि एवं काव्यमीमांसक कहते है । नाट्यशास्त्रीय तत्त्वों के साथ अपने नाटकों की रचना राजशेखर ने की है । आचार्य भरत ने नाट्यशास्त्र में नाट्यतंत्र का विस्तृत विवेचन किया है । इस नाट्यतंत्र का उपयोग राजशेखर ने अपने नाटकों में किया है । राजशेखर के बालरामायण नाटक में नाट्यतंत्र का प्रयोग कैसे किया? इस विषय पर चिंतन प्रस्तुत लेख में किया है ।

column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
This platform is aimed at collating the information from institutes, which impart education in Samskrit, its allied languages, and Samskrit shastras such as Vyakarana, Nyaya, Vedanta, Mimamsa, Ayurveda, Ganita, Jyotisha, and so on.
In the initial phase of the project, the platform will list all the campuses of Central Sanskrit University and provide course details including the database of scholars working at those campuses. The august audience will also witness the Proof of Concept of the same as web-app.

column11: CONCEPT OF INDIAN MATERIALISM
column13:
CONCEPT OF INDIAN MATERIALISM

ABSTRACT

Indian materialism has also been named Carvaka after one of the 
two founder of the school. Carvaka and Ajitha Kesakambalin are said 
to have established Indian materialism as a formal philosophical system 
but some still hold that Brahaspati was its original founder. Brahaspati 
allegedly authored the classic work on Indian materialism the 
Brahaspati sutra. There are some conflicting accounts of Brahaspati, 
life, but at the least he is regarded as the Mythical authority on Indian 
materialism and at most the actual author of the since-perished 
Brahaspati sutra. Indian materialism has to this reason also been named 
'Brahaspati'.

column11: BHAGAVADGITA STUDIES
column13:
URJA SRIHARI
                                                                                                                M.A in VEDANTA,
                                                                         Karnataka Sanskrit University, Bangalore
Abstract submission 
 
 Bhagavad Geeta Studies
 
अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयान् आत्मस्य जन्तोर्निहितो गुहायाम्।
तमकृतः पश्यति वीतशोको धातुप्रसादन महिमानमात्मनः॥ (कठोपनिषत् 1-2-20)

अणोरणीयान् महतो महीयान् आत्मा गुहायां निहितोऽस्य जन्तोः।
तमक्रतुः पश्यति वीतशोको धातुप्रसादात् महिमानमात्मनः॥ (श्वेताश्वतरोपनिषत् 3-20)  
 
 (Have refrained to use traditional way of punctuations and symbols..with an intent for ease of read)
 
Both verses slightly different in verbatim, succinctly describes that Brahman who happens to be Smaller than the smallest Anu and Bigger than the Biggest Mahath…to be that Dhatu…The Root for the souls’ to salvate.
However this Anu and Mahath which can be best described as Oxymoron  are  seemingly invisible, Intangible, indeclinable, unfathomable traits of that Brahman.., but the Upanishad advises the Aatman the........

column11: Changing dynamics in kathak : critical study
column13:
changing dynamics in kathak : critical study

      Indian classical dance embodies old traditions and customs. The eight classical dances of India represent various cultures. Dance forms have evolved over time, but their origins can be traced back to ancient scriptures such as Bharata Muni's Natyashastra. Kathak is a traditional dance form that originated in North India and is widely appreciated throughout India. Kathak is related with a story that began as a practice of telling people about gods and local deities using facial gestures and hand movements. Kathak has been mentioned in history from the 4th century BC, and the first performers were a nomadic tribe of artisans known as the Kathaka.
They would journey from one village to another, narrating tales from the mythology of India. These road shows eventually evolved into court performances, and they are currently presented as theatrical productions.
           This research paper studies the graph of changes in kathak from its origin to current time. This is a comparative study of its original and today's changed form.

column11: Chaaris Mohiniyattam through sangeetharathnakara
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
Chaaris Mohiniyattam through sangeetharathnakara


The Sangeetharathnakara is a book composed in 13 th centuary. Acomprehensive analysis of sangeetham ,vadyam  ,Nritham  has been presented in this book by the author saarngadeva. Nritha is the vividly illustrated in the 7 th chapter . 1690 Slokas are covered in this chapter alone. Mohiniyattam is one of the most enchantress classical dance form of south india. Mohiniyattam is very difficult to perform  learn and teaching also . Despite the title of simple art ...this is the reality .The Anga movements are very different .This paper deals with a brief study of chaaris and ...mohiniyatta chaaris as described in the sangeetharathnakara  grandha.This thesis also discusses  how to approach dance from the prayoga level (application ).

column13: प्राचीन समय में रसायन विज्ञान का धातुवाद भी एक महत्त्वपूर्ण अध्ययन का विषय रहा है ‍। जिसमे प्राचीन काल के नागार्जुन, मध्यकाल के गोरक्षनाथ और चाणक्य तक ने इस विषय के माध्यम से आर्थिक पक्ष को सशक्त करने की बात की है ‍।इसी विषय को एक नए दृष्टिकोण से प्राचीन एवं आधुनिक विश्लेषण कर के प्रायोगिक और सैद्धांतिक पक्ष को विश्व के समक्ष रख सकते है‍ । जिनसे भारतीय ज्ञान परम्परा में निहित वैज्ञानिकता हम आधुनिक परिपेक्ष्य में प्रस्तुत कर पुनः जीवंत कर सकते है आधुनिक परमाणुवाद के सिद्धांत और रसायन विज्ञान के प्राचीन सिद्धांत के बीच कुछ समानताएं और कुछ अंतर हैं। इसी विषय को हमने प्राचीन विज्ञान के सिद्धान्त को देख प्रायोगिक विश्लेषण किया और एक आश्चर्यपूर्ण परिणाम प्राप्त किया अर्थात पारे को सोने और रजत में परिवर्तित करने में सफलता प्राप्ति की वह भी एक अत्यंत अल्प खर्च में यह विज्ञान अपने आप में अद्वितय है | प्राय हम हमारे शास्त्रों को पढ़ते है उनमे रही वैज्ञानिकता का गौरव लेते है लेकिन हम हमारे शास्त्रों का प्रायोगिक नहीं करते लेकिन इस परिणाम से हमें ये ज्ञात हुवा की हां रस विद्या के मध्याम से धातु परिवर्तान संभव है अंत में सुवर्ण निर्माण संभव हुआ जिनका सम्पूर्ण विवरण आगे शोध पत्र में किया गया है l

column11: भारतीय चिन्तन प्रणाली में शिक्षा का स्वरूप
column13:
भारतीय चिन्तन प्रणाली शिक्षा को आवश्यक प्राप्य के रूप में स्वीकार करती है। शिक्षा के द्वारा ही शास्त्रों के अनुशासन का अभिज्ञान प्राप्त होता है। शास्त्र  प्रत्यक्ष ज्ञान के साथ ही अनुभव तथा आप्त (शब्द) प्रमाण के द्वारा यथार्थ ज्ञान से परिचित कराते हैं । शास्त्र हमें अन्तर्दृष्टि प्रदान करके पारिभाषिक शब्दों के भीतर निहित तत्वों से अवगत करते हैं। इसलिए भारतीय चिन्तन प्रणाली का मन्तव्य है कि "शास्त्र संशयों को दूर करने वाले तथा परोज्ञ ज्ञान को प्रकाशित करने वाले अन्तर्चक्षु हैं। जिस मनुष्य के पास शास्त्र रूपी अन्तर्दृष्टि नही है वह अन्धवत् ही है-
 अनेकसंशयोच्छेदि परोक्षार्थस्य दर्शकम्। 
 सर्वस्य लोचनं शास्त्रं यस्य नास्त्यन्ध एव स:।।

column4: Department of Pali and Buddhist Studies, Savitribai Phule Pune University Pune
column11: Characteristics of Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit with Special Reference to Mṛgadāya of Mahāvastu
column13:
Characteristics of Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit with Special Reference to Mṛgadāya of 
Mahāvastu

Abstract
Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit (BHS) is a distinct language form that developed as Buddhist 
teachings spread. It shows a mix of Middle Indic languages and classical Sanskrit, becoming 
more like Sanskrit while keeping some Prakrit influences. As Edgerton argued, BHS is 
primarily a Middle Indic language that evolved over time. The Mahāvastu, a key text of the 
Lokottaravāda school, is an important example of this language. In the Mahāvastu, the 
Mṛgadāya, which tells the story of a compassionate deer, provides a useful case for analyzing 
the grammar of BHS.
This case study looks at the grammatical features of the Mṛgadāya by classifying its nouns, 
pronouns, verbs, cases, and genders. My analysis shows how BHS maintains classical Sanskrit 
forms but also adopts Prakrit forms. From Edgerton’s Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit Reader and 
BHS Grammar, I examine specific examples from the Mṛgadāya, such as the different verb 
forms—bhavati, bhoti, hoti, bhaviti.

column11: CONCEPT OF INDIAN MATERIALISM
column13:
CONCEPT OF INDIAN MATERIALISM
ABSTRACT
Indian materialism has also been named Carvaka after one of the 
two founder of the school. Carvaka and Ajitha Kesakambalin are said 
to have established Indian materialism as a formal philosophical system 
but some still hold that Brahaspati was its original founder. Brahaspati 
allegedly authored the classic work on Indian materialism the 
Brahaspati sutra. There are some conflicting accounts of Brahaspati, 
life, but at the least he is regarded as the Mythical authority on Indian 
materialism and at most the actual author of the since-perished 
Brahaspati sutra. Indian materialism has to this reason also been named 
'Brahaspati.

column11: संस्कृतभाषायां पदद्विर्वचनप्रयोगविचारः
column13: भगवता पाणिनिना अष्टमाध्यायस्य चतुर्थपादे पदद्विर्वचनव्यवस्था कल्पितास्ति।चतुर्दशसूत्रात्मकेऽस्मिन् प्रकरणे नित्यवीप्सयोः,परेर्वर्जने प्रसमुपोदःपादपूरणे उपर्यध्यधसः सामीप्ये, एकं बहुव्रीहिवत्, आबाधे च , प्रकारे गुणवचनस्य इत्येतैः सूत्रैः विविधेष्वर्थेषु पदस्य द्विर्वचनं विधीयते। यथा-  पश्यति पश्यति।अत्र नित्यार्थे द्विर्वचनम्।नित्यपदार्थो हि आभीक्ष्ण्यम्।आभीक्ष्ण्यं च पौनःपुन्यम्।तच्च क्रियाविषयम् , पुनः पुनः पश्यति इत्यर्थः। वीप्सायाम् – तीर्थे तीर्थे स्नाति। विप्सा हि व्याप्तुमिच्छा।अनवयवाभिधानं वीप्सा।तुल्यजातीयानां भिन्नानाम् एकरूपगुणादावन्वयः वीप्सा।यावन्तः तीर्थव्शेषा बुद्धिविषयाः तेषु सर्वेषु तीर्थेषु स्नातीत्यर्थः।एवं रीत्या अत्र प्रबन्धे द्विर्वचनप्र्योगान् परिशील्य काव्यप्रयोगाः अपि विचार्यन्ते।यथा- मन्दमन्दमपयद्वलित्रया इत् पद्ये मन्दम् इति गु्णवचनस्य द्विर्वचने सति कर्मधारयवद्भावे च मन्दमन्दम् इति भवति।तर्ह् कालिदासेन मन्दं मन्दं नुदति पवनः इति पद्ये कथं समासवद्बावो न कृतः ? अत्र द्विर्वचनं नास्तीति वक्तव्यम्।स्वभावतः मन्दं त्वां वायुः मन्दं नुदति इति योजना कार्या।

column11: वैदिकेषु-भौतिकम्, भौतिकेषु-सामाजिकम्, सामाजिकेषु-नैतिकम् अभिलक्षमाणाः…..
column13: ‘भारतस्य प्रतिष्ठे द्वे- संस्कृतं संस्कृतिस्तथा’ इति सदुक्तिः वाङ्मये लोके विश्रूयते। भारतमिति देहस्य चरणत्वेन उपस्थितौ एतावंशौ। संस्कृतं विना संस्कृतिर्न जीवति। संस्कृतेर्विना संस्कृतमपि। तादृशस्य संस्कृतस्य परम्परा अनादिभूता वर्तते। यथा देहात् ऋते आत्मा न परिलक्ष्यते तथा संस्कृतमपि संस्कृतिर्विना न अवगाहते। संस्कृतवाङ्मयस्य प्रतिपाङ्क्ति संस्कृतिः जेगीयते इति उक्ते नेयमतिशयोक्तिर्भवति।आधिभौतिकेषु विचारेषु भौतिकमिदं जगत्, तत्र च जायमानाः क्रियाकलापाः, सामाजिकी व्यवस्था, व्यवस्थासु नारीणां किं स्थानमिति च विषयाः तत्र तत्र लक्ष्यन्ते इति मे मतिः। अनेन विचारप्रकरणेन वैदिकः समाजः कीदृशः परिदृष्टः? तस्मिन् समाजे नैतिकी मौल्ययुता दृष्टिः का बभूव? अपि च नारीणां वैदिके समाजे किं स्थानमानं प्राप्तमित्यादि विषयं सोदाहरणव्याख्यैः सह विमर्शयितुमीहे।वैदिकं पन्थानम् अनुसरन्तः, तेषु वेदेषु उक्तान् विचारान् अस्माकं जीवने आदधानाः वयं स्वस्थं, सुहृदं च समाजं अभिलक्षमाणाः, वैदिकासु विचारधारासु अस्मच्चेतांसि निमज्जयामः इति विवेकः।

column11: कर्मवद्भावपरिशीलनम्
column13:
कर्मवद्भावपरिशीलनम्


गुरुभ्यश्च ग्रहेभ्यश्च मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः । प्रसन्नमनसस्ते मे सत्यां कुर्वन्तु भारतीम् ॥
प्रयुक्तानामिदन्वाख्यानं व्याकरणम्। अत एव आचार्येण सिद्धे शब्दार्थसम्बन्धे इति कथयित्रा भगवतः पाणिनेः शब्दार्थसम्बन्धस्य स्मर्तृत्वं प्रत्यपादि, न तु शब्दार्थसम्बन्धोत्पादकत्वम्। लौकिकस्य वैदिकस्य च व्यवहारस्य शास्त्रानुविद्धत्वं कालचक्रे परिवृतेपि स्यादिति धिया वेदाङ्गत्वेन वेदरक्षां प्रधानप्रयोजनत्वेनोद्दिश्य भगवान् पाणिनिः सूत्राणि रचयामास। तत्र अधिगच्छति शास्त्रार्थः, पच्यते ओदनः स्वयमेव, एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे। कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे॥ चयस्त्विषामित्यवधारितं पुरा ततः शरीरीति विभाविताकृतिम्। विभुर्विभक्तावयवं पुमानिति क्रमादमुं नारद इत्यबोधि सः॥ इत्यादिषु लोककाव्यप्रयोगेषु कर्मणः कर्तृत्वविवक्षया प्रयोगः दरीदृश्यते। ग्रामः गम्यते स्वयमेव, देवः दृश्यते स्वयमेव इत्यादयः तु प्रयोगाः न दृश्यन्ते। भाषाप्रपञ्चे ईदृशस्य प्रयोगस्य साधकं सूत्रं पाणिनीयं कर्मवत्कर्मणा तुल्यक्रियः इति। कर्मणः स्वभाववैचित्र्यादेवं प्रयोगवै

column11: Vitaṇḍā: A Futile Harassment or an Intellectual Exercise?
column13: Indian philosophical schools typically follow the argumentative method. Philosophical discourses, called kathā, are of three types–– vāda, jalpa and vitaṇḍā. This classification is based on the goal of the deliberation, such as the attainment of truth or victory, and the method, such as stating the thesis and resorting to deceptive means. Out of these three types of deliberations, vitaṇḍā is the one where the debater neither presents his thesis nor aims at attaining the truth–– he merely seeks victory by any means. This gives us the impression that such a kind of discourse must be futile and harassing. However, if we consider the Indian sceptical tradition, we will find philosophers who deliberately employed this vitaṇḍā method in their philosophical texts, thereby being called vaitaṇḍika-s. Although the first known Indian sceptic, Sañjaya, cannot be conclusively called a vaitaṇḍika, Nāgārjuna, Jayarāśi and Śrīharṣa are well-known to scholars of Philosophy as the three pillars of Indian scepticism. Out of them, Jayarāśi seems to be the true sceptic as his Tattvopaplavasiṁha bears no

column4: Department of Sanskrit and Prakrit, Savitribai Phule Pune University
column11: From Prakrit to Marathi: The continuity and transformation of languages in social and cultural perspective.
column13:
This paper explores the linguistic evolution from Prakrit to Marathi, challenging the common belief that Marathi primarily evolved from Sanskrit. While Sanskrit has been traditionally regarded as the root of most Indian languages, this research highlights the significant influence of Prakrit. The study traces the development of Marathi over 1200 years, showing that it retained a distinct identity and continued to be recognized as a Prakrit language until the 18th century.
The research addresses three key problems: the widespread belief in Sanskrit's sole contribution to Marathi, the incorporation of Sanskrit words into Marathi, and the difficulty of connecting morphological and phonological changes in Prakrit to modern Marathi. The primary objectives include linking Marathi to its Prakrit origins through social and cultural lenses, examining the morphological and phonological evolution of Marathi words, and demonstrating how Prakrit rem

column11: Chaaris Mohiniyatta throgh Sangeetharathnakara
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
Chaaris Mohiniyatta throgh 
           Sangeetharathnakara

    
             The Sangeetharathnakara is a grandha composed in 13 th century . A comprehensive analysis of sangeetham vaadyam and Nritham has been presented  in this grandha by the author saarngadeva.Nritha is vividly illustrated in the 7th chapter .1690 slokas are covered in this chapter alone.Mohiniyattam is one of the most enchantress classical dance form of south India.Mohiniyattam is very difficult to perform .. learn and teaching also .Despite the title of simple art..this is the reality .The Anga movements are very different .This paper deals with a brief study of chaaris and Mohiniyatta charis as described in sangeetharathnakara. This thesis also discusses how to approach dance from the prayoga level .

column11: Philosophical Robustness as an effect of diversity in Indian Knowledge System
column13: Indian Knowledge System has proven extreme resilience to external influence and corruption while being highly diverse. This diversity brings robustness and adaptability, helping the IKS to evolve. From a graph theoretical perspective, a dense network of ideas, where nodes represent different philosophies and edges represent interactions or debates between them, is more robust to noise and perturbations. In such a network, the failure or invalidation of one idea does not collapse the entire system; instead, the network can adapt by relying on other interconnected ideas. This multiplicity of ideas fosters a culture of debate, dialogue, and synthesis, allowing for the coexistence of multiple truths and solutions. This intellectual flexibility is crucial for addressing complex and evolving real-world challenges. I will present a mathematical approach to show the robustness of such idea networks.

column4: Shah And Anchor Kutchhi Engineering College
column11: Raga-Rasa-Laya: Unveiling the interplay of Melody and Rhythm in evoking emotions
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13: Music profoundly impacts our emotions, from calm and empathy to joy. Indian classical music uses melodic (raga) and rhythmic (laya) elements to structure compositions episodically, evoking specific emotional responses or rasas. This study explores how these elements combine to create powerful emotional experiences, referencing ancient texts called Lakshana granthas to link ragas with emotions like Shringara, Veera, Karuna, and Shant. We analyze both instrumental and vocal music to understand these connections, focusing on how rhythm influences emotional expression. Our research challenges the traditional view that slower tempos are necessary for tranquility by investigating how drut laya (fast tempo) can express Shant rasa (peacefulness). Additionally, we introduce a Machine Learning-powered music streaming system that recommends ragas based on the listener's emotional state, using past listening habits and real-time feedback for personalization. Listener surveys validate our findings and compare them with traditional raga-rasa associations, providing new insights.

column4: Oriental Institute, The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara
column11: Rādhācaritam : A Study
column13: It is interesting to say that Sanskrit poets of our time are writing biographical poems or charitakāvyas on the lives of the great persons. One prominent example in this emerging literary trend is the Rādhācaritam, penned by Harinarayaṇa Dixita. Harinarayaṇa Dixita has authored a total of four charitakāvyas thus far, which include Bhiṣmacaritam, Gvalladevacaritam, Gurumahārājacaritam, alongside his most praiseworthy work—the Rādhācaritam. All the epics written by Harinarayana Dikshit cover different topics that are meaningful and relatable to today’s readers. Each of these works reflects a deep engagement with historical figures and mythological narratives while employing rich poetic devices characteristic of Sanskrit literature. Rādhācaritam itself is an elaborate Caritakāvya that intricately weaves together the life story of Rādhā, portraying her unwavering devotion to Srī Kṛṣna. The inclusion of a Hindi translation significantly enhances its accessibility, allowing it to reach a wider audience beyond those fluent in Sanskrit.
