column11: डुग्गर का लोक संगीत- भाख
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13: लोकगीत तथा लोक संगीत का संबंध तथा शरीर आत्मा की भांति है। एक के बिना दूसरा अधूरा है। लोकगीत मात्र शब्द और छंद का मेल नहीं अपितु सुर और ताल का संगम है। डुग्गर में लोकगीतों के विविध रूप मिलते हैं। जिनमें विषय गी विविधता के साथ-साथ संगीत-शैली में भी विविधता देखी जा सकती है। विषय और संगीत-शैली की दृष्टी से इन लोकगीतों को मुख्य दो भागों में विभाजित किया गया है। इन दोनों ही रूपों में जनमानस गी भावनाओं की अक्कासी हुई है। प्रस्तुति के अभाव में इन दोनों रूपों के शब्द चयन या भाव में समानता दिखती है। परन्तु एक रूप अपनी गायन-शैली के कारण डुग्गर प्रदेश के अतिरिक्त अन्य प्रदेशों के संगीत से भिन्न रूप लिये अपना विशिष्ट स्थान रखता है। इस संगीत शैली को डोगरी भाषा में ‘भाख’ के रूप में जाना जाता है।

column11: Prākṛta-Influenced Saṃskṛta: A Survey through the Dvirūpakoṣas
column13:
(Complete abstract cannot be pasted due to character limit of this text box. It has been added to .docx file of complete paper)

This paper will discuss how the interaction between these languages led to the origin of such alternative forms and how they became grammatically valid, leading to their usage in classical Saṃskṛta literature. 
For instance, Saṃskṛta word “bhindipāla” – used for instrument like sling for throwing stone becomes “bhiṇḍivāla” when it undergoes Prakritization. An instance of occurrence of the influenced form of “bhiṇḍipāla” where “ṇḍ” is used instead of “nd” is Bhāsa’s Ūrubhaṅga. During the re-Saṃskṛtization, the “v” sound was again changed to “p”, but “ṇḍ” somehow stayed. This implies that the Prakritized Saṃskṛta word underwent reSaṃskṛtization under whose influence, “bhiṇḍipāla” – an alternative form for “bhindipāla” exists.

column11: Fundamental Concepts of physics in Vaisheshik darshan
column13: The Vaisheshik Darshan, one of the classical systems of Indian philosophy,founded by maharishi Kanad, provides a distinctive framework for understanding the fundamental nature of reality, particularly in the context of physics. In this paper, we try to explore the fundamental concepts of physics as presented in the Vaisheshik Darshan, emphasizing its contributions to the understanding of matter, motion, and causality. Central to this philosophical system is the concept of 'Padarthas' (categories of reality), which include substances, qualities, actions, generalities, and universals. The Vaisheshik Darshan postulates that the material world is composed of indivisible atoms (paramanus) and the interactions between these atoms account for physical phenomena from the sutras .

*तन्त्रागमदर्शनोक्त- पतिपशुपाशेति तत्त्वत्रयाणां शैक्षिकोपादेयता* 
 आगमतन्त्रेषु शैवागमतन्त्रम्
अनुपमागमो विद्यते। शैवागमोक्तं ज्ञानं सर्वं श्रेयास्पदं वर्तते। तत्र विनिर्दिष्टाः सर्वाः क्रियाः स्वीकृत्य तथाचरितुं वर्तमानशिक्षायां सुकरं न प्रतीयते परं तत्र समुद्धृतं ज्ञानं, तत्वं,ज्ञानविषयकं चिन्तनं च समन्वयस्थापने, समत्वभावानायाः विकासे, आत्मनः प्रगतिशीलेन विकासेन सह अनुकरणीयव्यक्तित्वस्य उच्चतमविकासे च महदुपकारकं प्रतिभातीति। तत्र पतिः, पशुः पाशश्चेति पदार्थत्रयमाध्यमेन ईश्वरस्य जगतः प्राणिनां च स्वरूपस्य विषये तेषां कर्तव्यसन्दर्भे च चिन्तनं विहितमस्ति।
इति किरणागमवचनानुसारं तस्य कर्तृत्वं न सिध्यति इति वाच्यम्, अक्षरहितस्यापि अयस्कान्तमणेर्यथा लौहाकर्षणे कर्तृत्वं दृश्यते, तद्वदत्रापि ज्ञायताम् । एवं भूते पतिः (शवः) पञ्चमन्त्रतनुत्वमभिधारयति। पञ्चमन्त्रमयवपुः पतिः (शिवः) स्वेच्छया पञ्चकर्माणि सम्पादयति।

column11: श्रेष्ठ संतति सृजन में जननी की भूमिका का माहात्म्य
column13:
इस जगत में जितने प्राणी हैं उनमें मनुष्य सबसे अधिक बुद्धिमान माना जाता है जिसे ईश्वर ने इतना विवेक प्रदान किया है कि वह सत्य व असत्य नित्य व अनित्य को स्पष्ट रूप से पृथक पृथक देख सकता है 
मनुष्य जो अपनी दृढ़ इच्छा शक्ति, संकल्प व अखंड प्रचंड पुरुषार्थ से इस पूरे सृष्टि क्रम को प्रभावित कर सकता है | मानव यदि चाहे तो अपने सात्विक विचारों व प्रयासों से संसार में सत्त्व की स्थापना करके सबको सुखी कर सकता है और चाहे तो अपनी नकारात्मक क्रियाकलापों से विश्व की शांति भी भंग कर सकता है चूंकि  मनुष्य में इतना अधिक अपरिमित सामर्थ्य होता है अतः इसकी सर्जना करते समय गृहस्थियों  को विशेष रूप से सजग व सावधान होना चाहिए 
अन्य सभी सांसारिक उत्तरदायित्वों की तुलना में श्रेष्ठ संतति सृजन को प्राथमिकता देते हुए उसके निर्माण के लिए आवश्यक शारीरिक मानसिक व वाचनिक  सभी प्रकार के संयम का पालन हर क्षण करना चाहिए  इसकी महत्ता  का वर्णन करते हुए महर्षि मनु भी मनुस्मृति में  कहते हैं 

यथा वायुं समाश्रित्य सर्वे जीवन्ति जन्तवः

column11: अनीर्वचनीयख्यातेः आधुनिककाले उपादेयता
column13:
आधुनिकाकाले अनिर्वचनीयख्यातेः उपादेयता – Abstract. 
इह संसारार्णवे जगति समेषां जनिमतां दुःखनिदानम् अज्ञानमेव । तदन्मूलनेन परमपुरुषार्थभूतनिश्रेयसस्य अधिगमाय तत्वदर्शिनः महर्षयः अधिकारिभेदेन नैकानि दर्शनानि तत्वनिरुपणपराणि व्यरचयन्।  निरसनीयस्य मिथ्याज्ञानस्य याथात्म्यनिर्धारणाय समेऽपि दार्शनिकाः भूयसः विचारान् व्यदधुः । ते ख्यातिवादः" इति नाम्ना विप्रतिपत्तिपौष्कल्येन भारतीयदर्शनेषु असाधारणपदम् अलङ्कुर्वन्ति । ते च इत्थं - 
आत्मख्यातिः असत्ख्यातिः अख्यातिः ख्यातिरन्यथा ।
तथा अनीर्वचनीयख्यातिः इत्येतत् ख्यातिपञ्चकम् ।।
आधुनिकयुगे अस्माकं शास्त्राणां समन्वयपक्षः प्रदर्शनीयः भवति । तदेव वयम् आधुनिकपरिभाषायां Social Utility इति वदामः । यावत् पर्यन्तं समन्वयः न भवति तावत् पर्यन्तं लौकिकैः न उपादीयते। सर्वेषां शास्त्राणां तत्रत्य प्रमेयान् वयं युगानुकूलतया बोधयामः तदानीमेव शास्त्राणाम् अविच्छिन्नरूपेण अनुगमनं सर्वथा भविष्यति। अन्यथा शास्त्रपरम्परा हीयेत । तद्दीशि चिन्तयामः इति ज्येष्ठानां वचनानुसारेण अनिर्वचनीयख्यतेः आधुनिकपरिभाषा कथं चिन्तयितुं शक्या इति निरूपणार्थं मया अत्र कश्चन यत्नव

column11: The Concept of Chitta Bhumi – An Analytical Study with Daily Lifestyle
column13:
The Concept of Chitta Bhumi – An Analytical Study with Daily Lifestyle

Abstract-
Chitta Bhumi, as explained in Vyas Bhasya of Patanjali's Yogasutra, refers to the stages of mind influenced by Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas gunas. This study analyzes the impact of Chitta Bhumi on daily life, where multiple tasks and stress affect health, thinking patterns, sleep cycles, energy levels, and self-esteem. By understanding Chitta Bhumi, one can gain insight into their mental state and reduce disturbing lifestyle patterns. The paper explores various mental diseases and their physical outcomes. Some yogic techniques like asanas, pranayama, pranava japa, dhyana, yoga nidra are helpful to cure.
In conclusion, the paper emphasizes to figure out the stages of chitta so that one can differentiate the dense pattern of mind and can move on the better path for progress in life.
Keywords: Chitta Bhumi, Trigunas, Stress, Mental Diseases, Lifestyle, Yogic Techniques.

column11: Effect of Yoga on Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS): A Systematic Review
column13:
Abstract: 
Background: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common gastrointestinal disorder, which is estimated to affect around 4.1% of the global population. IBS is a group of symptoms that occur together, including repeated pain in abdomen and changes in bowel movements, which may be diarrhea, constipation, or both. 
Purpose: The key goal of this review is to obtain a deeper comprehension of the impact of yoga interventions on IBS symptoms.
Methods: A Systematic Review of original research included in the PubMed, Science Direct, Cochrane and Google Scholar databases. Clinical studies involving yoga as a therapeutic intervention and showed results in relieving IBS symptoms included.
Conclusions: This review has shown that several forms of yoga interventions were beneficial in managing the symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome.
Keywords:  IBS, Irritable Bowl Syndrome, Yoga, Yogic intervention, clinical trials, Review.

column11: Rejuvenating Elder Minds: Reinventing Sanskrit for Lifelong Learning in Later Life
column13: The article "Rejuvenating Elder Minds: Reinventing Sanskrit for Lifelong Learning in Later Life" explores the untapped potential of Sanskrit education in enhancing the mental, emotional, and social well-being of elderly individuals. It highlights the psychological challenges elderly face, such as loneliness, depression, and cognitive decline, and proposes lifelong learning as an antidote. Sanskrit, with its rich philosophical and devotional literature, offers unique intellectual engagement that promotes cognitive function, emotional resilience, and social interaction. Engaging with texts like the Bhagavad Gita and Upanishads provides elderly learners with mental stimulation and a renewed sense of purpose. The article also underscores the role of intergenerational learning, where younger and older students benefit from each other’s energy and wisdom, creating a cooperative educational environment. Lifelong learning in Sanskrit can bridge generational gaps and foster a community where elders contribute meaningfully to society, utilizing their life experience and philosophical insights.

column11: कालिदासकाव्येषु धर्मशास्त्र सन्दर्भाः
column13:
छन्दः पादो तु वेदस्य हसतौ कल्पोऽथं पठ्यते।
	ज्योतिषामयनं चक्षुर्निरूक्तं श्रोत्रमुच्यते।।
	शिक्षा घ्राणं तु वेदस्य मुखं व्याकरणं स्मृतम्।
	तस्मात्साङ्गमधीत्यैव ब्रह्मलोके महीयते।।
कालिदासकाव्येषु कल्पस्य विवरणं व्यापकतया तभ्यते। महाकवि गृह्य-श्रौत-धर्म-सूत्राणां सम्यक् ज्ञानं दधाति स्मेति तत्काव्यैः सिध्यति। कविः रघुवंशे प्रथमसर्गे कल्पशब्दस्य प्रयोगमपि करोति। यदा वसिष्ठो मुनिः कल्पठित् इति कथितः। यद्यपि तस्य ऋषेः तपःसिद्धिरासीत् तपसैव राजोचिताहारसम्पादनसामर्थ्य तस्मिन् बभूव, तथापि नियमोपेक्षया अर्थात् तदाप्रभृत्येव व्रतपर्यायाः अप्रेक्षया राज्ञः विलीपस्य कृते वनोचितामेव संविधां सामग्रीं सम्पादयामास-

column11: भारतीय ज्ञान प्रणली के अंतर्गत वास्तुशास्त्र में मापन इकाईयों का अध्ययन
column13: भारतीय ज्ञान परंपरा प्राचीन भारतीय संस्कृति एवं परंपरा में निहित विभिन्न क्षेत्रों के ज्ञान और प्रथाओं का सुदृढ एवं सुसंस्कृत प्रारूप है । भारतीय संस्कृति तथा इसके अपूर्व ज्ञान मंडार को जानने एवं समझने के लिए भारतीय ज्ञान परंपरा का अध्ययन सर्वाधिक सरल माध्यम है ।इसमें वेद , उपनिषद , दर्शन, गणित, कला, आयुर्वेद, ज्योतिष, वास्तुशास्त्र, साहित्य ,चिकित्सा , रसायन , भौतिकी , विमानशास्त्र , संगीत, नृत्य, नाट्य आदि का संयोग है जिनका ज्ञान सभी के लिए आवश्यक है । भारतीय वास्तु‌शास्त्र सभी प्रकार के निर्माण कार्यों से सम्बन्धित है । जिस प्रकार निराकार ब्रह्म माया शक्ति के अभाव में प्रकार सगुण ईश्वर का रूप नहीं हो सकता उसी प्रकार मापन प्रक्रिया के बिना वास्तु भी व्यक्त रूप में परिवर्तित नहीं हो सकता । अतः निर्माण कार्य के लिए मापन की इकाईयाँ अत्यंत महत्वपूर्ण हैं।प्राचीन काल में निर्माण कार्यों में प्रयुक्त मापन इकाईयाँ आज के मापदंडों से भिन्न थीं, परंतु उनके पीछे की वैज्ञानिकता और सटीकता अद्वितीय है। प्राचीन ग्रंथों  जैसे कि मयमतम्, मानसार, और राजवल्लभ वास्तुशास्त्र, में विभिन्न इकाइयों का वर्णन मिलता है जिनका प्रयोग मंदिर, नगर, और भवन आदि विभिन्न प्रकार के निर्माण कार्यों  में किया जाता था।

column11: उत्तररामचरिताभिज्ञानशाकुन्तलयोः विप्रलम्भजन्यवृत्तेर्मनोवैज्ञानिकमध्ययनम्
column13:
विचित्ररूपाः चित्तवृत्तयः भवन्ति । मनुष्यः भावनात्मकः जीवः, यस्य कृत्स्नमपि जीवनं विभिन्नैः भावैः संजुष्टं भवति ।  युवसु युवतीषु च वियोगस्य भावोऽतिशयेन प्राप्यते, येन युवानः युवतयः सामाजिकरूपेण मानसिकरुपेण च  प्रभाविताः भवन्ति । विषयोऽयमतीवमहत्वपूर्णः संवेदनशीलश्च वर्तते । विरहभावे जनेषु वस्तुतः तापः, निश्वासः, चिन्ता, मौनम्, कृशाङ्गता, वत्सरतुल्यरात्रिदैर्घ्यम्, जागरणम्, शीतले उष्णताज्ञानमित्यादयः भावाः अवलोकयन्ते। कालिदासेनाभिज्ञानशाकुन्तले उदाहृतं यत् विप्रलम्भशृङ्गारं विना सम्भोगश्रृंगारस्यानन्दः नास्ति -
न विना विप्रलम्भेन सम्भोगः पुष्टमश्नुते ।
कषायिते हि वस्त्रादौ भूयान रागो विवर्धते । 
अतः अस्माकं पूर्वजाः विप्रलम्भजन्यसंतापभावसन्तोऽपि किङ्कर्त्तव्यविमूढतायां रामादिवद् वर्तितव्यं न रावणादिवत् इत्यस्यानुसरणमाचरितवन्तः। तस्मात् अस्माभिः अपि तथैव भाव्यम्। स एव शोधस्याभिप्रायो वर्त्तते।

column11: Vaidik vangmay me agni vigyan
column13: वैदिक वांग्मय में सर्वत्र अग्नि शब्द की महिमा व्याप्त है। वेदों के अध्ययन करते समय एक सहज जिज्ञासा उठती है कि परमात्मा की वाणी वेदों में अग्नि शब्द की व्यापकता किसी विशेष अर्थ एवं जीवन दर्शन की ओर संकेत कर रही है। हमारे बड़े भी जब किसी एक बात को बार बार कहते हैं तो उसकी ओर उनका एक विशेष अभिप्राय होता है जिसे वे हमारे अंतस में प्रगाढ़ता के साथ स्थापित करना चाहते हैं। इसी भाव चेतना एवं शोधात्मक दृष्टि का अवलंबन लेकर यह लेख प्रवृत्त हुआ है जिसमें हमने अग्नि के पर्यायवाची 108 शब्दों का सप्रमाण चिंतन, मनन एवं विश्लेषण का विनम्र प्रयास किया है। इसके साथ साथ अग्नि के भेदों के ऊपर भी सप्रमाण विश्लेषण करने का भी प्रयास किया है। इस प्रकार अग्नि शब्द पर विशेष विश्लेषणात्मक विवेचन प्रस्तुत है।

column11: नवीनन्यान-अरिस्टाटल् मतयोः न्यायस्वरुपस्य तुलनात्मकविमर्शः
column13:
नवीनन्यान-अरिस्टाटल् मतयोः न्यायस्वरुपस्य  तुलनात्मकविमर्शः
न्यायनये अनुमानादिस्वरूपाणां विषयः गौतममहर्षेः न्यायसूत्रे निरूपितः। पाश्चात्यतत्वशास्त्रेपि अनुमानादिस्वरूपाणां स्पष्टतया प्रतिपादनम् अरिस्टोटल् ग्रन्थेषु दृश्यते । किमनयोः विचारयोः कश्चन प्रभावः वर्तते वा , उत एकस्य अपरस्मिन् विचारे प्रभावः वर्तते वा ? इदं चिन्तनीयम् । एडवर्ड कोर्बेट् इति नाम्नः कस्यचन विदुषः मतानुसारेण अरिस्टोटल् रेटोरिक् (Republic) इति नाम्नः अनुमादिस्वरूपप्रतिपादकस्य ग्रन्थस्य निर्माणं सा.का.पू ३६७-३४७(367-347 B.c.e) काले अथेन्सनगरे प्रारब्धवान् , परन्तु इदानीं येन स्वरूपेण योयं ग्रन्थः उपलभ्यते तत्स्वरूपं सा.का.पू ३३५-३२२ (335-322 B.c.e ) काले प्राप्तः । अरिस्टोटल्‌बुधः वादकलां नियबद्धां तत्वसम्बद्धां कर्तुं प्रयत्नं कृतवान् यदिदं ततःप्राक् केनापि न कृतमासीत् ।

column11: साहं प्राणिमि विष्णुभक्तिरचला संतिष्ठते संसृतिः
column13: कृताः। वेदान्तसिद्धान्तावगमे केषाञ्चन क्लेशः स्यादिति मत्वा नैके आचार्याः भक्तेः वैशिष्ट्यं प्रतिपादयितुं नैकानि स्तोत्राणि, काव्यानि, स्तोत्रकाव्यानि च रचयामासुः। तत्क्रमे विशिष्टाद्वैतमतप्रचारकैः कवितार्किकसिंहैः श्रीमद्भिः वेदान्तदेशिक इति नाम्ना ख्यातैः वेङ्कटनाथाचार्यैः विरचितमिदं सङ्कल्पसूर्योदयाख्यं नाटकम्। नाटकेऽस्मिन् दश अङ्काः वर्तन्ते। जीवस्य परमोद्देश्यं मोक्षप्राप्तिरेव इत्येनं महान्तं सिद्धान्तं नाटकरूपेण प्रतिपादयितुं तत्संबद्धाः नैकाः वेदान्तविचाराः यथासरलं बोधयितुं शक्याः तथा प्रत्येकमङ्कं प्रधानमेकं विषयं प्रतिपादयन्नाटकस्य रचनामकरोदाचार्यः। अत एव खलु श्रीमद्भिः कृष्णमाचार्यैरपि - श्रीपतेः सत्यसङ्कल्पसूर्योदयनिराकृते। मायान्धतमसे पुंसां ब्रह्मानन्दथुरेधते॥ इति राद्धान्तमत्यन्तहृद्यं वेदान्तसंसदः। ग्रन्थेऽस्मिन् स्पष्टमाचष्ट कविर्वेदान्तदेशिकः॥ इति प्रोक्तम्। तदस्मिन्नाटके विष्णुभक्तेः वैराग्यस्य न केवलं वैशिष्ट्यमपि तु तयोः मोक्षसाधनत्वं प्रतिपादितम्। अतश्च तद्विषयप्रतिपादनमुखेन विशिष्टाद्वैतसिद्धान्ते भक्तिः प्रपत्तिश्च कीदृशं मुख्यं स्थानं वहतः, ते च कथं मोक्षमार्गं प्रदर्शयतः, अन्यसाधनापेक्षयैतयोः वैशिष्ट्यं सारल्यं च क्व वर्तते इत्याद्यंशाः प्रतिपाद्यन्ते॥

column11: आधुनिक योगी, हरकरे इनका कुंडलिनी जागृतीका दिव्य अनुभव
column13:
सारांश -
योगी मनोहर हरकरे ने संपूर्ण सृष्टि को वैदिक बनाने का काम किया। वह इस लक्ष्य को 'वैदिक ब्रह्माण्ड' कहते हैं। इसके लिए उन्होंने लोगों को योग के बारे में सिखाया. उन्होंने क्रिया करके दिखाया कि आसन, प्राणायाम, ध्यान, योगनिद्रा, षट्चक्रभेदन, कुण्डलिनी जागरण से शरीर को किस प्रकार लाभ होता है तथा योगासन, शारीरिक एवं मानसिक रोगों के लिए किस प्रकार लाभकारी हैं। कुंडलिनी जागरण आध्यात्मिक प्राप्ति के लिए एक आवश्यक चरण है। इसके अलावा साधक को आत्मबोध व आत्मबोध नहीं हो पाता। कुंडलिनी जागरण अंतिम चरण नहीं बल्कि मध्य चरण है। इसके बाद एक स्टेज से दूसरे स्टेज तक जाने के लिए एक-एक सीढ़ियां चढ़नी पड़ती हैं। कुछ साधक इसे अंतिम चरण मानते हैं। लेकिन ऐसा नहीं है कि कुंडलिनी जागृत होने पर सब कुछ हासिल हो जाता है, बल्कि कुंडलिनी का बोध आध्यात्मिक क्षेत्र के प्रवेश द्वार का खुलना मात्र है। योगी मनोहर कहते हैं, कुंडलिनी प्रत्यक्ष अनुभव का विषय है। कुंडलिनी की अवधारणा को समझने के लिए वैज्ञानिक ज्ञान और तीव्र बुद्धि की आवश्यकता होती है जिसे केवल कल्पना से नहीं समझा जा सकता है। कुण्डलिनी जागरण के बाद साधक डर जाता है, उसके शरीर में पिडा आ जाती है। लेकिन बाद में अच्छा लगता है. साधक सर्वगुण सम्पन्न होता है।

column4: Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady
column11: Linguistic features of Saṭṭakas: With special reference to Karpūramañjarī and Candralekhā
column13:
Rūpaka and Uparūpaka refer to two categories of dramatic compositions in Sanskrit. Rūpakā
is generally used to describe the major types of Sanskrit dramas that adhere to specific
structural conventions, whereas Uparūpakā refers to minor forms of drama, which are more
specialised in music and dance. Saṭṭaka is a Uparūpakā, which was written completely in the
Prākṛt language. Saṭṭaka exhibits distinctive linguistic features that reflect its unique structure
and cultural context. The earliest and most significant work in this genre is
the Karpūramañjarī, which was composed in the 10th century CE. Rudradāsa, a scholar from
Kerala, wrote Candralekhā in the 17th century CE. Despite belonging to the same genre, they
exhibit notable differences in language, style, and cultural context, on account of the periods
and regions in which they were composed. This paper is an attempt to analyse the linguistic
features of Karpūramañjarī and Candralekhā and compare Prākṛt dialects used by the authors.

column11: Impact of Bhagavad Gita chanting on emotional intelligence of secondary school students : A Review
column13: This study examines the relationship between the Bhagavad Gita’s teachings and emotional intelligence, with a particular focus on the significant benefits of the Bhagavad Gita chanting and its relevance to modern psychology. It explores how applying the Bhagavad Gita’s teaching to daily life boosts emotional intelligence, resilience, self-awareness, empathy, and managing stress by examining various types of research and books of literature. The Bhagavad Gita’s teachings and emotional intelligence are examined in this study, with a focus on how modern culture’s stress management, self-awareness, endurance, and empathy may be enhanced by Gita chanting and other related practices. The research emphasizes the relationship between emotional stability and the teachings of the Gita. It also examines the effects of yoga, meditation, and chanting on well-being, particularly for teenagers, and how these activities support both emotional intelligence and academic achievement.

column4: The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda
column11: Vātavyādhinidāna (Diagnosis of diseases caused by wind) based on Nepalese version of Suśrutasaṃhitā
column13: One of the three major texts of classical Indian medicine, Suśrutasaṃhitā was composed in Sanskrit approximately two millennia ago. The present study of the first chapter of Nidānasthāna, vātavyādhinidāna is based on the Nepalese version of Suśrutasaṃhitā. Centuries-old three palm-leaf manuscripts of suśrutasaṃhitā have been photographed at the National Archives of Kathmandu, Nepal, as part of the Nepal-German Manuscript Preservation Project (NGMPP). The oldest of them is KL 699, which is preserved at the Kaisar Library in Kathmandu and dated as 878 CE. It does not include chapter 2.1 vātavyādhinidāna. The second manuscript, NAK 1/1079 is equally unfinished and unidentified date; however, chapter 2.1 is available. The third manuscript, NAK 5/333, is nearly a complete text. Though all these three manuscripts are not directly derived from one another but the readings are more similar to one another. The provisional edition of Chapter 2.1 and its English translation are prepared based on the readings of the second and third manuscript. The study aims to illustrate the differences betwee

column11: आधुनिकसंस्कृताचार्यनित्यानन्दस्मृतितीर्थानां कृतिषु एकमध्ययनम्
column13:

column4: Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady
column11: Translation techniques of N.V.P Uṇittiri : Special reference to Khaṇḍakāvyas
column13:
N.V.P. Uṇittiri is one of the multilingual scholars who working hard to bring the important contributions of the Malayalam language to the modern Sanskrit readers.  
He translated the works of prominent Malayalam poets like Vaḷḷattōl, Kumāran Āśān, Eḍaśśēri, P. Kuñjirāman Nāir etc. and nurtured the tradition of Sanskrit translation. The present study is focusing on translation techniques of  Unithiri’s three major translations of prominent writers of Malayalam Khaṇḍakāvyas viz. 
Vaḷḷattōḷ’s ‘Śiṣyaḥ Sutaśca’, Kumāranāśān’s ‘Caṇḍālabhikṣukī’ and Prabhā Varma’s ‘Śyāmamādhavam’. The authors belong to different generations and played distinct roles in the literary history of Kerala. Śiṣyaḥ Sutaśca is based on the scene where Lord Gaṇeśa stops Paraśurāma when he comes to meet Lord Śiva. Śyāmamādhavam is Kṛṣṇa’s inner pains, delusions and sense of sin, which the poet carefully expresses through this work. Caṇḍālabhikṣukī is a unique response to the social condition of Kerala in the early decades of the 20th century.

column11: संस्कृत बाल उपन्यास मानवी में मूल्य बोध
column13: साहित्य अकादमी द्वारा वर्ष 2023 के बाल साहित्य पुरस्कार से राधावल्लभ त्रिपाठी प्रणीत संस्कृत में बाल उपन्यास ‘मानवी’ को पुरस्कृत किया गया है। मानवी में पारम्परिक मूल्यबोध के साथ समकालीन मूल्यबोध विद्यमान है। पुस्तक के फ्लैप पर लिखी पंक्तियाँ बरबस ध्यान खींचती हैं- ‘यह (मानवी उपन्यास) बालक रघु और एक हंसिनी मानवी के बीच निश्छल अनुराग की मनोरम कथा है। कल्पना का संसार इसमें हमारे समय की सच्चाइयों के परदे खोलता चलता है। मानवी में प्रकृति और मनुष्य के बीच की दूरियाँ मिटती जाती हैं और दोनों एक हो जाते हैं। यह कथा आत्मा से परमात्मा के मिलन की महागाथा भी बन जाती है।’ ‘मानवी’ उपन्यास में सत्य (पृ. 33), मातृप्रेम (पृ. 98), मातृभूमि प्रेम (पृ. 22), कृतज्ञता (पृ. 107) जैसे पारम्परिक मूल्यबोध के साथ ही पर्यावरण प्रदूषण के भयानक रूप का वर्णन कर पर्यावरण संरक्षण के सन्देश (पृ. 107) को समकालीन मूल्यबोध के रूप में देखा जा सकता है। ‘मानवी’ में मूल्यबोध का निरूपण इस शोधपत्र में अभीष्ट है। इतिदिक्।

column11: आदर्श कविता का सच्चा दर्पण "शतपत्रम्"
column13: Vivek kumar

column11: Comparative study on Jainism and Buddhism's conception on Rebirth and Liberation in Indian Philosophy
column13: This research paper presents a comparative analysis of the concepts of rebirth and liberation as articulated in Jainism and Buddhism, two prominent Indian philosophical traditions. Both religions share foundational beliefs in the cycle of samsara (rebirth) and the pursuit of liberation (moksha in Jainism and nirvana in Buddhism), yet they diverge significantly in their interpretations and methodologies. In Jainism, liberation is achieved through the rigorous practice of non-violence (ahimsa), truth (satya), and asceticism, leading to the purification of the soul. Jains believe that the soul is inherently divine and can attain infinite knowledge and bliss upon liberation. The path to moksha involves strict adherence to ethical principles and the abandonment of karmic attachments, which perpetuate the cycle of rebirth. This study further explores the ethical implications and practical applications of these beliefs in contemporary society, highlighting the relevance of both traditions in addressing modern existential concerns.

column11: Dukkha (Suffering) and Ecological Crisis: A Buddhist Perspective on Global Environmental Degradation
column13:
The ecological collapse, marked by escalating climate change, biodiversity loss, and environmental degradation, has emerged as a grave concern today. The catastrophic landslides and floods in Himachal Pradesh in 2023 are part of a global pattern of environmental instability.  The destruction wrought there, is a manifestation of collective suffering, due to intersection of human actions and environmental degradation.
The paper establishes a relationship between Buddhist concept of Dukkha and the current ecological crisis. There are two complementary objectives which facilitate this analysis; i) identifying the root causes of environmental destruction through the lens of Buddhist philosophy, ii) evaluating the ethical solutions offered by Buddhist teachings and proposing a sustainable and compassionate framework for mitigating ecological crises.

column5: PROF. HARERAM TRIPATHI (मा. कुलगुरु, क. का. सं. वि., रामटेक, महाराष्ट्र)
column11: प्राचीन रोग निवारक पद्धति नाभि चिकित्सा
column13: नाभि चिकित्सा एक प्राचीन भारतीय चिकित्सा पद्धति है जो शरीर के मध्य भाग, विशेष रूप से नाभि क्षेत्र के स्वास्थ्य पर केन्द्रित है। यह पेट के गड्ढे को सन्दर्भित करता है, जो सहानुभूति और पैरासिम्पेथेटिक तन्त्रिका तन्तुओं का मिलन स्थल है। यह तन्त्रिका कोशिकाओं और सहायक ऊतकों का एक घना समूह है, जिसे सीलिएक प्लेक्सस के रूप में भी जाना जाता है। यह कई महत्त्वपूर्ण कार्यों जैसे एड्रेनल स्राव और आंतों के संकुचन को नियन्त्रित करता है। यह पूरे शरीर में ऊर्जा प्रसारित करता है और मानव जीवन के विकास, परिसंचरण और नियन्त्रण में महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाता है। इसे हमारे शरीर का दूसरा मस्तिष्क भी कहा जाता है। नाभि और मस्तिष्क के बीच गहरा सम्बन्ध है, और मानव मस्तिष्क के अंदर उठने वाला कोई भी डर सीधे नाभि को प्रभावित करता है। एक स्वस्थ नाभि केन्द्र शारीरिक ऊर्जा को बढ़ाता है, शरीर की आभा को उज्ज्वल करता है, शारीरिक आकर्षण और सौन्दर्य को बढ़ाता है। यह व्यक्ति को सक्रिय और ऊर्जावान रखता है, तनाव मुक्त करता है, नसों और मांसपेशियों को सक्रिय बनाता है, याददाश्त बढ़ाता है और स्वस्थ वीर्य का उत्पादन करता है। नाभि हमारे पाचन तंत्र से गहराई से जुड़ी हुई है, इसलिए नाभि में किसी भी तरह का असन्तुलन पाचन सम्बन्धी समस्या

column11: प्राचीन रोग ननवारक पद्धनि नानि नचनकत्सा
column13:
शोधसार-  
               नाभि चिकित्सा एक प्राचीन भारतीय चिकित्सा पद्धति है जो शरीर के मध्य भाग, विशेष रूप से नाभि क्षेत्र के स्वास्थ्य पर केन्द्रित है। यह पेट के गड्ढे को सन्दर्भित करता है, जो सहानुभूति और पैरासिम्पेथेटिक तन्त्रिका तन्तुओं का मिलन स्थल है। यह तन्त्रिका कोशिकाओं और सहायक ऊतकों का एक घना समूह है, जिसे सीलिएक प्लेक्सस के रूप में भी जाना जाता है। यह कई महत्त्वपूर्ण कार्यों जैसे एड्रेनल स्राव और आंतों के संकुचन को नियन्त्रित करता है। यह पूरे शरीर में ऊर्जा प्रसारित करता है और मानव जीवन के विकास, परिसंचरण और नियन्त्रण में महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाता है। इसे हमारे शरीर का दूसरा मस्तिष्क भी कहा जाता है। नाभि और मस्तिष्क के बीच गहरा सम्बन्ध है, और मानव मस्तिष्क के अंदर उठने वाला कोई भी डर सीधे नाभि को प्रभावित करता है। एक स्वस्थ नाभि केन्द्र शारीरिक ऊर्जा को बढ़ाता है, शरीर की आभा को उज्ज्वल करता है, शारीरिक आकर्षण और सौन्दर्य को बढ़ाता है। यह व्यक्ति को सक्रिय और ऊर्जावान रखता है, तनाव मुक्त करता है, नसों और मांसपेशियों को सक्रिय बनाता है, याददाश्त बढ़ाता है और स्वस्थ वीर्य का उत्पादन करता है

column4: The Institute of Vaishnava Studies, Gainesville Florida, USA
column11: Cosmology of the Purāṇas and the Sūrya Siddhānta: A map of Jambudvīpa
column13: The Siddhāntins’ primary text is the Sūrya Siddhānta, a document of less than 500 verses. Among other things, the text deals with the Earth’s shape and size and the eclipses. The Purāṇas, on the other hand, are vast and include cosmologies, including those of the Sun and the Moon. The 8th-century astronomer Lalla first pointed out some disagreements relating to astronomy between the Paurāṇikas and the Siddhāntins. His arguments were supported by Bhāskara (12th century) and later astronomers. More recently, David Pingree called out this dispute and in 2004, Christopher Minkowski summarized it in five parts relating to the Earth, eclipses and the Moon and dubbed it the virodha problem. The paper uses a critical study of over a dozen Purāṇas to establish that they are consistent with the Sūrya Siddhānta in two of the five aspects. The paper demonstrates that the Purāṇic Earth was of the correct shape and size and consistent with the Sūrya Siddhānta while also describing the continents of Africa, the Americas and Antarctica.

column11: ब्रह्मसाक्षात्कारसाधनस्य आवृत्त्यनावृत्तिविचारः
column13: दर्शनसामान्यस्य महातात्पर्यमस्ति परमपुरुषार्थभूतमोक्षस्य साधनप्रतिपादने तत्र च मोक्षसाधानानि यानि अन्तरङ्गबहिरङ्गसाधारणानि तेषां तावत् आवृत्तिः अपेक्ष्यते न वा इति अस्य पत्रस्य शोधविषयः । तत्र वेदान्ते शाङ्करभाष्यमधिकृत्य प्रतिपादनं क्रियते । साधनानाम् एकवारम् अनुष्ठानेन फलं सिद्ध्यति इति आशयस्य निराकरणपूर्वकं यत्र फलं दृष्टार्थं तत्र यावत् फलोत्पत्ति साधनानुष्ठानम् इति स्थापनम् अस्मिन् शोधपत्रे मया चिकीर्षितमस्ति ।

column11: Living Jaina Traditions In Wayanad
column13:
Jainism is an independent ideology that preaches the most compassionate and humanitarian treatment towards all souls. The ideology has a significant
connection to Kerala’s medieval history. The exclusive geographical features and easy accessibility of Wayanad from Kannada states greatly influenced the
growth of Jainism in northern Kerala from the ancient period onwards. The Vatteluttu inscriptions from Thirunneli Temple, short inscriptions from Edakkal Caves, Muthanga, etc. show the political evidence of the authority of Cheras over the region. The passes connecting Wayanad and Karnataka nurtured the economic traditional backgrounds of the land. The native, literary, inscriptional, and archaeological evidence of the antiquity of Jainism over the region of Wayanad is explored in this paper. The thrive of Jainism in generating new standards of living for the ordinary people of Wayanad and its spread and annihilation over the invasion of mainstream Hinduism were analysed with the objective of unveiling exclusive movements of Jainism in Wayanad.

column11: हर्षचरितगतः स्त्रीपक्षविचारः।
column13: उपलब्धेषु संस्कृतसाहित्यकृतिषु ऐतिहासिककाव्यानां रचना सर्वप्रथमं बाणभट्टाचार्येण एव कृता। महाकवेः बाणभट्टस्य प्रथमं काव्यं वर्तते हर्षचरितम्। तावत्पर्यन्तं संसारे विद्यमानानां मानवानां साक्षाद्वृत्तान्तं काव्यानाम् इतिवृत्तरूपेण न उपयुज्यते स्म। बाणभट्टस्य हर्षचरिते अष्टौ उच्छ्वासाः वर्तन्ते। काव्यमिदम् ऐतिहासिकं भवति यतो हि अत्र चक्रवर्तिनः हर्षवर्धनस्य जीवनचरितं वर्णितं वर्तते। अस्मिन् सत्यर्थकथनं वर्तत इति हेतुना इदं काव्यं गद्यकाव्यस्य कथा आख्यायिका चेति भेदयोः आख्यायिकायाम् अन्तर्भवति। काव्यस्यास्य प्रथमद्वितीयोच्छ्वासयोः तथा तृतीयोच्छ्वासस्य प्रथमचतुर्थांशस्य च अध्ययनेन बाणभट्टस्य जीवनवृत्तान्तम् अस्माभिः ज्ञातुं शक्यते। तदनन्तरम् अस्मिन् काव्ये चक्रवर्तिनः हर्षवर्धनस्य चरितं वर्णितं वर्तते। गद्यशैल्यां रचितमिदं काव्यम् ऐतिहासिककाव्यस्य गद्यकाव्यस्य च उत्तमोदाहरणं भवति। अत एव अस्य काव्यस्य परिशीलनेन काव्यस्यास्य रचनाकाले अर्थात् सप्तमशताब्द्यां भारतस्य सामूहिकस्थितिः का आसीदिति ज्ञायते। बहुषु इतिहाससम्बद्धांशेषु एकः सुप्रधानः अंशः वर्तते स्त्रीपक्षविचारः। भारतीयसमूहे तदानीन्तनस्त्रीणां महत्त्वं, पुरुषाणां स्त्रीसम्बद्धविचाराञ्च अवगत्य तेषां प्रतिपादनमेव मया अत्र क्रियते।

column4: SREE SANKARACHARYA UNIVERSITY OF SANSKRIT KALADY
column11: पाण्डुलिपिग्रन्थानां संरक्षणोपायाः प्राधान्यं च |
column13: हस्तलिखितविज्ञानं अथवा पाण्डुलिपिविज्ञानं पाण्डुलिपिनां अध्ययनं भवति, ये पुरातनलिखितलेखाः  सन्ति। क्षेत्रेस्मिन् एते लेखाः कथं निर्मिताः, तेषां इतिहासः, तेषां संरक्षणं च कथं करणीयम् इति चिन्तयन्ति। अस्मिन् प्राचीनलेखनस्य पठनं, पाण्डुलिपिनां भौतिकपक्षस्य परीक्षणं, अभिलेखाकारस्य प्रबन्धनम् इत्यादीनां विभिन्नक्षेत्राणां संयोजनं भवति। पाण्डुलिपिशास्त्रज्ञाः ग्रन्थानां सांस्कृतिक-ऐतिहासिकपृष्ठभूमिं ज्ञातुं तेषां विश्लेषणं कुर्वन्ति। अयं अध्ययनः अस्माकं साहित्य-इतिहासस्य संरक्षणाय महत्त्वपूर्णः अस्ति तथा च इतिहासकारेभ्यः विद्वांसेभ्यश्च अनेकेषु क्षेत्रेषु सहायतां करोति। अस्माकं सांस्कृतिकविरासतां ऐतिहासिकज्ञानस्य च रक्षणार्थं पाण्डुलिपिनां संरक्षणं महत्त्वपूर्णम् अस्ति। एते पुरातनलिखितलेखाः अस्माभिः पुरातन संस्कृतीनां, तेषां विश्वासानां, भाषाणां च विषयेषु सूचनां ददति । इतिहासे, साहित्ये, मानवशास्त्रे च संशोधनार्थं ते प्रमुखाः संसाधनाः सन्ति। पाण्डुलिपिग्रन्थानां संरक्षणेन  वयं सुनिश्चितं कुर्मः यत् आगामि कालेभ्यः मानवेभ्यः एतेषां ग्रन्थानाम् अध्ययनं शिक्षिणं च शक्नुवन्ति, येन अस्माकं मानवीयम् अनुभव: अवगन्तुं साहाय्यं भवति इति।

column11: कालिदासरूपकेषु सामुद्रिकशास्त्रसन्दर्भाः
column13: वेदस्य षट्सु अङ्गेषु ज्योतिषं चक्षुरूपेण अन्यतमम् अङ्गमस्ति । त्रिस्कन्धात्मकस्य ज्योतिषशास्त्रस्य महत्त्वपूर्णम् अङ्गं वर्तते संहितास्कन्धः । संहितास्कन्धे चेतनाचेतनानां पदार्थानां वर्णनं प्राप्यते । आन्तरिक्षीयघटनानाम् अथवा मानवजीवनस्य शुभाशुभफलानि चर्चितानि सन्ति । अस्मिन् स्कन्धे फलकथनपरम्परायां नैके प्रकाराः वर्तन्ते । तेषु एकः प्रकारः विद्यते सामुद्रिकशास्त्रम्  इति । प्राचीनकाले मानवानाम् अङ्गलक्षणानुसारेण फलकथनस्य प्रचलनम् आसीत् । पूर्वकाले एषा अङ्गविद्या इति नाम्ना प्रसिद्धा किन्तु तदनन्तरम् एषा विद्या सामुद्रिकशास्त्रमिति नाम्ना प्रसिद्धा अभवत् । मनुष्यस्य गुणाः दोषाश्च तस्य शरीराकारानुवर्तिनः सन्ति । सामुद्रिकशास्त्रे नृस्त्रीणां नखशिखान्ताङ्गप्रत्यङ्गस्य वर्णनं दीयते । तेषामाधारेण मनुष्यस्य चरित्रं, स्वभावः, व्यक्तित्वञ्च ज्ञायते । सामुद्रिकशास्त्रस्य परम्परा पुराणात् आरभ्यते । तानि लक्षणानि पृथक्तया सङ्कलय्य सामुद्रिकशास्त्रं रचितम् । समुद्रस्येदं सामुद्रिकमिति कथ्यते । मनुष्यस्य भूत-वर्तमान-भविष्यफलानि तस्य स्वभावादि ज्ञानम् अस्य शास्त्रस्य मुख्योदेश्यः।

column11: राधायनं महाकाव्यस्य समीक्षणात्मकमध्ययनम्
column13: सहृद‌यान् आनन्दयितुं साधनं वाङ्‌मयमस्ति । तत्रापि संस्कृतसाहित्यस्य अवदानं वैशिष्ट्यपूर्णं महत्त्वपूर्णञ्च । ‘संस्कृतं संस्कृतेर्मूलम्’ इति वचनानुसारं संस्कृतभाषायाः महत्वं सर्वे जानन्ति एव ।  भारतीये संस्कृतसाहित्ये न केवलं मनोरञ्जनम् अपि तु नीतिः, व्यापारः, अध्यात्मः, सामाजिकघटकः, संस्कृतिः इत्यादीनां विषयाणामुपरि बहवः ग्रन्थाः उपलभ्यन्ते । भारतीयसंस्कृतिः संस्कृतसाहित्यं विना अपूर्णा एव । यत्किमपि ज्ञानम् अद्य प्राप्यते तत्सर्वं वेदेभ्यः सङ्‌गृहीतमस्ति । संस्कृतसाहित्यस्य आरम्भः वैदिककालतः भवति यत् भारतीय-सभ्यतायाः युगमस्ति । वैदिक - साहित्यानन्तरं लौकिकसाहित्यं निर्मितं तथा च रामायणमहाभारतादि काव्यानाम् उपजीव्यत्वं स्वीकृत्य कविभिः साहित्यं रचितम् । प्राचीनकालतः एव अलङ्‌कार-रसादि साहित्यिकतत्त्वानां परिपोषः काव्यनाटकरूपेण रसिकजनान् आनन्दयन्ति । एषा साहित्यपरम्परा अविच्छिन्नरूपेण प्रवहति । आधुनिककालेऽपि ग्रन्थकारः स्वप्रतिभां प्रदर्श्य उत्तमवाङ्‌मयस्य निर्माणं करोति । समग्रसंस्कृतसाहित्यं सर्वव्यापी अस्ति तथा च लक्षण-लक्ष्यग्रन्थैः संस्कृतसाहित्यं समृद्धम् । संस्कृतसाहित्यस्य परम्परा अखण्डितास्ति अतः अर्वाचीनग्रन्थकाराःअपि वाङ्ग्मयं रचयन्ति ।

column11: Sri Vyasaraja: A Historical Reappraisal – Dispelling Myths and Misconceptions
column13: In India, we occasionally hear objections that Madhwa saints have contributed little to the revival of Sanatana Dharma. We read about how Vidyaranya worked towards the establishment of the Vijayanagara Empire by Hakka and Bukka, striving for the rejuvenation of Sanatana Dharma. However, a deeper historical study of Vyasaraja’s life reveals that his contributions in this regard are equally unparalleled. Some modern scholars, driven by biases, argue without evidence that Vyasaraja replaced the Kuladevata (family deity) of the Vijayanagara dynasty from Virupaksha (Shiva) to Srinivasa (Vishnu), and that this led to the downfall of the Vijayanagara Empire due to conflicts between Shaivites and Vaishnavites. They claim that the imposition of Vaishnavism caused the kingdom's collapse after Krishnadevaraya's reign. i will review these aspects with historical and hagiographical accounts

column11: 1527 - Chandonuśāsana of Vāgbhaṭa : An Unpublished Jain Text on Prosody
column13:
For hundreds of years, Jain authors have been contributing to the Sanskrit literature of various types. From Shastric works to classical literature, Jain authors have not kept a single stone unturned. Chandas-śāstra, the science of prosody is one of the fields that has a huge contribution from Jain authors. The texts like Chandonuśāsana of Hemacandra Sūri and Kavidarpaṇa of an unknown Jain author have proved themselves as milestones of prosody. Having said that, it must be mentioned that many more original works as well as commentaries on other famous Jain and non-Jain works are still lying in a manuscript form and waiting for their turn to be published.
	One of such texts is Chandonuśāsana of Vāgbhaṭa with his own commentary (svopajña tika) named as vivaraṇa. Two manuscripts of this text are available out of which one is known for more than last half a century. Even then, there has been no effort for publishing it. The present paper aims at introducing this very text to the scholarly world. The main points covered in this paper are -  a thorough examination of the text, information

column11: Significance of Natyadharmi in Kutiyattam
column13: Kutiyattam is the most ancient sanskrit theatre surviving in India. The pan-Indian tradition of Sanskrit play production gives clear evidence for its wide antiquity. This will be a curious fact to review and understand how Kutiyattam existed in India over two decades whether on equivalent occasions other old aged artforms were vanishes or weltered. On pricise observation and winnowed studies it is clear that the psyche of Kutiyattam adhere to its techniques, language and gestural expressionism.

column11: Metadiscourse in Sanskrit Literature: An Analytical Study of Mundakopanishat
column13: Sanskrit tradition of texts evolved out of the need to better understand Vedas. As a result, linguistic analysis became a central point of discussion across different fields of study related to Sanskrit or Vedas, such as phonetics, nirukta, grammar, philosophy, etc. At the core of these linguistic analysis is to understand the true meaning of the texts/utterances. Without the right language, the right ideas would have not been conveyed. In other words, there must have been linguistic elements that were used to ensure that the right ideas were conveyed. This paper uses Meta-discourse theory as a basis for finding out such elements and uses Mundakopanishat as a text of focus.

column4: Department of Archaeology, University of Mumbai
column11: 392 The Position and Worship of Brahmā in the Sacred Landscape of the Mathurā Region
column13:
The association of the deity Brahmā with the Mathurā Region dates to the post-Gupta Period and becomes evident from texts like the Bhāgavata Purāṇa and the much posterior Garga Saṃhitā. Sculptures of Brahmā in Mathurā also start appearing from around the same time period. Moreover, texts like the Mathurā Mahātmya, affiliated to the Varāha Purāṇa refer to a person attaining the loka of Brahmā if he or she bathes/gives up life at certain tīrthas in Mathurā. Oral traditions prevalent in the Mathurā Region also relate a few places like Brahma Kuṇḍa in Vṛndāvana to Brahmā. It should be noted that the literary sources as well as the oral traditions assign a secondary position to Brahmā in relation to Kṛṣṇa individually and later to Kṛṣṇa and Rādhā jointly.
The present paper attempts to investigate the position and worship of Brahmā in the sacred landscape of Mathurā through the mediums of archaeological and literary sources combined with consultation to oral traditions.

column11: Progression of yoga education in India: An outline in the light of National Education Policy- 2020
column13:
National Education policy -2020, a radical reform in Indian Education System recognizes the critical importance of promoting yoga education in India. The global yoga market size was estimated at USD 107.1 billion in 2023 and is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) OF 9.4% from 2024 to 2030.
Yoga provides a unique opportunity for INNER ENGINEERING. Yoga has gained momentum in recent times growing and emphasis on health and wellness have driven individuals to seek holistic approaches to wellbeing.
The research paper will entail a comprehensive analysis of how yoga has been spreading throughout the world in last one decade. Furthermore, we will explore how NEP 2020 fosters the spread of yoga science education. Additionally, we will discuss the goal of “internationalization at home”.
We will explore the proposed strategies, such as making yoga accessible to masses by creation of professions in yoga through the higher education institutions. This research paper seeks to ensure the continued relevance of this ancient science in the modern education of India.

column11: Children’s Literature in Sanskrit: A Timeless Treasure
column13:
Children’s Literature in Sanskrit: A Timeless Treasure

Children’s literature in Sanskrit is a rich and enduring tradition that offers timeless wisdom, moral guidance, and cultural heritage. This body of work, deeply rooted in ancient Indian philosophy and thought, is a treasure trove of stories that have influenced generations of young minds. Early texts such as the *Pañcatantra* and *Hitopadesha* are key examples of this legacy, offering simple yet profound tales that convey ethical lessons through the use of allegory, fables, and engaging characters—often animals that represent human virtues and vices. These stories not only entertain but also educate, providing foundational moral teachings that remain relevant today.

The epics *Mahabharata* and *Ramayana* further enhance this tradition by introducing children to heroic figures, complex moral dilemmas, and life’s fundamental values, such as courage, loyalty, and justice. Their narratives, full of adventure and ethical challenges, serve as moral guides while stimulating the imagination of young readers.

column11: AYURYOG- INTEGRATION OF AYURVEDA & YOGA FOR DISEASE PREVENTION & CURE
column13: Both Yoga and Ayurveda are age old sciences developed with a common aim of holistic well-being. In the present era, both these sciences have gained global recognition for promotion of physical & mental health. Integrating the two sciences is observed to be yielding best results in preventive & curative aspects. In a group of 20 participants were selected and daily one hour practice of Yoga protocol including Sukshma Vyayamam, Yogasana and Pranayamam was done for 14 days.  Participants showed improvement in Digestion, Quality of Sleep and Physical health. Further, Ayurveda treatment when combined with sookshma vyayamam and yogasanas in Musculoskeletal, GIT and neuro-endocrine disorders; Pranayamam & Meditation in respiratory, neuro-endocrine and psychological ailments have been observed enhance the speed and sustainability of the results. Present paper deals with the benefits of Yoga as Vyayamam in daily life as a measure of preventive health promotion and case studies highlighting the efficacy of Integrated Yoga-Ayurveda approach in curative practices.

column11: अलङ्कारशास्त्रदृष्ट्या नानार्थकशब्दप्रयोगस्थले अर्थप्रतीतिः तत्प्रतिपादकवृत्तिश्च
column13:
नानार्थकशब्दप्रयोगस्थले अर्थप्रतीतिः तत्प्रतिपादकवृत्तिश्च
एकार्थकानां प्रयोगे नियमेन तस्यैवार्थस्य प्रतीतिः अर्थान्तराभावात् । नानार्थकेषु शब्देषु प्रयुक्तेषु बहुष्वर्थेषु सङ्केतात् श्रोतुर्मनसि सन्देहो जायते कस्तावदत्र विवक्षितोऽर्थ इति । कदाचित् सन्देहः न स्यात् । सन्देहे सति कथं विवक्षितार्थनिर्णयः? अविवक्षितस्याप्यर्थस्य प्रतीतौ कया वृत्त्या प्रतीतिः ? किमत्र प्रयोजनमित्यादयः प्रश्नाः जाग्रति । विषयेऽस्मिन् आलङ्कारिकारिकेषु अस्ति मतभेदः । किञ्च सङ्केतितार्थस्तावत् रूढः यौगिकः योगरूढः यौगिकरूढश्चेति चतुर्विधः । तत्र तृतीयतुरीयार्थकशब्दप्रयोगे कदाचित् अर्थान्तरप्रतीतिर्जायते । तत्र कः क्रमः इत्यपरः प्रश्नः । तत्प्रतीतिः अभिधया उत व्यञ्ज्जनया इत्यन्यः प्रश्नः । विषयेऽप्यस्ति मतभेदः । एवमन्येऽपि सन्त्यत्र वक्तव्याः विषयाः । विषयेऽमिन् आनन्दवर्धनमम्मटभट्टाप्पयदीक्षितजगन्नाथादीनां मतमुल्लिख्य किञ्चिदिव मीमांसा क्रियतेऽत्र इति निवेदयामि ।

column11: Concept of citrakala in silparatna
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
The Sanskrit word ‘Citra’ is generally rendered as painting, but it means just 'image'.one can see the vide classification of images as Citra, Ardhacitra and Citra̅bha̅sa, the three-fold classification, on the basis of the sculpture, as fully sculptured, half represented, and non-manifest ones. 
Citrakala̅ in India has a rich and enduring tradition. The centuries-old tradition of painting seems to be growing in tandem with the experimental observations of different nations across various time spans.  Citrakala̅ is the part of Stha̅ptaya, the Upaveda of Atharvaveda. Even though the discussion of comprehensive and detailed description of Citrakala̅ can be found in Viṣṇudharmottarapura̅ṇa. It has also been discussed in detail in Śilparatna, a book written by Śri̅kuma̅ra, hailing from Kerala. This paper is an analysis of Citrakala in Śilparatna. This paper discusses topics like the definition of citrakala̅, its objectives, background setting and chromatic aberrations.

column11: Recognising Recognition: A Philosophical Interpretation of Pratyabhijñā
column13: Is it really worth talking about Pratyabhijñā or Recognition? Yes, it is! ‘He is the same teacher who taught us yesterday’. Here, it is difficult to categorise this statement as either a case of perception or memory. So, what is it? Most of the prominent Indian philosophical schools, viz. Nyāya, Mīmāṃsā, etc., employed recognition as a weapon against the ‘self-negating’ schools, i.e., the Buddhists, to establish the permanence of the self. However, they did not give much importance to recognition in their epistemological discussion. It is because, according to them, recognition is nothing but a kind of perception. Contrarily, there are some Indian philosophical schools based on the āgama śāstra, viz. Jaina and Kashmir Śaivism, which, either directly or indirectly, portrayed the importance of recognition in their discussion.

column11: जैन आगम सूर्यप्रज्ञप्ति सूत्र में सूर्य संबंधी वर्णन और आधुनिक खगोलशास्त्र एक तुलनात्मक अध्ययन
column13: प्राचीन काल से ही ज्योतिष चक्र ने सम्पूर्ण विश्व के वैज्ञानिक एवं विचारकों को अपने अध्ययन का माध्यम बनाया है | सूर्य मंडल और चन्द्र मंडल को लेकर विभिन्न दृष्टिकोण आज तक सामने आये है | जैन दर्शन में ज्योतिष चक्र विशेष आगम उपलब्ध होते है, जो ग्रह, नक्षत्र, तारा, राहू आदि के गतिविधियों पर सूक्ष्म विवरण प्रस्तुत करते है – सुर्यप्रज्ञप्ति सूत्र भी एक ऐसा ही आगम है | इसकी विशेषता बताते हुवे Dr. Winternitz कहते है , जैन दर्शन के सुर्यप्रज्ञप्ति सूत्र और चन्द्रप्रज्ञप्ति सूत्र वैज्ञानिक ग्रन्थ है | अन्य पाश्चात्य विचारकों ने भी इन ग्रंथों को गणित एवं ज्योतिष विज्ञान की दृष्टी से महत्वपूर्ण माना है | इस शोध लेख में हम जैन दर्शन की सूर्य सम्बन्धी कुछ विशेष विषयों को लेकर क्या मान्यताये है तथा इन्हें लेकर आधुनिक ज्योतिष विज्ञान के क्या सिद्धांत है इनका तुलनात्मक अध्ययन करेंगे | Keywords – सूर्य प्रज्ञप्ति आगम, आधुनिक खगोलशात्र, तुलना, जैन खगोलशात्र

column4: THE MAHARAJA SAYAJIRAO UNIVERSITY OF BARODA
column11: Critical Evaluation of Sabhabhushan Ragamala: a Manuscript on Indian Music
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
Critical Evaluation of Sabhabhushan Ragamala: a Manuscript on Indian Music

Abstract:

Introduction:
Ragamala is an interesting topic to venture for a scholar or student of Sanskrit and Music. The picturesque depiction of various Ragas and Raginis of Indian Music is breath taking and arousing interest in this field. We find the works on Ragamala from art history point of view; however musicological aspect is what piques my interest. Following the lines of Ragamala paintings and the Ragamala texts written in Sanskrit by scholars of Sanskrit and Music, the present Manuscript on another Ragamala is titled as: ‘Sabhabhushan Ragamala’ authored by Gangaram found in the library of Oriental Institute of the Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara, Gujarat.
The present paper will focus on various Ragamala texts and the contribution of Sabhabhushan Ragamala to the fields of Sanskrit and Indian Music. It will present a detailed comparative and critical study of Ragamalas in general and Sabhabhushan Ragamala, in particular.

Key words: Ragamala, Sabhabhushan Ragamala, Gangaram

column11: महाराष्ट्र का प्राचीन मंदिर संगीत- दत्तोपासना में संत सर्वज्ञ दासोपंतस्वामी की संगीत साधना
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13:
‘महाराष्ट्र का प्राचीन मंदिर संगीत- दत्तोपासना में संत सर्वज्ञ दासोपंतस्वामी की संगीत साधना’


 भारतीय संस्कृति का आधार अध्यात्म है। अध्यात्म आत्मा का आनंद है। परमानंद का यह स्तर चित्रकला,  साहित्य ,संगीत की ललित कलाओं के माध्यम से आत्म-साक्षात्कार के माध्यम से प्राप्त किया जा सकता है। 
श्री निःशंक शारंगदेव द्वारा रचित ‘संगीत रत्नाकर’ के प्रथम अध्याय में भगवान को प्रिय संगीत वाद्य का उद्देश्य स्पष्ट है।
 आचार्य भरत मुनी के अनुसार गंधर्व  संगीत देवताओं  का सबसे प्रिय संगीत हैं। आचार्य मतंग के अनुसार, मार्ग संगीत और देसी संगीत वास्तव में भगवान महादेव के मुख से उत्पन्न हुआ था। मार्ग संगीत या गंधर्व संगीत का मुख्य उद्देश्य मोक्ष माना जाता है।
गंधर्व संगीत या मार्गी संगीत का प्रचार ऋषि-मुनियों, ऋषि-मुनियों द्वारा, आगे संगीताचार्यों द्वारा साधना, उपासना के माध्यम से किया गया। मध्य युग में लगभग सभी संतों, संप्रदायों ने संगीत के माध्यम से ईश्वर की भक्ति का मार्ग चुना।  महाराष्ट्र में संगीत परंपरा की स्थापना ग्यारहवीं शताब्दी से होती है, उससे पहले भी कोई परंपरा रही होगी, लेकिन इसका कोई लिखित प्रमाण उपलब्ध नहीं है। मराठी में संत साहित्य आरंभिक कवि मुकुंदनाथ से लेकर आज भी उपलब्ध है, दसवीं

column11: Poetry and Poetics- Vamana's observations
column13:
Poetry and Poetics- Vamana's observations

 Vamana, the 9th century Sanskrit rhetorician was the first to seek the soul of poetry. He is the proponent of Riti school in Poetics and  was the first to make clear distinction between gunas and alankaras.

 The paper ' Poetry and Poetics -Vamana's observations ' examines the systematic approach and live discussions of Vamana on poetry in  kavyalankarasutra vrtti.   Vamana 's way of expression is poetic in nature . The theory of Riti and the distinction between Guna and alankara ,supports this view .

This paper subjects the striking observations of Vamana on poetry ,cause of poetry and types of poetry, Riti, gunas and Alankaras.

The present  study demands the re-reading of the text. The references of particular regions like Vidarbha , Panchala and Gauda opens up more possibilities of research in poetic styles.

column11: Understanding the Cultural landscape of Gunj-Kati in the Archaeological Context
column13:
This paper aims to probe into the intricate cultural heritage of the Gunj-Kati region by conducting a comprehensive examination of seven temples identified within the area, with particular emphasis on the four temples located in Gunj/Gunj-Kati. The research seeks to uncover and establish the cultural antiquity of the village of Gunj-Kati, taking into account the complex and multifaceted cultural landscape that has shaped the region over time. The temples in this area present an intriguing yet challenging subject of study, largely due to the dilapidated condition of the ruins, which makes it difficult to discern their original structure and the cultural significance they once held.

A central theme of this research is understanding the dynamic interaction and interdependence between the local population and their places of worship across different historical time frames. The site of Gunj-Kati is comparable to a layered cake, each layer representing a distinct period of cultural materials that must be carefully disentangled and analysed to comprehend the region's

column4: GOVT. ARTS COLLEGE SAGBARA, DIST. NARMADA (GUJARAT)
column11: A NEW AGE SANSKRIT NOVEL “HEMASHAKATIKAM”
column13:
A NEW AGE SANSKRIT NOVEL “HEMASHAKATIKAM”

‘Hemashakatikam’ the title of the novel itself gives idea about its source to readers. Because Shudraka’s Mrichchhakatikam is not unknown to the readers of Sanskrit literature, Novelist Dr. Vishwas himself declares in the preface of this book about its connection with ‘Mrichchhakatikam’. This novel contains 144 pages and it’s published by Sanskrit bharati, New Delhi in the year 2011. Dr. Vishwas, author of this novel, is a Banglore, Karnataka based well-known Sanskrit scholar and he is also one of the editors of famous Sanskrit magazine ‘Sambhashan-sandesh’. From ages we have seen that Sanskrit literature revolves around the background of kings, kingships and kingdoms. But here the novelist chose totally different background for this novel i.e. Film and Television industry, which is never seen before by Sanskrit readers. Dr. Vishvas has tried to introducing innovative idea into Sanskrit literature and in true sense tried to make it modern in terms of its theme which is contemporary and interesting for modern readers.

column4: Department of Archaeology, CEMS, University of Mumbai
column11: Poster - Antiquities recovered from Ulhas River Basin at Ulhas: Museum and Research Centre, Titwala
column13:
The Ulhas River basin presents a vibrant picture in our understanding of the region it flows and the history it carries. The river has been a testament to many dynasties from the Mauryas to the Shilaharas, and Marathas to the Portuguese and British. This region has been the centre of power struggle and subsequent wars and cultural confluence. 
The river has become one of the major sources for our understanding of historical archaeology and the cultural continuity that flourished in the Salsette islands before becoming the metropolitan city now we know as Mumbai. For Example, historically significant port towns of Kalyan, Sopara, Kondane Caves, Lonad Caves, and Shiva Temple, etc. 
Antiquities such as Sculptures Fragments and Sculptures of various eras and dynasties are found across the Ulhas basin. Ashwamedh Pratisthan along with the INTACH Thane Chapter has collected and organized the biological and archaeological finds of the Ulhas River Basin, under the at Ulhas: Museum and Research Centre, Titwala.

column4: Centre for Incubation Innovation Research Centre.
column11: Descriptive Cataloguing and Conservation of Printed Paper Manuscript-Harivamsha
column13:
Descriptive Cataloguing and Conservation of Printed Paper Manuscript:Harivamsha
Manjula1, PadmashreeAnand1, Prabhuswamy S2
1Ancient Indian Sciences Lab, Centre for IncubationInnovation Research and Consultancy,Bangalore.
2Department of Manuscriptology, Karnataka Samskrit University, Bangalore.
padmashree.a@ciirc.jyothyit.ac.in

Abstract:
Paper has been the substratum for writing and recording information from many centuries. Like any other organic material, paper is also prone to deterioration. Both handmade and machine-made paper may need timely interventions to extend their life. Conservation of paper manuscripts can be preventive, curative, restorative, or a combination of all. Conservation treatment is planned depending on the composition of the paper, quality of production, and degradation due to environmental condition

column4: MIT WPU and Deccan College, Pune
column11: Why and How ‘Puruṣaviśeṣa’ according to Yogasūtra
column13:
Why and How ‘Puruṣaviśeṣa’ according to Yogasūtra 
Philosophy is the study of the real nature of Jīva (soul), Jagat (Universe) and the need for Jagadishvar (master of this Universe) also said to be Iśvara . Most of the times there is special  curiosity to know about Jagatah- Iśvara, because Iśvara is beyond the Jagat. Experience of Iśvara is beyond the human intellect. According to this specialty (viśeṣatva) of Iśvara, Yogśāstra  particularly attributes ‘Puruṣaviśeṣa’ to Iśvara. Hence, the research question is, why and how  Iśvara is ‘Puruṣaviśeṣa’? ‘Puruṣa’ is concept of Sankhya. Here, specifically I would like to know,  according to yogashatra, what kind of viśeṣatva is attributed to Puruṣa which makes it Iśvara. Specifically, yogasūtra of Patanjali because, yogasūtra gives clear dimensions of form of ‘Puruṣaviśeṣa Iśvara’ from sutra 1.23 to 1.29 in Samadhipad. Yogasūtra defines Iśvara as 
क्लेशकर्मविपाकाशयैरपरार्ष्टृ : पुरुषविशेष ईश्वरः ।। १.२४।। 
In Puruṣaviśeṣatva form and qualities of Iśvara are reflected. Therefore, in this paper I will study  this viśeṣatva of Puruṣa with

column11: श्वेताश्वतरोपनिषदि सृष्टितत्त्वस्वरूपविमर्शः
column13:
सारांशः 
प्राचीनकालादेव ऋषयो मुनयश्च सृष्टिप्रक्रियायाः अन्वेषणं कृतवन्तः। साधारणतः मनुष्याणां मध्ये सृष्टिप्रक्रियायाः भावना अपगता। बहवो मुनयः स्व-मतानि विषयेऽस्मिन् उक्तवन्तः। प्राचीनकाले अष्टसहस्रम् उपनिषदः सन्ति। सम्प्रतिकाले एकादश उपनिषद् प्राप्नोन्ति। तेषु उपनिषद्सु श्वेताश्वतरोपनिषदि सृष्टिप्रक्रिया भिन्ना वर्तते। अस्याम् उपनिषदि  मायाया आलोचना अधिका आसीत्। सामान्यदृष्ट्या मनुष्याणां समीपे विषयेऽस्मनि् कष्टसाध्यं मन्यन्ते। परन्तु मया शोधपत्रे माया-उपायेन कथं सृष्टिः भवति? सा वर्ण्यते। यद्यपि शंकराचार्येण माया स्वीक्रियते तथापि भिन्य-दार्शनिकाणां मध्ये मतानैक्यं दृश्यते।

column11: Ahimsa in Crisis: Can Non-Violence Bring Peace to a Violent Postmodern World?
column13: This article explores the relevance of Jain Ahimsa and Mahatma Gandhi's philosophy of non-violence in addressing contemporary issues of violence and injustice. In the modern world, where conflicts, wars, and systemic oppression persist, Ahimsa provides a framework that transcends mere non-violence in action and extends to thoughts, words, and intentions. By examining the ethical underpinnings of Jainism and Gandhi's Satyagraha, the article demonstrates how these principles can be applied to current crises, including global conflicts, environmental degradation, and social inequality. Gandhi’s approach, which involved empathy, inner peace, self-discipline, and non-violent resistance, offers a transformative method for resolving conflict and creating lasting peace. Additionally, the article addresses how Gandhi's methods, such as non-violent protests, economic boycotts, and community mobilization, remain powerful tools for combating oppression and promoting justice. Through this discussion, the article emphasizes the enduring relevance of non-violence as a strategy for overcoming...

column11: Ancient Wisdom in Post-modern Wellness: The Influence of Atharvaveda Medicine
column13: The Atharvaveda, one of the four sacred Vedas, holds profound insights into the ancient Indian medical practices that have continued relevance in addressing modern health challenges. This article explores the role of Atharvaveda in the evolution of Ayurveda and its approach to medicine, focusing on the holistic understanding of health and disease. The Atharvaveda not only discusses the anatomical and physiological aspects of the human body but also emphasizes the interconnectedness of mind, body, and cosmic forces. The Vedic recognition of diseases, ranging from hereditary conditions to infectious diseases like tuberculosis, resonates with post-modern medical challenges such as diabetes, mental health disorders, and pandemics like COVID-19. The use of herbs like Kuṣṭha, Punarṇavā, and Maṇḍūkī demonstrates the enduring relevance of plant-based treatments, while the Vedic emphasis on balance between the tridoshas (Vata, Pitta, and Kapha) mirrors modern lifestyle-related diseases. This paper seeks to bridge ancient wisdom with contemporary wellness by growing field of integrative...

column8: Post Graduate in Sanskrit (Jawaharlal Nehru University) . Graduate in Sanskrit (Hindu College Delhi University)
column11: Artificial Intelligence and Consciousness: A Comparative Study of Jñāna in Vedanta Philosophy and Modern AI
column13: This paper explores the concept of consciousness and knowledge by comparing the jñāna (self- realization) of Indian philosophy, particularly Advaita Vedanta, with the knowledge generated by Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in modern science. Indian philosophical traditions define jñāna as the direct realization of the Self (Ātman), which is identical to the universal consciousness (Brahman). This knowledge is not merely intellectual but experiential, and transformative, and leads to mokṣa (spiritual liberation). In contrast, AI operates on data processing, machine learning, and algorithms, replicating aspects of human intelligence but without self-awareness or subjective experience. The paper further explores the ethical implications of AI consciousness, drawing on Indian principles such as ahimsa (non-violence) and dharma (righteous duty). Should AI entities develop even a minimal form of awareness, Indian ethical frameworks might necessitate a reevaluation of how AI is treated.

column11: गीतायां दैवीयसम्पदः समीक्षात्मकं विवेचनम्
column13:
श्रीमद्‌भगवद्गीता भारतीयदर्शनस्य एकः प्रमुखो ग्रन्थोऽस्ति, यत्र योगेश्वरश्रीकृष्णचन्द्रस्य उपदेशो मानवजीवनस्य  समग्रसमस्यासु सामाधानं प्रदानं करोति । गीतायां धर्मस्य कर्मण: योगस्य भक्ते: मोक्षस्य च विवेचनमतिशोभनतया दृश्यते। गीताया: षोडशोऽध्यायः 'दैवासुरसम्पद्‌विभागयोगः' नामको वर्तते, यत्र देवीयगुणाः तथा चासुरीयगुणा व्यक्तिनां जीवनमार्गे कथं प्रभवतीति स्पष्टीकृ‌त: ।

अस्मिन् लेखे गीताया: दैवीयगुणानां स्वरूपं द्रष्टुम् शक्नुमः।

'दैवीयसम्पद्' शब्दो गीताया: षोडशोऽध्यायस्य मुख्यविषयोऽस्ति । दैवीयसम्पदः ता गुणाः सूचयति या मनुष्यं धर्ममार्गे स्थापनं कुर्वन्ति, तथा च तं मोक्षमार्गे नेतुमग्रे समर्थाः भवन्ति । दैवीयगुणाः जीवनस्य शान्तिपूर्णं, धर्मयुक्तं तथा चाध्यात्मिकं स्वरूपं स्थापनायोपयोगीर्भवन्ति । तस्य विपरीतमासुरीसम्पदस्तु अधर्मः, अहकारः, क्रोधः, तामसीवृत्तीनां च प्रतिफलमस्ति ।                                          

 	गीतया दैवीयसम्पदं मोक्षस्य मार्गे परमप्रयोजकं साधनरूपेण प्रस्तुयते । श्रीकृष्ण : अर्जुनं ब्रुवन्ति यत् दैवीयसम्पदः धारणीयाः यः जीवनस्य साफल्ये प्रमुखं कारकमस्ति ।

अभयं सत्वसंशुद्धिज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः ।। 
दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ।।१।।

column11: गीतायां दैवीयसम्पदः समीक्षात्मकं विवेचनम्
column13:
श्रीमद्‌भगवद्गीता भारतीयदर्शनस्य एकः प्रमुखो ग्रन्थोऽस्ति, यत्र योगेश्वरश्रीकृष्णचन्द्रस्य उपदेशो मानवजीवनस्य  समग्रसमस्यासु सामाधानं प्रदानं करोति । गीतायां धर्मस्य कर्मण: योगस्य भक्ते: मोक्षस्य च विवेचनमतिशोभनतया दृश्यते। गीताया: षोडशोऽध्यायः 'दैवासुरसम्पद्‌विभागयोगः' नामको वर्तते, यत्र देवीयगुणाः तथा चासुरीयगुणा व्यक्तिनां जीवनमार्गे कथं प्रभवतीति स्पष्टीकृ‌त: ।

अस्मिन् लेखे गीताया: दैवीयगुणानां स्वरूपं द्रष्टुम् शक्नुमः।

'दैवीयसम्पद्' शब्दो गीताया: षोडशोऽध्यायस्य मुख्यविषयोऽस्ति । दैवीयसम्पदः ता गुणाः सूचयति या मनुष्यं धर्ममार्गे स्थापनं कुर्वन्ति, तथा च तं मोक्षमार्गे नेतुमग्रे समर्थाः भवन्ति । दैवीयगुणाः जीवनस्य शान्तिपूर्णं, धर्मयुक्तं तथा चाध्यात्मिकं स्वरूपं स्थापनायोपयोगीर्भवन्ति । तस्य विपरीतमासुरीसम्पदस्तु अधर्मः, अहकारः, क्रोधः, तामसीवृत्तीनां च प्रतिफलमस्ति ।                                          

 	गीतया दैवीयसम्पदं मोक्षस्य मार्गे परमप्रयोजकं साधनरूपेण प्रस्तुयते । श्रीकृष्ण : अर्जुनं ब्रुवन्ति यत् दैवीयसम्पदः धारणीयाः यः जीवनस्य साफल्ये प्रमुखं कारकमस्ति ।

अभयं सत्वसंशुद्धिज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः ।। 
दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ।।१।।

column11: जीवन जीने की कला शास्त्रों के अनुसार एक विवेचनात्मक अध्ययन
column13:
जीवन जीने की कला शास्त्रों में एक महत्वपूर्ण स्थान रखती है, और इसे समझने के लिए विभिन्न शास्त्रों में गहन विवेचन मिलता है। प्राचीन भारतीय शास्त्रों में जीवन को जीने के सही तरीके पर मार्गदर्शन देने वाले कई महत्वपूर्ण सिद्धांत मिलते हैं, जिनमें से वेद, उपनिषद, भगवद्गीता, योगसूत्र, और धर्मशास्त्र मुख्य हैं।
वेदों के अनुसार, जीवन चार पुरुषार्थों—धर्म, अर्थ, काम, और मोक्ष—के आधार पर संचालित होना चाहिए। इनमें से धर्म को प्रमुखता दी गई है, क्योंकि धर्म व्यक्ति को सही और गलत का बोध कराता है। धर्म पालन करने से जीवन में नैतिकता और सदाचार का विकास होता है, जो व्यक्ति को सही जीवन जीने की दिशा में अग्रसर करता है। अर्थ और काम, जीवन की भौतिक आवश्यकताओं को पूरा करने के साधन हैं, लेकिन इन्हें धर्म के अनुसार नियंत्रित किया जाना चाहिए। मोक्ष, अंतिम पुरुषार्थ, जीवन का सर्वोच्च लक्ष्य है, जो आत्मा की मुक्ति और परमात्मा से एकत्व की स्थिति है।
उपनिषद आत्मज्ञान और जीवन के गूढ़ रहस्यों पर ध्यान केंद्रित करते हैं। इसमें बताया गया है कि सत्य, प्रेम, और अहिंसा का पालन करते हुए आत्मा के साथ एकात्मता प्राप्त की जा सकती है।

column11: Navadha Bhakti and Bhakti Mahatwam in Narayaneeyam
column13:
Abstract : Navadha bhakti is the type of Bhakti given 
by Prahlada in Srimad Bhagavathapuranam. In his opinion bhakti is of 9 types. 
Narayaneeyam is a famous devotional and religious book written by 
Narayanabhatta. 
We can see various instances of navadha bhakti in Narayaneeyam 
In Sravanam Keertanam and all the other types of bhakti we cam exemplify 
Narayana Bhattapada himself and his own book and instances described there. 
Narayana bhattapada surrenders himself completely to Lord Vishnu, seeking 
liberation and union.
Analyzing Narayaneeya through Navadha Bhakti can provide valuable insights 
into the nature of devotion and the poet's spiritual journey.

column4: GOVT. ARTS COLLEGE SAGBARA, DIST. NARMADA (GUJARAT)
column11: A NEW AGE SANSKRIT NOVEL “HEMASHAKATIKAM”
column13:
A NEW AGE SANSKRIT NOVEL “HEMASHAKATIKAM”
‘Hemashakatikam’ the title of the novel itself gives idea about its source to readers. Because Shudraka’s Mrichchhakatikam is not unknown to the readers of Sanskrit literature, Novelist Dr. Vishwas himself declares in the preface of this book about its connection with ‘Mrichchhakatikam’. This novel contains 144 pages, and it’s published by Sanskrit bharati, New Delhi in the year 2011. Dr. Vishwas, author of this novel, is a Banglore, Karnataka based well-known Sanskrit scholar, and he is also one of the editors of famous Sanskrit magazine ‘Sambhashan-sandesh’. From ages we have seen that Sanskrit literature revolves around the background of kings, kingships and kingdoms. But here the novelist chose totally different background for this novel i.e. Film and Television industry, which is never seen before by Sanskrit readers. Dr. Vishvas has tried to introduce innovative idea into Sanskrit literature and in true sense tried to make it modern in terms of its theme which is contemporary and interesting for modern readers.

column11: संस्कृतक्षेत्रे अनुकूलनाधिगमप्रणाल्यां नवमाध्यमानुप्रयोगाः
column13: अनुकूलनाधिगमः एकः शैक्षिकोपायः वर्तते यत्र प्रौद्योगिक्याः उपयोगेन वैयक्तिकरूपेण अनुरूपनिर्देशनेन च छात्राणां आवश्यकतानां पूर्तिः कल्पयति। अनेन अनुकूलनाधिगमशैक्षिकप्रणाल्या पठनसामग्रीं, अध्यापनगतिं च वास्तविकसमये समायोजयति। येन प्रत्येकं शिक्षकाः वैयक्तिकमनुभवं प्राप्नोति इति सुनिश्चितमेव। यत्र छात्राणां सर्वाधिकसमर्थनस्य आवश्यकता भवति तत्र प्राधान्येन केन्द्रीकरणं कृत्वा ग्रहणविषयाणां प्रविधिमाध्यमेन प्रस्तुतिः भवति। फलतः अनुकूलनाधिगमप्रसङ्गे अधिकम् अनुकूलितं प्रतिक्रियाशीलयुक्तं व शिक्षणवातावरणं प्रदातुं शैक्षिकप्रभावशीलतां कार्यक्षमतां च वर्धयितुं क्षमता वर्तते। वर्तमानकाले नवमाध्यमः शैक्षिकक्षेत्रे उत्तरोत्तरप्रगतये नवभूमिकां निर्वहति। विशेषतः अनुकूलनाधिगमे (Adaptive Learning) प्रविधीनां माध्यमानां च विविधता अनुकूलितशैक्षणिकपरिष्कारार्थं सहायतां समर्पयन्ति। एषः प्रविधिः अनुकूलनाधिकारप्रणालीषु नवप्रारूपं जनयति। अधिगमसफलतां च प्रददाति। नवमाध्यमाः यथा डिजिटलप्लेटफार्म, सामाजिकमाध्यमाः, तथा मोबइल अनुप्रयोगसाधनानि च शिक्षायाः द्रुतविकासार्थं प्रेरयन्ति। एतेषां माध्यमानां प्रयोगः छात्राणां शिक्षणपरिस्थितेः परिष्कारार्थं, शिक्षायाः प्रयोजनानुसारं सामग्रीसम्पादनार्थं च उपकरोति । अनुकूलना

प्रतिसमाजं लिखितमलिखितं  वा स्वानुकूलप्रकृतिकं साहित्यं तु भवत्येव किन्तु पूर्वमेवापरापेक्षया प्रभावि भवति  स्थायिप्रकृतिकत्वाल्लिपिबद्धतया । अपरञ्च , अलिखितमपि साहित्यं कालान्तरे लिपिबद्धं भवत्येव । 

संप्रति उपलब्धेषु सर्वेष्वपि साहित्येषु संस्कृतसाहित्यं प्राचीनतमं परिष्कृतञ्च दृश्यते । संस्कृतसाहित्यस्य वेदा: खलु मानवज्ञा

column4: Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady
column11: RESEMBLANCES IN PREMODERN PRAKRIT AND MALAYALAM: AN ANALYSIS
column13:
Abstract
This study examines the linkage between Malayalam and Prakrit literature in Kerala.  Malayalam, being a Dravidian language with a strong Sanskritized register, is often believed to have been impacted and stimulated by Sanskrit or Tamil poetry, syntax, and literature. But this essay draws attention to a topic that is rarely explored: the influence of Prakrit on Malayalam thought and literature. The emic word Maṇipravāḷam, which translates to "gems and corals," unites Sanskrit with the native tongue of Kerala in a significant portion of the state's premodern vernacular literature. Prakrit and Malayalam are related in two interconnected ways: first, by analysing the practices' commonalities, particularly with regard to themes and aesthetics; and second, by looking at the tacit ways that Maṇipravāḷam theory, as it. In this work, we have tried to demonstrate that there is sufficient evidence to infer that, during the periods of Maṇipravālam theory's consolidation, Prakrit literature and Sanskrit debates of it existed as an important model.

column11: लौकिकन्यायः
column13: लोकसंज्ञकैः सह सम्बन्धित-साहित्यं लोकसाहित्यमित्यभिधीयते ।साहित्यं द्विधा विभक्तुं शक्यते। तत्र प्रथमं सुसंस्कृत-सुशिक्षितैः रचितम् । तत् शिष्टसाहित्यमिति ब्रूमः, यस्य नियमानुसृता घटना वर्तते ।द्वितीयं तु असंस्कृत-अशिक्षितानां जनसामान्यानां साहित्यम्। यत्तु मौखिकरूपेण बहुकालात् समाजे विद्यते, यस्य परम्परा अतिपुरातना वर्तते । यत् समाजे अथवा लोके सर्वत्र परिलसति । अस्यैव लोकसाहित्यमिति संज्ञा । लौकिकाश्च ते न्यायाश्च  लौकिकन्यायाः। लोकसाहित्यान्तर्भूतस्य लोकोक्तेः एकः प्रकारः अयम् । लौकिकं व्यवहारमधिकृत्य  प्रवर्तिताः, लौकिकस्य अनुभवस्य वाचकाः, किं वा कथायाः कस्याश्चित् घटनायाः प्रसङ्गे आगतानि वाक्यानि च लौकिकन्यायसंज्ञयाभिधीयन्ते ।यथा शास्त्रेषु अल्पाक्षराणि सूत्राणि बृहत्तत्वानि बोधयन्ति, यथा तेषु अर्थावबोधकसामर्थ्यं विद्यते तथा न्यायाः अल्पाक्षराः सन्तः चेदपि विशालं तत्वं वहन्ति । लौकिकन्यायाः अर्थप्राधान्याः। दैनन्दिनेजीवने सर्वेषां ये अनुभवाः भवन्ति तेषां सारं संगृह्य न्यायाः भावान् प्रकटयन्ति । लौकिकन्यायानां भावस्तु व्यङ्यः अस्ति । न्यायाः आप्तवचनानीत्यपि वक्तुं शक्नुमः। यथा सुभाषित-नीतिवाक्य-कथाभ्यःलोकजीवनस्य वैविध्यस्य एवं रसमयतायाश्च ज्ञानं भवति तथा लौकिकन्यायेभ्यो भवति ।

column11: Ragas and the Human Psyche
column12: Technical Science & Fine Arts & Sanskrit & Computer
column13: Rāgas are the life-force of Indian music. A rāga is so called because it tinges or colours the minds of all living-beings. Rāga, a component of music, is a unique set of selected notes. It provides immense creative potential for improvisation. A given rāga can have various effects. “Bhāva”, another component, is the emotion conveyed and is the essence which instils life to the rāga- scale. The object of a rāga is to express a certain emotional mood and sentiment without any reference to time and season. This paper shall deal with the psychic balance offered by rāgas to the human sensitivity and ability to handle deep emotions and stress that is prevalent in day-today life.

column11: Kam Shaktin aur Kundali Shakti Ka Sambandh
column13:
काम और कुंडलिनी महाशक्ति का सम्बन्ध -
कुंडलिनी महाशक्ति को 'काम-कला' कहा गया है। उसका वर्णन कतिपय स्थलों में ऐसा प्रतीत होता है, मानो यह कोई सामान्य काम सेवन की चर्चा की जा रही हो। कुंडलिनी का स्थान जननेंद्रिय मूल में रहने से भी, उसकी परिणति कामशक्ति के उभार के लिए प्रयुक्त होती प्रतीत होती है। इस तत्त्व को समझने के लिए, हमें अधिक गहराई में प्रवेश करना पड़ेगा और अधिक सूक्ष्मदृष्टि से देखना पड़ेगा। नर-नारी के बीच चलने वाली 'काम-क्रीड़ा और कुंडलिनी साधना में सन्निहित 'काम कला' में भारी अंतर है। मानवीय अंतराल में उभयलिंग विद्यमान है। हर व्यक्ति अपने आप में आधा नर और आधा नारी है। अर्ध नारी नटेश्वर भगवान् शंकर को चित्रित किया गया है। कृष्ण और राधा का भी ऐसा ही एक समन्वित रूप चित्रों में दृष्टिगोचर होता है। पति-पत्नी दो शरीर एक प्राण होते हैं। यह इस चित्रण का स्थूल वर्णन है। नारी लिंग का सूक्ष्म स्थल जननेंद्रिय मूल है। इसे 'योनि' कहते हैं। मस्तिष्क का मध्य बिंदु ब्रह्मरंध्र- लिंग' है। इसका प्रतीक- प्रतिनिधि सुमेरु - मूलाधार चक्र के योनिगद्दर में ही काम बीज के रूप में अवस्थित है।

column11: INFLUENCE OF DARSHANAS ON INDIAN CULTURE: A PERSPECTIVE OF POORNAVAD
column13:
Influence of Darshans on Indian Culture: A Perspective of Poornavad 
The present Indian Culture & Tradition is an outcome of the perennial tradition of Ancient Indian Thought that has the roots of it’s resent form. The objective of this paper is to probe into the impact of Darshans on Indian culture and the need of Poornavad for reaching an integrated harmony for a better assimilation of different parts of Indian culture & tradition. 
	This Study is limited to examination of the impact of Samkhya, Yoga and Vedant on the varied aspects of Indian culture and the perspectives of Poornavad as envisaged by Dr. Ramchandra Parnerkar in his doctoral thesis ‘Poornavad’. The hypothesis of this paper is that the Visions of Poornavad can be helpful in eradicating the negative aspects of the influence of Samkhya; Yoga & Vedant on present Indian Culture & Visions of the public at large.

column11: संस्कृतसाहित्ये टीकाकारमल्लिनाथवैदुष्यम्
column13:
संस्कृतवाङ्मये काव्यमहाकाव्ययोः धारा सुप्राचीना । आदिकविवाल्मीकेः आरभ्य अद्यावधि तस्य धारा प्रवहन्ती विद्यते । गद्यं यथा कवीनां कवित्वपरीक्षायाः आधारभूतं तद्वदेव काव्योत्कर्षजननाय तथा काव्यस्य लोकप्रसिद्धेर्जननाय टीकायाः महती भूमिका अस्तीति विद्वद्भिः मन्यते। संस्कृतवाङ्मयम् अपारम् एवं च समृद्धं वर्तते । विविधशास्त्रे विविधटीकाकारः वर्तते । तद्वत् साहित्यशास्त्रे तथा काव्यशास्त्रे वहुटीकाकाराः विराजिताः। तन्मध्ये कोलाचलमल्लिनाथसूरिः अन्यतमः प्रतिभाति । नैकेषु काव्येषु सः टीकाः विरचितवान्, प्रभूतकाव्योपरि तस्य टीका दरीदृश्यते । यथा कालिदासस्य रघुवंशकुमारसम्भवमेघदूतेत्यादिकाव्योपरि सञ्जीवनीनाम्ना तथा भारविकृतकिरातार्जुनीयमहाकाव्योपरि घण्टापथटीकां विरचितवान् । माघकृतशिशुपालवधमहाकाव्ये सर्वाङ्कषाटीकां तथा श्रीहर्षकृतनैषधचरितमहाकाव्ये जीवातुटीकां विरचितवान्।
मल्लिनाथः न केवलं काव्यानां टीकाकारः, अपि तु स्वयं कविरप्यीसीत्।

column11: Addressing Mental Health Challenges in the LGBTQ+ Community: A Review of Research Gaps and the Role of Yoga as an Intervention
column13: This review paper examines the mental health challenges faced by the LGBTQ+ community and the potential benefits of yoga as an intervention. Leveraging the extant body of scholarly work, the review elucidates significant themes including the widespread occurrence of stress, anxiety, depression, and suicidal ideation within the LGBTQ+ population. It explores how minority stress, discrimination, and societal stigma contribute to these mental health issues. The paper further discusses how yoga may serve as a holistic approach to alleviate psychological distress, enhance emotional resilience & promote overall well-being within this marginalized population. Notwithstanding the encouraging results, considerable deficiencies in research persist, especially concerning the varied experiences of LGBTQ+ individuals hailing from distinct racial and ethnic backgrounds. Future research directions are suggested to address these gaps, emphasizing the need for inclusive methodologies and exploring culturally relevant practices.

column13:

column11: संस्कृतशिक्षकशिक्षाया:पाठ्यक्रमनिर्माणस्यैक: विमर्श:।
column13: लोके सर्वेषु अपि स्तरेषु पाठ्यक्रम एव छात्रस्य स्तरं शिक्षाया:गुणवत्तां शैक्षिकस्वरूपं सामाजिकपरिवर्तनं सामाजिकापेक्षां च सूचयति तथैव निर्धारयति। तत्रापि च विशेषेण एकविंशतिशतके विज्ञानस्य तन्त्रज्ञानस्य विस्फ़ोट: सर्वेषु क्षेत्रेषु जात: जायमानश्च अस्ति।एतादृशेऽस्मिन् सन्दर्भे समाजनिर्मातॄणाम् अध्यापकानां शिक्षाया बहुमहत्वपूर्णं स्थानं वर्वर्ति। कृत्रिमबुद्धिमत्ताया: प्रयोगोपि सर्वत्र प्राधान्यमावहद्वर्तते।शिक्षक: समाजस्य निर्माता यथा भवति तथैव समाजपरिवर्तक: समाजपरिवाहक:संस्कृतेरुद्धारक:संस्कृतिवाहकश्च वर्तते। अत:अध्यापकशिक्षाया: पाठ्यक्रमे एकविंशतिशतकानुकूलांशा: तथैव परम्पराया: संस्कृतेश्च संरक्षकांशा:अनिवार्येण भवन्ति चेदेव सुरक्षितसमाजस्य निर्माणं भवितुमर्हति। अत: पाठ्यक्रम:कृत्रिमबुद्धिमत्तांशसमन्वित: तन्त्रांशज्ञानसमन्वित: संस्कृतिबोधकांशसमन्वितश्च भवेदिति २०२०राष्ट्रियनवशिक्षानीतिरपि अभिप्रैति।तथा हि २०२०- राष्ट्रियशिक्षानीते:चतुर्थाध्याये विद्यालयसम्बद्धं शिक्षाशास्त्रं कीदृशं भवेदित्युल्लेखसमये समग्राधिगमस्य एकीकृताधिगमस्य आनन्दाधिगमस्य रुचिपूर्णाधिगमस्य च प्राधान्यं प्रतिपादितं विद्यते। विद्यालये एतादृशमधिगमं सम्पादयितुं शिक्षक:तादृशकौशलपूर्ण: तादृशशिक्षाशास्त्राभिज्ञश्च तत्रा

column11: संस्कृताध्ययने सामाजिकमाध्यमानां योगदानम्
column13:
संस्कृताध्ययने सामाजिकमाध्यमानां योगदानम्

सामाजिकमाध्यमानां आगमनेन संस्कृतादिशास्त्रीयभाषाणाम् अध्ययनशैक्षणिकक्षेत्राणि गभीररूपेण प्रभावितानि जातानि। अस्मिन् पत्रे संस्कृतस्य शिक्षणे प्रसारे च सामाजिकमाध्यमानां प्रभावस्य अन्वेषणं कृतम् वर्तते, यत्र फेसबुक्, ट्विटर्, समर्पिताः अधितन्त्रिमञ्चाः इत्यादयः अस्याः प्राचीनभाषायाः संरक्षणे आधुनिकीकरणे च कथं योगदानं ददति इति प्रतिपाद्यते।  
सामाजिकमाध्यमाः आभासीयसमुदायस्य निर्माणस्य सुविधां ददति। यत्र उत्साहयुक्ताः विद्वांसः, शिक्षकाः च संसाधनानाम्  भाषावैज्ञानिकसूक्ष्मतानां च चर्चां कर्तुं, सहकारीशिक्षणे  संलग्नाः च भवितुमर्हन्ति । तदतिरिक्तरूपेण शिक्षणसामग्रीणां व्यापकवितरणं सक्षमं कुर्वन्ति वैज्ञानिकाः। यत्र संस्कृतसम्बद्धाः पाठ्यक्रमाः, अङ्कीयग्रन्थाः, अन्तरक्रियाशीलसाधनानि च सन्ति, तत्र संस्कृतस्य सुलभतां, आकर्षणं च वर्धयितुं प्रयत्नं कुर्वाणः पण्डिताः। परन्तु एतत् परिवर्तनं पारम्परिकशिक्षणपद्धतीनां सह एव अग्रे नेतव्यम्। आभासीय - अध्ययनस्य सकारात्मकनकारात्मकयोः प्रभावयोः विश्लेषणं तथा संस्कृताध्ययने सामाजिकमाध्यमानां योगदानम् चेत्याद्यवलोकनं पत्रे अस्मिन् अग्रे प्रस्तूयते।

column11: Vedic Women and Their Contribution for Human Society
column13:
Vedas are one of the oldest texts available to human society.  Vedas are a large number of compositions composed primarily in Sanskrit which mainly contribute to the improvement of human culture and are essential to the progress of mankind. These Vedas are four in number viz. Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva. Every Veda has its subdivisions, their divisions are Brahmanas, Samhitas, Aranyakas, and Samhitas. According to the history of India, these Vedas were seen by Rishis and composed, amongst them there were a few women Rishis who also composed some part of the Vedas and contributed upliftment of the  Vedic and human society. 
	According to the recent modern theory, women of the vedic times were said to have been considered as inferior to men and they were not given any privilege that the men used to enjoy, but the reality was the other way round. Accordingly Vedas allowed Women to present a liberal view and were also allowed to make decisions that benefited the human society. Women were treated equally to men and they were given equal opportunities to acquire adequate education.

column11: Sleep in contexts of karma and apavarga in the Śānti-parvan and Anuśāsana-parvan of the Mahābhārata
column13: In this preliminary literature study, references to sleep in the Śānti and Anuśāsana parvan-s of the Mahābhārata are collected and summarized from perspectives that are karma-oriented (i.e., dealing with prescribed codes of conduct related to sleep in human affairs and ritual contexts) and apavarga-oriented (i.e., dealing with mastery of sleep in the course of Yoga accomplishment). Digital searches were performed on the chosen parvan-s of the Mahābhārata from the Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL) to capture occurrence of sleep-related terms (e.g., Nidrā, Svāpa, Śayana). Verses yielded by these searches were then thematically examined for overall karma-orientation or apavarga-orientation.

column11: AESTHETIC BEAUTY IN MEGHASANDESHA OF KALIDASA
